Title: Is Firepower 9300 affected by improper handling of whitespace patterns - CVE-2016-8743
RNE: Symptom: This product includes Third-party Software that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2016-8743  Cisco has analyzed these vulnerabilities and concluded that the product is not impacted  Conditions: Not applicable  Workaround: Not applicable  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has evaluated this issue and does not meet the criteria for PSIRT ownership or involvement. This issue will be addressed via normal resolution channels.  If you believe that there is new information that would cause a change in the severity of this issue, please contact psirt@cisco.com for another evaluation.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: A flaw exists due to improper handling of whitespace patterns in user-agent headers. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can exploit this, via a specially crafted user-agent header, to cause the program to incorrectly process sequences of requests, resulting in interpreting responses incorrectly, polluting the cache, or disclosing the content from one request to a second downstream user-agent.It was discovered that the HTTP parser in httpd incorrectly allowed certain characters not permitted by the HTTP protocol specification to appear unencoded in HTTP request headers. If httpd was used in conjunction with a proxy or backend server that interpreted those characters differently, a remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to inject data into HTTP responses, resulting in proxy cache poisoning.(CVE-2016-8743)

Title: Sessmgr and Diamp mapping(s) get wrong after several SRP failovers
RNE: Symptom: Session manager instance mapping to diamproxy instance get changed,due to this diameter session id get changed for existing calls,due to this RAR trigger from PCRF fails and VoLTE call impact will be seen.  Conditions: Whenever ICSR switchover happens multiple times, within 1-2 minutes of that switchover, the Sessmgr-Diamporxy mappings get changed and internally diameter session id of existing subscriber get changed.  Workaround: No Workarounds, Need to clear existing IMS subscriber.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 2.6/2.2: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:U/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: When multiple SRP failovers occur in quick time(atleast 4 within 8 minutes) due to BGP failures, the sessmgr and diamproxy task original mappings get changed impacting the VoLTE bearer setup attempt from PCRF.Since PGW has now incorrect GX IMS session ID for the impacted subscriber, PGW rejects/fails the RAR from PCRF.Pl. see attached enclosures for subscriber with IMSI 311480202000017Originally the above subscriber is handled by sessmgr task #110, which communicates with diamproxy task #6.After several SRP failovers induced by BGP failures, it gets changed from diamproxy task #6 to diamproxy task #7.This causes the IMS GX session ID used by PGW to new session ID causing issues with PCRF.

Description: ISR4331 is crashing with following process stack:Software Version (Software Version) 03.16.03.SIOS Version (Version of the IOSd process running within IOS-XE) 155-3.S3Decoded Stack TraceTAC Case: 681961239 Attachment: SOPR1_RP_0_ucode_pkt_PPE0_2425_1489995554.core.gz      1. 0xf771a430 __kernel_vsyscall  2. 0xf7504ed5 __GI_raise ---> ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:64  3. 0xf75066e1 __GI_abort ---> abort.c:88  4. 0x80d0ed7e <BE> hal_abort ---> /auto/mcpbuilds14/release/03.16.03.S/BLD-V03_16_03_S_FC1/cpp/dp/hardware/emu/hw-posix/posix-i686/posix_abort.c:34  5. 0x80a2c3b3 <BE> pa_remove. ---> /auto/mcpbuilds14/release/03.16.03.S/BLD-V03_16_03_S_FC1/cpp/dp/infra/logger.h:212  6. 0x808a63f8 <BE> vtcp_copy_from_tx ---> /auto/mcpbuilds14/release/03.16.03.S/BLD-V03_16_03_S_FC1/cpp/dp/dplane/feature/threat_defense/vtcp/vtcp_parser.c:844  7. 0x808a5bad <BE> vtcp_tx_invoke. ---> /auto/mcpbuilds14/release/03.16.03.S/BLD-V03_16_03_S_FC1/cpp/dp/dplane/feature/threat_defense/vtcp/vtcp_parser.c:2483  8. 0x808a7670 <BE> td_egress_invoke ---> /auto/mcpbuilds14/release/03.16.03.S/BLD-V03_16_03_S_FC1/cpp/dp/dplane/feature/threat_defense/threat_defense_egress_invoke.c:29  9. 0xe742a4d8 ?? 10. 0x60707ee5 ?? 11. 0x00000000 ?? The only other occurrence of the same problem was investigated under:http://www-tac.cisco.com/Teams/ks/c3/casekwery.php?Case=680550271-> case was closed as no further issues were notedWe have already replaced router to exclude HW failure. Router keeps crashing after replacement.Crash is always happening due to RP_0_ucode_pkt_PPE1 or RP_0_ucode_pkt_PPE0 packet is almost never seen in the core file, when it is, it's not consistent.Example for cores with pointer to existing packet:https://foosball.cisco.com/apps/smartdecoder/history/150896https://foosball.cisco.com/apps/smartdecoder/history/150898

Title: ASA not sending all logging messages via TCP logging
RNE: Symptom:  If TCP syslogging is configured on the ASA, not all messages are sent to the syslog server.  Conditions: The issue is seen during heavy tcp syslogging.  Workaround: Use UDP syslogging instead of TCP syslogging.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5.0/4.5:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:W/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2011-0356 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Customer has an ASA5580-40 running 8.2(2)4 and if he configures the ASA to log TCP syslog,  e.g. 'logging host services 10.22.0.24 6/1470', he's notgetting all the log messages.  For example, they don't see any build orteardown messages such as 302103, 302103, 302105, and 302106.  If theyswitch to using UDP for the same server (logging host services 10.22.0.24),they see all the messages.   Also, they have an ASA 5550 running 8.0(5)9 andboth tcp and udp logging works fine for that ASA.Since the ASA 5580-40 is a heavily used firewall for the customer, it's possible that the issue is due to heavy tcp logging.

Title: ASA traceback with Thread Name: dhcp_daemon

Title: Cisco Anyconnect for Linux Privileges Escalation Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: On a Linux machine running Cisco Anyconnect Mobile Client is it possible to elevate privileges to the root user by loading binary from a non root directory  Conditions: This can be exploited only on Linux machine. MAC OS and Windows will not have this problem  Workaround: none  Further Problem Description: A vulnerability in the code of Cisco Anyconnect Mobility Client for Linux could allow an authenticated, local attacker to elevate privilges to the ones of the root user.  The vulnerability is due to improper implementation of some internal functions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by accessing the system and calling the vpnagent with some options. An exploit could allow the attacker to obtain privileged access to the system.  This vulnerability affects only Cisco Anyconnect Mobility Client for Linux.   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.8/5.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0761 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: I believe that a local privilege escalation vulnerability exists in the CiscoAnyConnect Secure Mobility Client 4.0.00048 on Linux. I have not been able totest with the very latest version (4.0.00061) as I do not have access to it, butI note that there is no advisory that appears to apply to this vulnerability andI cannot find any description of it in changelogs. I also have not been able totest with the Mac OS X client as I do not have a Mac.Details:After installation, /opt/cisco/anyconnect/bin/vpnagentd is a setuid root binary:$ ls -l /opt/cisco/anyconnect/bin/vpnagentd-rwsr-xr-x 1 root root 680379 Feb  4 19:55 /opt/cisco/anyconnect/bin/vpnagentdThere is an undocumented option, -verify_certs, that takes (at least) threeadditional options. When invoked as:./vpnagentd -verify_certs 1 1 1it sets the effective uid to that of the current user (excerpt from strace):setresuid(-1, 1000, -1)                 = 0and subsequently attempts to load libnssckbi.so from the Mozilla Firefox profilefolder (also from strace):open(;/home/gmarkall/.mozilla/firefox/kuy2t5i9.default/libnssckbi.so;, O_RDONLY|O_CLOEXEC) = -1 ENOENT (No such file or directory)Since this folder is controlled by the user, we can create a library with aninit function that sets the effective uid back to root and forks a shell.Then the resulting binary libnssckbi.so is copied to the Firefox profile folder(/home/gmarkall/.mozilla/firefox/kuy2t5i9.default in my particular case). Whenvpnagentd is invoked with the arguments stated earlier:$ ./vpnagentd -verify_certs 1 1 1Attempt to set euidSetresuid result = 0Attempt to launch shell$ whoamiroot$ iduid=1000(gmarkall) gid=1000(gmarkall) euid=0(root) groups=...

Title: Cisco FX-OS and NX-OS Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) implementation of Cisco Firepower Extensible Operating System (FXOS) and NX-OS System Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to reload.  The vulnerability occurs because AAA processes prevent the NX-OS System Manager from receiving keepalive messages when an affected device receives a high rate of login attempts, such as in a brute-force login attack. System memory can run low on the FXOS devices under the same conditions, which could cause the AAA process to unexpectedly restart or cause the device to reload.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by performing a brute-force login attack against a device that is configured with AAA security services. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause the affected device to reload.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171018-aaavty  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3883 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: UCS 6200 FI reset Ha Policy: Service : AAA Daemon Hap resetUCS-FI-6248UP-SUPUCSM Version: 2.27cCustomer does not have AAA configured but FI crashed due to this processShow logging nvram:2017 Jan 25 05:40:04 LandauUCSCluster-A %$ VDC-1 %$ %DAEMON-2-SYSTEM_MSG: request to AAA service timed out.Using local authentication for login service - sshd[19294]2017 Jan 25 05:40:04 LandauUCSCluster-A %$ VDC-1 %$ %DAEMON-2-SYSTEM_MSG: request to AAA service timed out.Using local authentication for login service - sshd[19295]2017 Jan 25 05:40:04 LandauUCSCluster-A %$ VDC-1 %$ %DAEMON-2-SYSTEM_MSG: request to AAA service timed out.Using local authentication for login service - sshd[19296]2017 Jan 25 05:40:09 LandauUCSCluster-A %$ VDC-1 %$ Jan 25 05:40:09 %KERN-2-SYSTEM_MSG: [110040.862618] [sap 111][pid 4522][comm:aaad] QFULL drop notify posted - kernel2017 Jan 25 05:40:09 LandauUCSCluster-A %$ VDC-1 %$ Jan 25 05:40:09 %KERN-2-SYSTEM_MSG: [110040.862631] [sap 111][pid 4522][comm:aaad] sap recovering failed and so Killed - kernel2017 Jan 25 05:40:09 LandauUCSCluster-A %$ VDC-1 %$ %SYSMGR-2-SERVICE_CRASHED: Service ;AAA Daemon; (PID 4522) hasn't caught signal 9 (no core).2017 Jan 25 05:40:09 LandauUCSCluster-A %$ VDC-1 %$ %DAEMON-2-SYSTEM_MSG: request to AAA service timed out.Using local authentication for login service - sshd[19353]2017 Jan 25 05:40:09 LandauUCSCluster-A %$ VDC-1 %$ %SYSMGR-2-HAP_FAILURE_SUP_RESET: System reset due to service ;AAA Daemon; in vdc 1 has had a hap failureFI output:`show system reset-reason`----- reset reason for Supervisor-module 1 (from Supervisor in slot 1) ---1) At 524676 usecs after Wed Jan 25 05:40:18 2017    Reason: Reset triggered due to HA policy of Reset    Service: AAA Daemon hap reset    Version: 5.2(3)N2(2.27c)Similar to CSCur97432, this defect is for 2nd gen FI

Title: Cisco Unified Intelligence Center unauthorized access vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the upgrade mechanism of Cisco collaboration products based on the Cisco Voice Operating System software platform could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to gain unauthorized, elevated access to an affected device.  The vulnerability occurs when a refresh upgrade or Prime Collaboration Deployment (PCD) migration is performed on an affected device. When a refresh upgrade or PCD migration is completed successfully, an engineering flag remains enabled and could allow root access to the device with a known password.  If the vulnerable device is subsequently upgraded using the standard upgrade method to an Engineering Special Release, service update, or a new major release of the affected product, this vulnerability is remediated by that action.  Note: Engineering Special Releases that are installed as COP files, as opposed to the standard upgrade method, do not remediate this vulnerability.  An attacker who can access an affected device over SFTP while it is in a vulnerable state could gain root access to the device. This access could allow the attacker to compromise the affected system completely.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.   This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-vos  Conditions: Devices running an affected Voice Operating System platform and have met the conditions to be vulnerable are affected.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 9.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: log_cookie function allows attackers DOS (CVE-2014-0098)
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco Unified Computing System manager includes a version of Apache that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2014-0098: The log_cookie function in mod_log_config.c in the mod_log_config module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and daemon crash) via a crafted cookie that is not properly handled during truncation. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 5.0 (AV:N/AC:L/AU:N/C:N/I:N/A:P)  Cisco has analyzed these vulnerabilities and concluded that the product is not impacted  Conditions: Not applicable  Workaround: Not applicable  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has evaluated this issue and does not meet the criteria for PSIRT ownership or involvement. This issue will be addressed via normal resolution channels.  If you believe that there is new information that would cause a change in the severity of this issue, please contact psirt@cisco.com for another evaluation.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco IOS XE Software for cBR-8 Routers Line Card Console Access Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: An issue in motherboard console ports of Cisco ASR1000 line cards and CBR8 line cards could allow an unauthenticated, physical attacker to gain access to the underlying operating system of the device.  The issue is due to an engineering console port being made available on the motherboard of the affected line cards. An attacker could exploit this issue by physically connecting to the console port on the line cards. An exploit could allow the attacker to gain full access to the underlying operation  system of the device.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability.  Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available.   This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170927-cc   This advisory is part of the September 27, 2017, release of the Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication, which includes 12 Cisco Security Advisories that describe 13 vulnerabilities. For a complete list of the advisories and links to them, see the '' Cisco Event Response: September 2017 Semiannual Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication'' which is available at  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-63410  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco devices that are running a vulnerable release of a Cisco IOS XE Software. See the published advisory for more  information.  Please see the Cisco IOS XE Software Checker tool for information on non-vulnerable, vulnerable and fixed releases. This tool is available at  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x  NOTE: Cisco IOS Software Checker checks for BOTH ASR1K and CBR8 fixes combined.  CBR8 Affected releases: * 3.16S Train. * 3.17S Train. * 3.18S Train. * 3.18SP Train. * Everest-16.5 Train.  First fixed in: Everest-16.5.2 Everest-16.6.1  Workaround: See published advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:P/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12239 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: This bug is opened to investigate the impact to CBR8 which may be similar to CSCvc65866 as documented on the ASR1K family.The CBR8 has a console connection on the motherboard of the LCs.  In production shipping images, is the console port on the mother board enabled?See CSCvc65866 for the fixes they did on the ASR1K.  We need to see if this fix is also applicable for the CBR8.So the questions would be:? Is it protected by a username/password (are they static)?? Is the console port active in shipping images, or only for dev builds.? From the console port can you access the other cards/processor in the box unauthenticated?? Can you jump to hosts outside of the CBR8.

Title: Sig6:client_bounce <- xtcp_client_timer_tick - egtpinmgr
RNE: $$IGNORE   Symptoms: A vulnerability in General Packet Radio Switching (GPRS) Evolved Tunneling Protocol  (eGTP) protocol of the Cisco Packet Data Network Gateway (PGW) could allow an  unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a partial denial of service (DoS) under  very heavy traffic load.  The vulnerability is due to lack of rate limiting of ingress eGTP packets. An attacker  could exploit this vulnerability by sending first having many subscribers attached and then sending a crafted stream of valid eGTP traffic at a very high rate. An exploit  could allow the attacker to cause a DoS of the eGTP process of the PGW which leads to a short DoS condition.   Conditions: The PGW has many active subscribers with a large amount of eGTP traffic is received.   This vulnerability exists in all previous releases until the first fixed release.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Title: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance HREF Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web-based management interface of an affected device.      The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of the interface to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the interface or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.      Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at:         https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoAppliedMitigationBulletin/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss         https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)      There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.     This advisory is available at the following link:     https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171004-asa1  Conditions: Device running with ''webvpn'' configured on an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. Description: Clientless href rewrite XSS vulnerabilityHTTP servers usually sanitizes the user input by escaping characters like: <,>,;This is especially important when the user input is reflected back to the HTML output. In that case the characters are converted to:&lt, &gt, Normally the ASA rewriter passes the &lt, &gt,  characters in as-is form, which is expected. However, when these characters are reflected in href HTML attribute (passed back to the user in a link), they are converted back to the <,>,; which leads to a risk of XSS attack. Webpages that are properly protected against XSS attack lose the protection partially when they are accessed via Clientless VPN.Please see tac-repro for POC.This issue was first seen by customer in Confluence ;People directory; functionality. When the malicious string is put into the search field, the same can be reproduced.

Title: Cisco Finesse for UCCE Information Disclosure Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the Notifications Service of Cisco Finesse for Unified Contact Center Enterprise (UCCE) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to retrieve information on agents using the Finesse desktop.  The vulnerability is due to a user account with an undocumented hard-coded password. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by subscribing to the Finesse Notifications Service using these hard-coded credentials. This would allow an attacker to receive notifications when an agent signs in or out of the Finesse desktop, when information about an agent changes, or when an agent's state changes.  Conditions: Using Cisco Finesse for Unified Contact Center Enterprise (UCCE) with default configuration.  Workaround: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the security advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6626 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Finesse Notification Service (OpenFire) creates a federated presence listener for the 2 nodes of the cluster to check the presence of each other. By default, a random password based on the VOS platform's security password is created during install and and replicated between the two nodes, and used as a shared secret for this user. However, if replication is broken between the two nodes, there is a hardcoded password that is used as the default to prevent the system from going out-of-service. The code is written in such a way that the default hard-coded password can always be used by the federated presence listener to connect to OpenFire and subscribe to events. The port for event subscription (5222) is open on the firewall for external clients to subscribe to OpenFire events. Therefore, this constitutes a remote access vulnerability.This vulnerability exists only in the 11.5 and 11.6 versions. Prior to these release, if replication is broken, the subscriber node will go out of service and will stay out-of-service until the replication is fixed.

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the authentication module of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass local authentication.  The vulnerability is due to improper handling of authentication requests and policy assignment for externally authenticated users. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating with a valid external user account that matches an internal username and incorrectly receiving the authorization policy of the internal account. An exploit could allow the attacker to have Super Admin privileges to ISE Admin portal.  This vulnerability does not affect endpoints authenticating to the ISE.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  Note: Software versions 1.2.x and all prior versions are affected.  Version 2.3 is not affected.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170802-ise  Conditions: Please see the Security Advisory  Workaround: Please see the Security Advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.1:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6747 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: While working on bug CSCvb01794 I discovered that being a total security concern and I want to proceed with opening a PSIRT. Now the issue is as follows: If I only allow AD users to be Monitor helpdesk or any other role. But then in AD I will create a user for instance 'admin' which matches the username from a local database when authenticating I will be able to log into ISE with admin rights. Which means that when authorization is being checked only username being checked hence if we create any matching local user and AD user. AD users will have a privileges of a localy created users which is a vulnerability.1) The most extensive troubleshooting I performed on ISE 2.0 patch 3. = 10.48.17.220 and ISE 2.1 Patch 1 = 10.48.17.2182) Those deployments are joined into AD. And I created a user named 'admin' with password = Krakow123 in AD. In local datastore there is a user named 'admin' with password = P@ssw0rd.3) In Admin Access authorization policies I got a policy set up to allow only Helpdesk Admin Menu Access to the users in Domain Users group.4) If I login with normal AD user I get the correct limitied privilege5) In ISE 2.1 I will just get logged in straight away without trouble with highest privileges. In ISE 2.0 I and log into ISE using 'admin' user from AD i am directed to https://10.48.17.220/admin/LoginAction.do. 6) Just go to address string and hit enter again and I am redirected to https://10.48.17.220/admin/login.jsp?mid=auth_failed7) Though it should be something else I get a full privileged admin access to the ISE.I suspect that being a severe Security issue and though the customer is not fully aware of that issue yet. That should provide a great security concern.

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software EnergyWise Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
RNE: Symptoms: Multiple vulnerabilities in the EnergyWise module of Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a buffer overflow condition or a reload of an affected device, leading to a denial of service (DoS) condition.  These vulnerabilities are due to improper parsing of crafted EnergyWise packets destined to an affected device. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending crafted EnergyWise packets to be processed by an affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a buffer overflow condition or a reload of the affected device, leading to a DoS condition.  Cisco has released software updates that address these vulnerabilities. There are no workarounds that address these vulnerabilities.  This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170419-energywise  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Firepower System Software Server Message Block Version 2 File Policy Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the detection engine of Cisco Firepower System Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass a file policy that is configured to block the Server Message Block Version 2 (SMB2) protocol.  The vulnerability is due to the incorrect detection of an SMB2 file when the detection is based on the length of the file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by  sending a crafted SMB2 transfer request through the targeted device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass filters that are configured to block SMB2  traffic.  Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-firepower2  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco Firepower System Software that has one or more file action policies configured. This vulnerability is present in all software versions prior to the first fixed.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12300 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: SMB2 file not being blockedEscalation: https://clpsvs.cloudapps.cisco.com/services/clip/main/transaction/BEMS616566Customer: CiscoVersion: 2.9.9 2.9.10When the customer transfers a file via SMB2, it is allowed, even though it should be blocked by file policy. The file is small and fits within a single read response. It seems that if the create request and read request are sent together, and then the read response and the create response are being sent together, then the file is not blocked. If the create request/response happens first, and then the read request/response, it is blocked successfully. Also, if the file is larger so that it needs two read responses, then it works fine, and the second read response is blocked, even if the create and read request were originally sent together.Attached to the bug is a pcap where the file is transferred and not blocked - it was taken on the client and the entire contents of the file are present. The client was Windows 10 and the server was Windows 2012.Steps to reproduce:1) Create AC policy with file policy to block exe file type w/ reset2) Replay pcapActual results:File is not blocked and no reset is generatedExpected results:Firewall should block file and generate reset

Title: ACNS Outdated Apache package has known vulnerabilities.
RNE: Symptom: Vulnerability scanners might indicate false positives on ACNS. !-- , no, CmdArg, and noCmdArg --  Conditions: ACNS 5.5(15)   Workaround: N/A  Further Problem Description:  The following are the known vulnerabilities of Apache 1.3.x as of Nov 2009, They either do not apply to ACNS or have been fixed as indicated:  CVE-2007-6388  ACNS Not vulnerable - ACNS doesn?t has server-status page enabled. Hence this vulnerability cannot be  exploited. CVE-2007-5000 ACNS Not Vulnerable - ACNS doesn?t uses imagemap files. Hence this vulnerability cannot be exploited. CVE-2006-5752 ACNS Not Vulnerable  - ACNS doesn?t has server-status page enabled. Hence this vulnerability cannot be  exploited. CVE-2007-3304 ACNS Not Vulnerable - ACNS has Apache version 1.3.33 which does not use the  Prefork MPM module. CVE-2006-3747  Already Fixed by CSCsg10276 CVE-2006-3918 Already fixed by CSCsx99875  CVE-2005-3352  ACNS Not Vulnerable - ACNS doesn?t uses mod_imap. Hence this vulnerability cannot be exploited. CVE-1999-0619  Not a Vulnerability but a recommendation. In ACNS telnet service can be disabled and ssh enabled using the  cmdboldtelnet  enablenocmdbold and the cmdboldsshd enablenocmdbold commands. Description: ACNS version 5.5.15 (latest) and probably any other software based on the same core files (WAAS, etc) is being shipped with a very old version of the Apache web server - v1.3.33 - which is affected by multiple security vulnerabilities - affecting both the core http server and compiled-in modules. Title: Uuencode emails are generating scanning error.
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Uuencode inspection engine of Cisco AsyncOS for Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass the engine protection and deliver a malicious files as an email attachment. The ESA will log 'Scanning Error' in the mail_logs after allowing the email to traverse it.  Conditions: ESA configured to inspect attachments, eg: to discard executable files.  Workaround:  Further Problem Description: Contact TAC to be provisioned for ASYNCOS 8.5.6-113  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. Title: Assess SSL inspection against issues named in Cert TA17-075A
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptom:  Conditions:  Workaround:  Further Problem Description:
Description: The US-CERT raised an alert about potential security pitfalls of HTTPS interception solutions:https://www.us-cert.gov/ncas/alerts/TA17-075Aespecially in relation to the publication of:https://zakird.com/papers/https_interception.pdfwhere a number of hardware and software solutions performing HTTPS interception were analyzed focusing on their client behavior connecting towards an HTTPS server (while acting as a proxy for the real client), their findings highlighted that in DEFAULT CONFIGURATIONS oftentimes the interception would degrade the overall security of the connection compared to when the client would connect directly to the server,  mostly due to:- set of ciphers advertised by the interception device to the server- mis-handling of certificates (eg: lack of validation)- being vulnerable to known attacks (eg: Logjam, BEAST,  FREAK etc.)While the FPR was not tested by the researchers it does performs SSL inspection so the objective of this defect is to get it proactively assessed internally to ensure we are not affected by most of the issues above. Please note that the researchers tested inspection with default configuration, so the objective here is to move towards a more secure behavior by default.

Title: Cisco Prime Security Manager Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom:   A vulnerability in the web framework of Cisco Prime Security Manager could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site  scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web interface on the affected system.    Conditions:   An attacker who can convince a user to follow an attacker supplied link could cause arbitrary script or HTML code to be executed on the users browser within the context of the affected site.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of several parameters in the Access Polices and Device Summary Dashboard related HTML  pages.    Workaround:  None.    Further Problem Description:   Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigation can be found at: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  4.3/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2014-3364 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller command injection vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the command-line interface (CLI) processor of the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller could allow an authenticated, local attacker to inject arbitrary commands that are executed with elevated privileges on the underlying operating system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the device and submitting crafted commands through the CLI. An exploit could allow the attacker to read, write and overwrite any file on the system or execute arbitrary code.  Conditions: Default configuration  Workaround: There are no workarounds  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.8/5.6:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-4224 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: It is possible to inject shell commands using core dump facilitythis opens the controller to be used as start point for any kind of attacksThis was reported externallyexample of killing system:(5500-3) >config coredump username ';poweroff;' password pass(5500-3) >test ftpstatuscurl: option -u: requires parameter        curl: try 'curl --help' for more informationsh: :pass: not found FTP file transfer was unsuccessful Error number is 0x7f00 The system is going down NOW!Dumping a core. This can take a few minutes... Sending SIGKILL to all processesRequesting system poweroffSystem halted.(no reboot, just dead)

Title: Cisco Secure Desktop Cache Cleaner Command Execution Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in a Cisco-signed Java Archive (JAR) executable Cache Cleaner component of Cisco Secure Desktop could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the client host where the affected .jar file is executed. Command execution would occur with the privileges of the user.  The Cache Cleaner feature has been deprecated since November 2012.  There is no fixed software for this vulnerability. Cisco Secure Desktop packages that includes the affected .jar files have been removed and are not anymore available for download.  Because Cisco does not control all existing Cisco Secure Desktop packages customers are advised to ensure to ensure that their Java blacklists controls have been updated to avoid potential exploitation. Refer to the "Workarounds" section of this advisory for additional information on how to mitigate this vulnerability.  Customers using Cisco Secure Desktop should migrate to Cisco Host Scan standalone package.  This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150415-csd  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS sscores as of the time of evaluation are 9.3/8.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:H/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0691 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Call Manager SQL Injection
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in Cisco Unified Communications Manager (Cisco UCM) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to preform a SQL Injection attack.  This could result in the attacker gaining the ability to disclose information accessible by the affected application.  The vulnerability is due to a failure to properly sanitize user supplied input passed to the affected application.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by logging into the Administrative Web interface and submitting a response to the affected page designed to trigger the issue.   Conditions: Devices running an affected version of the Cisco Unified Communications Manager.   Workaround: None  Further Problem Description: None  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4/3.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2014-3366 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: A security researcher recently uncovered a SQL injection, cross site scripting and  session hijacking during a client internal penetration assessment.  A malicious user can use the application to perform any functionality the database user has available.This can include querying, writing, and deleting data that is accessible by the database account usedby the web application.Applications that do not correctly validate and/or sanitise the user input can potentially be exploitedThe following table details the pages and parameters found to be vulnerable to SQL injection:Page Parameterhttps://192.168.2.100/ccmadmin/bulkviewfilecontents.do fileNameThe following URL can be used to reproduce this issue. The SQL statement ' OR 1=1-- allows for alldata in the current table to be dumped.SQL Injectionhttps://192.168.2.100/ccmadmin/bulkviewfilecontents.do?filetype=customfile&fileName=a%27%20OR%201%3d1--You can also refer to the pdf file attached the this bug - 	DiData Vulnerability Assesment.pdf

Title: UCCX 11.5 XMPP Cleartext Authentication Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms:  A vulnerability in the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP) service of the Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (UCCx) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to masquerade as a legitimate user.   This vulnerability is due to the XMPP service incorrectly processing an unsecured HTTP port for 3rd party remote presence monitoring. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to access the system as another user.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6722 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: XMPP Cleartext Authentication is detected as vulnerability on port 5222. Port 5222 (unsecured HTTP) and 5223 (secured HTTPS) are open on the firewall for 3rd party clients to connect via raw XMPP connections to Finesse OpenFire. These client would use the Finesse REST APIs and the OpenFire notification interface to build their own functionality. Finesse also uses 5222 to connect to OpenFire on the other node for checking on remote presence. We can force this to use the secure 5223 port, but would still have to leave 5222 open for 3rd party clients.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Unified Communications Manager could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross- site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web-based management interface of an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this  vulnerability by persuading a user of the interface to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of  the interface or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.   This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171129-cucm  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoAppliedMitigationBulletin/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12357 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: CUCM 11.5 Secure Headers not used-XSS-Cross-site Scripting (post authentication)The application is vulnerable to cross-site scripting after authentication and frame injection. The script does not properly validate the input parameters, allowing scripts to be injected and then used to compromise client's confidential information, such as the Session ID. In addition, more sophisticated phishing attacks make use of this vulnerability to even trick security aware users.Parameter Manipulation: SID=228 SID=>;>alert(;CSS%20attack%20may%20be%20used;).XSS vulnerability exists in the Cisco Unified Reporting module where a user can upload a report with a malicious file name.Step 1Created XML report file whose name is %3Cscript%3Ealert(%27XSS%27)%3C%2Fscript%3E.xmlStep 2Upload the report.Step 3Rendering.https://<CUCMIP>/cucreports/generateReport.do?upload=true&isStandard=false&name=%3Cscript%3Ealert(%27XSS%27)%3C%2Fscript%3E.xml&transform=trueURL: https://<CUCMIP>/cucreports/generateReport.doParameter: nameAffected Hosts/URLs:https://<CUCMIP>/cucreports/generateReport.do?upload=true&isStandard=false&name=%3Cscript%3Ealert(%27XSS%27)%3C%2Fscript%3E.xml&transform=true

Title: Crash in ALPS SNMP code
RNE: Symptom: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6. Only traffic directed to an affected system can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities.  The vulnerabilities are due to a buffer overflow condition in the SNMP subsystem of the affected software. The vulnerabilities affect all versions of SNMP Versions 1, 2c, and 3. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 2c or earlier, the attacker must know the SNMP read-only community string for the affected system. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 3, the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain full control of the affected system or cause the affected system to reload.  Cisco will release software updates that address these vulnerabilities. There are workarounds that address these vulnerabilities.  The advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170629-snmp  Conditions: Devices running an affected version of Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software.  Workaround: Administrators are advised to allow only trusted users to have SNMP access on an affected system. Administrators are also advised to monitor affected systems by using the show snmp host command in the CLI.  In addition, administrators can mitigate these vulnerabilities by disabling the following MIBs on a device:      ADSL-LINE-MIB     ALPS-MIB     CISCO-ADSL-DMT-LINE-MIB     CISCO-BSTUN-MIB     CISCO-MAC-AUTH-BYPASS-MIB     CISCO-SLB-EXT-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-DNIS-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-NUMBER-EXPANSION-MIB     TN3270E-RT-MIB  To create or update a view entry and disable the affected MIBs, administrators can use the snmp-server view global configuration command, as shown in the following example:      snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP iso included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP internet included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpUsmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpVacmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpCommunityMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.252 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP transmission.94 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP mib-2.34.9 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.35 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.95 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.130 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.219 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.254 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMabMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoExperiment.997 excluded  To then apply this configuration to a community string, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server community mycomm view NO_BAD_SNMP RO  For SNMP Version 3, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server group v3group auth read NO_BAD_SNMP write NO_BAD_SNMP  Further Problem Description: Customer are advised to utilize the Cisco IOS Software Checker or Contact Cisco TAC to determine if fixed software has been released for an affected platform.  Cisco IOS Software Checker: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6742 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: It is possible to reliably crash a router by sending it a single packet. This sender only needs to know the snmp community read string. The crash can be triggered by issuing the following command on any system that supports the snmpget program:snmpget -v2c -c <read-pwd> <address> `python -c ;print '1.3.6.1.4.1.9.9.95.1.2.4.1.3.10.1.1.1.100.0%s'%('.1'*99);`The crash is caused by a overflowing a stack variable, potentially allowing the attacker control of the cpu program counter. It existed as early as 12.4(11)T3 on a c7206 npe-g1, and as late as 15.6(3)M1 on a c2900. The crash does not require any configuration of ALPS, although the 2900 does need a uck9 or data9 license. I did not test any versions outside of this range, but the bug has most likely been present since the day the code was released.The crash occurs because the ALPS snmp code calls the function alps_lib_toupper() passing in an attacker controlled length. That function blindly copies the number of bytes specified. All callers to that function must validate that the length being copied is less than the length of the destination buffer. It appears that there are several configuration commands that also call alps_lib_toupper, so it should also be possible to crash the router from the command line as well.

RNE: Symptom: This bug has been opened to evaluate and address the potential impact of the CVE-2015-0239 vulnerability on these versions of the product:       ESA AsyncOS 9.0.x      ESA AsyncOS 8.5.x      ESA AsyncOS 8.0.x      ESA AsyncOS 7.6.3  Overview: ''The em_sysenter function in arch/x86/kvm/emulate.c in the Linux kernel before 3.18.5, when the guest OS lacks SYSENTER MSR initialization,  allows guest OS users to gain guest OS privileges or cause a denial of service (guest OS crash) by triggering use of a 16-bit code segment for  emulation of a SYSENTER instruction.'' Title: Unity Connection breaks rfc 3264 for Multicast Streams
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptoms:  A vulnerability in the Unified Messaging Service (UMS) of Cisco Unity Connection, could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to access sensitive information.  The vulnerability is due to the handling of Multicast Music on Hold (MMOH) . An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by streaming voicemail to the multicast ip address.  An exploit could allow the attacker to listen to sensitive data.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Unity connection 11.5 is responding incorrectly to midcall Invites with a multicast ip address in the connection field ;Connection Information (c): IN IP4 239.191.255.251;this is causing crosstalk  when the following calls occur (all users on hold  are hearing Private voicemails and or voicemail greetings) (This is privacy issue for our customer and our customers customers that are leaving private confidintial voice mails)1. phone A (local or pstn) calls phone B (local) Phone B places phone A on hold (Phone A is now receiving MMOH.2. Phone C (local phone) dials into Unity connection, Phone C then places Unity on hold. (Unity is now streaming what Phone C was listening to to the MMOH multicast address and port)

Title: Cisco WebEx Meeting Server Cross Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom:  A vulnerability in the web framework of Cisco WebEx Meetings Server could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web interface of an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of some parameters that are passed to the web server of the affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing a user to follow a malicious link or by intercepting a user request and injecting malicious code into the request. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected web interface or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171004-wms  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: This vulnerability was externally reported to Cisco by Ali Ardic, Cyber Security Researcher & Specialist.  Security Advisory: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171004-wms  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12257 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco ASA Software DNS Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the DNS code of Cisco ASA Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to reload or corrupt the information present in the device's local DNS cache.  The vulnerability is due to a flaw in handling crafted DNS response messages. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by triggering a DNS request from the Cisco ASA Software and replying with a crafted response. A successful exploit could cause the device to reload, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition or corruption of the local DNS cache information.  Note: Only traffic directed to the affected device can be used to exploit this vulnerability. This vulnerability affects Cisco ASA Software configured in routed or transparent firewall mode and single or multiple context mode. This vulnerability can be triggered by IPv4 and IPv6 traffic.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170419-asa-dns  Conditions: See security advisory  Workaround: See security advisory  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6607 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Internet Key Exchange Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Internet Key Exchange Version 2 (IKEv2) module of Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an  unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause either high CPU, traceback messages or a reload of the affected device that would lead to a denial of  service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to how an affected device processes certain IKEv2 packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending specific  IKEv2 packets to an affected device to be processed. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause either high cpu, tracebacks or a reload of the  affected device that would lead to a DoS condition.  Although only IKEv2 packets can be used to trigger this vulnerability, devices that are running Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software are  vulnerable when ISAKMP is enabled.  A device does not need to be configured with any IKEv2-specific features to be vulnerable.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available.   This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170927-ike   This advisory is part of the September 27, 2017, release of the Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication, which  includes 12 Cisco Security Advisories that describe 13 vulnerabilities. For a complete list of the advisories and links to them, see the '' Cisco Event  Response: September 2017 Semiannual Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication'' which is available at  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-63410  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco devices that are running a vulnerable release of a Cisco IOS or Cisco IOS XE Software. See the published advisory  for more information.  Please see the Cisco IOS XE Software Checker tool for information on non-vulnerable, vulnerable and fixed releases. This tool is available at  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x  Workaround: See published advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12237 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: TLS renogotiation MITM vulnerability in some 3D series BMC web servers
RNE: Symptom:   A vulnerability in the 3D series BMC web servers could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web interface of the affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of a user-supplied value. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing a user to click on a specific link.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration..  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigations can be found at: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. Title: ACS GUI Arbitrary OS Command Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Summary Cisco Secure Access Control System (ACS) is affected by the following vulnerabilities:      Cisco Secure ACS RMI Privilege Escalation Vulernability     Cisco Secure ACS RMI Unauthenticated User Access Vulnerability     Cisco Secure ACS Operating System Command Injection Vulnerability  Cisco Secure ACS uses the Remote Method Invocation (RMI) interface for internode communication using TCP ports 2020 and 2030.  These vulnerabilities are independent of each other; a release that is affected by one of the vulnerabilities may not be affected by the other.  Cisco has released free software updates that address these vulnerabilities. This advisory is available at the following link:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140115-csacs  Network-based mitigations for the RMI-based vulnerabilities are outlined in the Cisco Applied Mitigation Bulletin: Identifying and Mitigating the Multiple Vulnerabilities in Cisco Secure Access Control System http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAMBAlert.x?alertId=32120  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 8.5/7: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-0650 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.checkForSpecialChars() in ActiveDirectoryLDAPFacade.java does not adequately filter special characters in user input, resulting in an attacker being able to inject arbitrary shell commands.Special characters to the shell, such as semicolons, are not being filtered or escaped properly.  The filtering of the space character, for instance, is easily bypassed with brace expansion.  Furthermore, it is suspected that user input is being provided directly to a shell via the AD commands, because shell interpretation of special characters, such as ;>; for output redirection, works, despite the use of Java's exec() from Runtime.User input should be thoroughly filtered or escaped as if it were being directly  provided to a shell.

Title: Insufficient protection of CIMC 'load debug plugin' command
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Unified Computing Platform Blade servers contain the Cisco Integrated Management Controller.  The CIMC utilizes an access generation algorithm for the debug plug-in functionality that may be insufficient in strength.  This could allow a local, authenticated attacker who has the ability to  break the hashing algorithm to gain access to the debug plug-in functionality.  Conditions: Cisco Unified Computing System deployments that are running an affected version of UCS software.  Workaround: Restrict CIMC access to trusted users only.  Further Problem Description: This issue was identified during an internal security audit of the UCS and related devices.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  1.5/1.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:POC/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The protection mechanism employed by the 'load debug plugin' command on the B- and C-series CIMC uses a relatively easily broken random number system for protection. Access to the Linux shell on the CIMC should be highly protected from misuse or abuse.  The code that was used to provide this protection system is readily available and documented on the internet as well as the weakness's inherent in the implementation.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: trfridle           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs. Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance FTP Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptoms: A vulnerability in FTP server of the Web Security Appliance (WSA) could allow an unauthenticated,  remote attacker to log into the FTP server of the device without a valid password. The attacker does need to have a valid username.  The vulnerability is due to incorrect FTP user credential validation. An attacker could exploit  this vulnerability by using FTP to connect to the local ip address of the targeted device. An  exploit could allow the attacker to login into the FTP server of the WSA without having a valid  password.  Conditions: FTP was enabled on an interface using the ''ifconfig'' command. FTP is disabled by default.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.2: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: FTP Login Does not Validate Password FieldWhen connecting to the WSA over FTP using any valid username, any string entered in the password field results in a successful login.  This is true for both internal and external users.  Using a blank password does not allow login.

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers Access Control List Security Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in certain filtering mechanisms of access control lists (ACLs) for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass ACL rules that have been configured for an affected device.  The vulnerability exists because the affected device fails to inspect and match certain traffic that meets the criteria defined in ACL rules configured for the device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP packets to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass certain sets of rules defined in ACLs for the affected device.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170719-asr1  Conditions: Device running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: For information about vulnerable and not vulnerable software releases, and time frame for fixed software releases, please open a support case with your support organization. PSIRT does not provide or maintain this information for Medium SIR advisories.   This is the best available information on affected/not affected/fixed releases as of May 22, 2017. PSIRT will not maintain this information. For updates, please follow up with the DE assigned to this bug.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6672  has been assigned to document this issue. Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Horizontal Privilege Escalation
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in configuration modification permissions validation for Cisco Unified Communications Manager could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to  perform a horizontal privilege escalation where one user can modify another user's configuration.  The vulnerability is due to lack of proper Role Based Access Control (RBAC) when certain user configuration changes are requested. An attacker could exploit  this vulnerability by sending an authenticated, crafted HTTP request to the targeted application. An exploit could allow the attacker to impact the integrity of the  application where one user can modify the configuration of another user's information.  Conditions: This vulnerability exists in all previous versions until the first fixed release.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6785 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Reported by BoA:Vulnerability 1: Unauthorized Data Access Exists (Horizontal Escalation)Horizontal Privilege escalation allows a malicious user to access data they should not be able to access, in afunctionality they can typically access.Example1.png:Example Affected Url's:https://iptqae1c0.bankofamerica.com/ccmadmin/userNewEdit.do?key=d8c81bc4-6c09-49f9-a70d-7ba6d9e1291bhttps://iptqae1c0.bankofamerica.com/ccmadmin/pluginsSave.do (Name and URL of plugin's can be modified.)Note: It is recommended to apply fixed through out the application.Steps to replicate:1. Login and navigate to Quick User/Phone Add.2. Edit any of the user and observe any of the user details like First name, Last name are non editable.Example2.png:3. Save the record and intercept the request using a proxy tool like burp and modify the user details as shownbelow.Example3.png:4. Forward the modified request and observe the changes to the user.

Title: Cisco ASA Software and Cisco FTD Software TCP Normalizer Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the TCP normalizer of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause Cisco ASA and FTD to drop any further incoming traffic on all interfaces, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to improper limitation of the global out-of-order TCP queue for specific block sizes. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a large number of unique permitted TCP connections with out-of-order segments. An exploit could allow the attacker to exhaust available blocks in the global out-of-order TCP queue, causing the dropping of any further incoming traffic on all interfaces and resulting in a DoS condition.  Workarounds that address this vulnerability are not available.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170419-asa-norm  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3793 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: In the current TCP Normalizer implementation, we only implement global TCP packet block limits for re-ordering with 1550- and 2048-byte blocks. Since Jumbo frames are common and most modern platforms use 9344-byte blocks by default, we need to implement similar limits across all applicable block sizes. Otherwise, it create a potential DoS vector.Relevant code from tcp_norm.c:if ( (bp->class_size == BLK_SZ_1550 &&               tcp_ooo_block_1550used > tcp_ooo_block_1550limit) ||             (bp->class_size == BLK_SZ_2048 &&               tcp_ooo_block_2048used > tcp_ooo_block_2048limit) ){            snp_tcp_drop_and_send_ack(bp, tcb,                                       !packet_to_service,                                       packet_to_service,                                      NP_DROP_TCP_GLOBAL_BUFFER_FULL, FALSE);            return;        }
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: trfridle           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs.
