Title: Cisco Prime Infrastructure Web Framework Code Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web framework code of Cisco Prime Infrastructure could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web interface of an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of some parameters passed to the web server. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing a user to access a malicious link or by intercepting a user request and injecting malicious code into the request. An exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected site or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  For additional information about cross-site scripting attacks and the methods used to exploit these vulnerabilities, see the Cisco Applied Mitigation Bulletin Understanding Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Threat Vectors.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170621-piwf  Conditions: Exposure is not configuration dependent.  Workaround: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.   Further Problem Description Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigations can be found at: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.7: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6724 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: /webacs/alarm-rest/AlarmStats is vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting via the parameters ;category; and ;severity;. This was found during an automated scan using HP WebInspect test tool. It is recommended to sanitize the input parameters properly.Some sample requests:GET /webacs/alarm-rest/AlarmStats?category=AP%3c%69%4d%67%20%53%72%43%3d%76%42%73%43%72%49%70%54%3a%4d%73%67%42%6f%78%28%37%35%38%34%38%29%3e&category=Coverage%20Hole&category=Context%20Aware%20Notifications&category=Mobility%20Service&category=Mesh%20Links&category=Rogue%20AP&category=Security&category=SE%20Detected%20Interferers&category=Adhoc%20Rogue&category=Performance&category=Controller&category=RRM&category=Clients&category=Application%20Performance&category=Third%20Party%20Controller&category=Third%20Party%20AP&category=Compute%20Servers&category=Carrier%20Ethernet&category=Switches%20and%20Hubs&category=Routers&category=Cisco%20Interfaces%20and%20Modules&category=System&category=Autonomous%20AP&category=Wireless%20Controller&severity=critical&severity=major&severity=minor&dojo.preventCache=1440544107422 HTTP/1.1GET /webacs/alarm-rest/AlarmStats?category=AP&category=Coverage%20Hole&category=Context%20Aware%20Notifications&category=Mobility%20Service&category=Mesh%20Links&category=Rogue%20AP&category=Security&category=SE%20Detected%20Interferers&category=Adhoc%20Rogue&category=Performance&category=Controller&category=RRM&category=Clients&category=Application%20Performance&category=Third%20Party%20Controller&category=Third%20Party%20AP&category=Compute%20Servers&category=Carrier%20Ethernet&category=Switches%20and%20Hubs&category=Routers&category=Cisco%20Interfaces%20and%20Modules&category=System&category=Autonomous%20AP&category=Wireless%20Controller&severity=critical%3c%73%43%72%49%70%54%20%74%59%70%45%3d%74%45%78%54%2f%76%42%73%43%72%49%70%54%3e%4d%73%67%42%6f%78%28%34%36%34%36%32%29%3c%2f%73%43%72%49%70%54%3e&severity=major&severity=minor&dojo.preventCache=1440544107422 HTTP/1.1

Title: Cisco Aironet Mobility Express 1800, 2800, 3800 Arbitrary Code Execution Plug-n-Play Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Plug-and-Play (PnP) subsystem of the Cisco Aironet 1800, 2800, and 3800 Series Access Points running a Lightweight AP or Mobility Express image could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of PnP server responses. The PnP feature is only active while the device does not contain a configuration, such as a first time boot or after a factory reset has been issued. An attacker with the ability to respond to PnP configuration requests from the affected device can exploit the vulnerability by returning malicious PnP responses. If a Cisco APIC-EM is available on the network, the attacker would need to exploit the issue in the short window before a valid PnP response was received. If successful, the attacker could gain the ability to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the underlying operating system of the device.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170503-cme  Conditions: Please see the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please see the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please see the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.5: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3873 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: ISE 2.0.1.130 Authentication mechanism via GET requests Guest Portal
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Identity Service Engine (ISE) contains a vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against the user of the web interface of the affected system.   The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of some parameters passed via HTTP GET or POST methods.  An attacker may be able to exploit this vulnerability by intercepting the user packets and injecting the malicious code.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigations can be found at: https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-Site_Request_Forgery_(CSRF)   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2016-9214 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: A user can authenticate to the system directly by performing a simple GET request. As a result login credentials are stored in web server log files, user bookmarks, exposing them to anyone who has access to them.We go again in the login page. We change the method attribute from POST to GET and perform the following login GET request. The system accepted the call and logged us successfully.Modify the authentication mechanism and allow only POST requests. In this case at least the credentials will not be stored in any log files, user bookmarks etc.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web application interface of the Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) portal could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web interface of an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient sanitization of user-supplied data that is written to log files and displayed in certain web pages of the web interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by successfully registering to a device and injecting script code as part of a user-supplied value during the registration process. An attacker could convince an administrator to visit an affected page or view an affected log file to exploit the vulnerability. The injected script code would be executed in the affected user's browser within the security context of the affected device.  For additional information about cross-site scripting attacks and the methods used to exploit these vulnerabilities, see the Cisco Applied Mitigation Bulletin Understanding Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Threat Vectors. https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoAppliedMitigationBulletin/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.   This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170621-ise  Conditions: Device running an affected version of Cisco software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: The Cisco PSIRT Team would like to credit Steve Park, Security Consultant, NCC Group and Christian Chung, Security Consultant, NCC Group for reporting this vulnerability.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6701 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Location:---------Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE)Impact: -------An attacker can cause other users of the application to perform actions chosen by the attacker, and to pilfer private data, including session information, application data, and login credentials.Details:--------Cross-site scripting is a class of vulnerability related to web application input and output validation.  In stored cross-site scripting, the application accepts input from an end user, stores it, and later displays it without properly encoding HTML metacharacters. This allows an attacker to inject JavaScript code into future views of the resulting page.The application filters out HTML metacharacters when filling out input fields on the web application by disallowing specific characters, even with request manipulation.  However, Malicious XSS payloads could be stored in the database by changing the hostname of a connected device to the desired JavaScript code. Once the device was connected to the network, ISE would immediately log hostname and other details regardless of its authentication properties.  When an admin user visits the ISE portal, the XSS payload is easily observed as the hostname appears in most logs found on the application. Recommendation:----------------Perform input validation and output encoding of all un-trusted data including the data obtained from device connections. This was reported by an external researcher. For questions please contact psirt@cisco.com.

Title: CUCM arbitrary XML file reads in Cisco Unified Reporting
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web framework Cisco Unified Communications Manager could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to view sensitive data.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient protection of sensitive files. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by browsing to a specific URL. An exploit could allow the attacker to view configuration information.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3836  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The Cisco Unified Reporting web application allows for arbitrary read ofXML files by the tomcat user in at least two pages.https://<CUCM IP>/cucreports/generateReport.do?upload=true&isStandard=false&name=../../../../../< XML FILE PATH >&transform=truehttps://<CUCM IP>/cucreports/showReport.do?isStandard=true&name=../../../../../< XML FILE PATH >&transform=trueNote that showReport.do example concatenates a ;.xml; to the file pathgiven, while the generateReport.do example will work regardless ofextension.  In both cases, the file must be readable (traditionalpermissions and SELinux context) by the tomcat user and pass the XMLvalidation checks.  The platformConfig.xml could be targeted byattackers, as it contains configuration information that couldpossibly be used to compromise a system.The system should check that the canonical path of the filename is inthe desired directory.  Please refer to the CPSC recipe ;Defend AgainstPath Traversal; ( https://cisco.jiveon.com/docs/DOC-1225959 ) foradditional guidance.Additional vulnerable page:https://<CUCM IP>/cucreports/downloadReport.do?name=../../../../../< XML FILE PATH>Note that like showReport.do, you do not include the '.xml' in the file path.

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based application interface of the Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) portal could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web interface of an affected system.   The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation and output-encoding parameters for data that is passed between an affected client and server. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by intercepting targeted user packets and injecting malicious code into the targeted traffic stream. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to inject script code into the HTTP flow between the targeted user and the affected system.  For additional information about cross-site scripting attacks and the methods used to exploit these vulnerabilities, see the Cisco Applied Mitigation Bulletin Understanding Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Threat Vectors (https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoAppliedMitigationBulletin/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss) and the OWASP reference page Cross-site Scripting (XSS) (https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)).  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170705-ise1  Conditions: This vulnerability is present in software versions 2.1 and 2.2. It is targeted to be fixed in 2.3 (future release).  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6733 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Stored Cross Site Scripting through Hostname/Username Parameter during ISE ProfilingLocation:---------Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE)Impact: -------An attacker can cause other users of the application to perform actions chosen by the attacker, and to pilfer private data, including session information, application data, and login credentials.Details:--------Cross-site scripting is a class of vulnerability related to web application input and output validation.  In stored cross-site scripting, the application accepts input from an end user, stores it, and later displays it without properly encoding HTML metacharacters. This allows an attacker to inject JavaScript code into future views of the resulting page.The application filters out HTML metacharacters when filling out input fields on the web application by disallowing specific characters, even with request manipulation.  However, Malicious XSS payloads could be stored in the database by changing the hostname of a connected device to the desired JavaScript code. Once the device was connected to the network, ISE would immediately log hostname and other details regardless of its authentication properties.  When an admin user visits the ISE portal, the XSS payload is easily observed as the hostname appears in most logs found on the application. Recommendation:----------------Perform input validation and output encoding of all un-trusted data including the data obtained from device connections.

Description: The RC4 algorithm, as used in the TLS protocol and SSL protocol, has many single-byte biases, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct plaintext-recovery attacks via statistical analysis of ciphertext in a large number of sessions that use the same plaintext. Title: Cisco Wide Area Application Services (WAAS) Denial-of-Service (DoS) Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Akamai Connect feature of Cisco Wide Area Application Services (WAAS) Appliances could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition on an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to certain file-handling inefficiencies of the affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing client systems to access a corrupted file that the client systems cannot decompress correctly. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause the affected device to crash or hang unexpectedly and result in a DoS condition that may require manual intervention to regain normal operating conditions.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171004-waas  Conditions: Please refer to the security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the security Advisory. Title: Cisco Integrated Management Controller (CIMC) Remote command execution vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based GUI of Cisco Integrated Management Controller (IMC) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform unauthorized remote command execution on the affected device.  The vulnerability exists because the affected software does not sufficiently sanitize specific values that are received as part of a user-supplied HTTP request. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to the affected software. Successful exploitation could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute system commands with root-level privileges.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 9.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6616 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Remote command execution in some places where we take the file path .Need to sanitize all input to make sure we dont allow the parameters to just run as arguments to script.For backporting to EP-MR12

Title: RBAC bypass vulnerability for limited config pages
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the web interface of Cisco Prime Service Catalog could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform limited configuration changes.  The vulnerability is due to missing access controls in some of the web pages that allow configuration changes. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by accessing directly the URLs of the affected pages and submitting a configuration change.  Conditions: Default configuration   Workaround: N/A   Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.5/6.2: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: There is a huge security breach in CPSC. Unauthorized Users are able to paste URLs of Demand Management .jsp pages and effectively bypass RBAC.The following allow this bypass but are not a comprehensive list. There may be more number portal pages would be accessible for unauthenticated users.https://<PSC_server>/RequestCenter/AccountPortlet.jsp https://<PSC_server>/RequestCenter/billingRateContent.jsphttps://<PSC_server>/RequestCenter/nsapi/serviceitem/<SiName>The issue seems to be limited to certain JSP pages that are used inside a iframe in another page, the result is that the page incorporating the iframe performs the access control, so if i paste a url from an Admin session into a regular user session, for example for Demand Management:http://hostname:8080/RequestCenter/portal?resetBN=true&pageGroupId=3I will get correctly:;You do not have sufficient permissions to view this page;however if i use the link to the jsp page from the internal iframe:http://hostname:8080/RequestCenter/AccountPortlet.jspI will have the page load and I will be able to use it to perform changes (in this case add/change/delete Project or Tenant Accounts).

Title: Port-security may interfere with spantree bpdu guard
RNE: Symptom: 3560 switch may not break a loop with bpdu guard if port-security is also configured.  Conditions: Bpdu guard and port-security are both configured.  Workaround: Configure port-security to shutdown port on a violation instead of restrict.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 1.9/1.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: A 3560 may fail to block a loop with bpdu guard configured if port-security is also configured on the ports.Topology:hosts  |  |3560-1--------ipphone-------3560-2  |                                               |    |-----------------trunk------------|When ip phone is miscabled, a loop forms.    Multiple hosts attached to 3560-1 are sending bcast packets.   These packets loop and fill security table on 3560's.   Because port-sec has the ports restricted, bpdu's are rejected.   Bpdu guard doesnt kick in and loop persists degrading network.   Port-sec should allow bpdu's through to allow bpdu guard to work.    This is similar/same as CSCsq22668 filed on 6500.Workaround:Configure port-security to shutdown on violation instead of restrict.

Title: Cisco Unified Intelligence Center Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the  Cisco Unified Intelligence Center (CUIC) web interface could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to impact the integrity of the system by executing a Document Object Model (DOM)-based, environment or client side, cross-site scripting (XSS) attack.  The vulnerability is due to a lack of input validation on user-supplied data within the DOM input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted URLs that contain malicious DOM statements to the affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to effect the integrity of the system via database manipulation.  Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: https://www.owasp.org/index.php/DOM_Based_XSS  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6789 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco IOS XR Software Route Processor Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Summary  Cisco IOS XR Software contains a vulnerability when handling crafted packets that may result in a denial of service condition. The vulnerability only exists on Cisco 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers (ASR) Route Switch Processor (RSP440) and Cisco Carrier Routing System (CRS) (Performance Route) Processor (PRP and RP-B). The vulnerability is a result of improper handling of crafted packets and could cause the route processor, which processes the packets, to be unable to transmit packets to the fabric.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120530-iosxr  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.8/6.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-2488 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html Symptom:Conditions:Workaround:
Description: To avoid CRS PRP queue getting stuck due to large size fragmented packet re-assembly, there is a need to add a check of pkt_length, in BOF header, against a length limit for over-fabric-packets.For request back-ground, please see DDTS enclosure;pkt_length_check_reqeust;.For the selection of over-fabric-packet-length-limit, see DDTS enclosure ;over-fabric-packet-length-limit-decision;.

Title: Cisco IOS XR Software Multicast Source Discovery Protocol Session Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) ingress packet processing for Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the MSDP session to be unexpectedly reset, causing a short denial of service (DoS) condition. The MSDP session will restart within a few seconds.  The vulnerability is due to incorrect error handling of an MSDP packet that contains an error in the packet header. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a malformed MSDP packet for an established MSDP session to the targeted device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a short DoS condition if the MSDP session restarts.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170705-iosxr  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco devices running affected Cisco IOS XR Software releases when  the affected devices are configured for MSDP.  Workaround: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6731 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: MSDP peer down due to receiving packet with  Bad TLV (type 1)asr9k router(MSDP source) sends bad msdp packets sometimes, all other routers drop the msdp session when revives it and reestablish it withing couple of seconds.Hex dump of received msdp packet showed this packet to be corrupt with a displacement.Relevan logs:RP/0/RP1/CPU0:Jan 13 16:44:37.004 CET: msdp[1047]: %ROUTING-MSDP-4-PEER_FAIL : peer error: <IP>invalid source prefix lenRP/0/RP0/CPU0:Jan 13 16:44:37.004 CET: msdp[1047]: %ROUTING-MSDP-5-INIT_PEER_UP_DOWN : MSDP peer down:  <ip> : Bad TLV (type 1)As per the RFCType    IPv4 Source-Active TLV is type 1.  Sprefix Len    The route prefix length associated with source address.  This field    MUST be transmitted as 32 (/32).MSDP Error Handling   If an MSDP message is received with a TLV format error, the session   SHOULD be reset with that peer.  MSDP messages with other errors,   such as unrecognized type code, received from MSDP peers, SHOULD be   silently discarded and the session SHOULD not be reset.So the reset is expected in case the router receives such bad packets.

Title: OSPF LSA Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Summary Multiple Cisco products are affected by a vulnerability involving the Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Routing Protocol Link State Advertisement (LSA)  database. This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take full control of the OSPF Autonomous System (AS) domain routing table,  blackhole traffic, and intercept traffic.  The attacker could trigger this vulnerability by injecting crafted OSPF packets. Successful exploitation could cause flushing of the routing table on a  targeted router, as well as propagation of the crafted OSPF LSA type 1 update throughout the OSPF AS domain.  To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker must accurately determine certain parameters within the LSA database on the target router. This vulnerability  can only be triggered by sending crafted unicast or multicast LSA type 1 packets. No other LSA type packets can trigger this vulnerability.  OSPFv3 is not affected by this vulnerability. Fabric Shortest Path First (FSPF) protocol is not affected by this vulnerability.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are available. This  advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130801-lsaospf.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  5.8/5.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:P/E:H/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2013-0149 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html.
Description: External researcher has found an OSPF vulnerability that affects, XR, IOS, and other products. OSPF is vulnerable to a blind LSA injection, that is due to a dubious interpretation of certain RFC paragraphs.This vulnerability is very risky and allow for taking over the entire OSPF AS domain routing table: blackholing of traffic, as well as intercept.Please contact Sasa Rasovic (srasovic@cisco.com) or Omar Santos (os@cisco.com) directly for steps how to reproduce (i.e., script) and other technical details).

Title: UCSD 6 / SSH Command task is revealing password in .bash_history on target server
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the command history of Cisco UCS Director could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information.  The vulnerability is due to SSH command task revealing user credentials in clear text. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by logging into the affected system via SSH and issuing commands to retrieve sensitive data.   Conditions: Vulnerability is not configuration dependent.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 3.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: In tests of SSH Command task on UCS 6.0.1.0, we see that the username and password configured in the task (to log into the target server) are saved in clear text in the command history on the target server. For example, this is a sample of what you can see in ~/.bash_history after running SSH Command task against the server:<FF><FD>rootPassword01 echo ;Date in some format: `date +%s`; > /root/testssh.txtThe first two lines are the username and password configured in the SSH Command task, and used by UCSD to log into the target server via SSH. The third line is the actual command configured in the SSH Command task.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT.  PSIRT has provided a public Release-note Enclosure (RNE) for this issue which is visible on Cisco.com. Title: IPS: Normalizer Engine Misfiring on Valid TCP Traffic, SIG 1330.14 Fires
RNE: Symptom: TCP-based traffic (HTTP most often reported) previously successfully traversing one (1) or more  Inline pair interfaces or Inline VLAN pair interfaces of an IPS sensor device begins to fail (new  TCP connections may not establish, existing TCP connections may be dropped or otherwise  negatively impacted).  Signature 1330.14 (TCP Drop - RST or SYN in Window) begins firing/triggering on traffic for  affected TCP connections. Signatures 1330.12 (TCP Drop - Segment Out Of Order) and/or  1330.18 (TCP Drop - Segment out of window) may also be observed to be firing/triggering.  Non-TCP traffic (ex. ICMP) that was successfully traversing the IPS sensor continues to do so  (unaffected).  This condition/state may persist until the IPS sensor device is rebooted or bypass-mode is  engaged/disengaged, at which point, affected traffic returns to normal (working) until this defect is  encountered again.  Conditions: IPS sensor device running affected version of software configured in Inline or Inline VLAN Pair  mode.  Workaround: 1.) [RECOMMENDED] Prior to a fixed release (7.1(9)E4) being made available, upgrade affected  7.1(8)E4, 7.1(8p1)E4, 7.1(8p2)E4 or 7.1(8p3)E4 IPS sensor devices to 7.1(8p4)E4 which  contains the fix for this issue:   http://software.cisco.com/download/special/release.html? config=53f1edf9a8ee69426657660fda5f71d7   2.) [ALTERNATE OPTION] Alternatively, re-configure the IPS sensor device's TCP  Protection Mode from Strict (the default) - Asymmetric, then reboot the IPS sensor device for  the change to take affect:   sensor# conf t  sensor(config)# service analysis-engine   sensor(config-ana)# virtual-sensor vs0  sensor(config-ana-vir)# inline-TCP-evasion-protection-mode asymmetric   sensor(config-ana-vir)# exit  sensor(config-ana)# exit  Apply Changes?[yes]: yes  Warning: Change of TCP evasion protection mode will not take effect until restart.  sensor(config)# exit  sensor# reset  Warning: Executing this command will stop all applications and reboot the node.  Continue with reset? []: yes   3.) [NOT RECOMMENDED] Alternatively, using a Service Account, add the following lines to the  IPS sensor device's /usr/cids/idsRoot/etc/sensorApp.conf file, save the changes, then  reboot the IPS sensor device for the change to take affect:  [BacklogSettings] DisabledActions=4  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 2.6/2.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: After an undetermined amount of uptime (observed frequency of days to weeks), TCP-based traffic previously successfully traversing one (1) or more Inline pair interfaces or Inline VLAN pair interfaces of an IPS sensor device begins to fail (new TCP connections may not establish, existing TCP connections may be dropped or otherwise negatively impacted).Signature 1330.14 (TCP Drop - RST or SYN in Window) begins firing/triggering on traffic for affected TCP connections.Non-TCP traffic (ex. ICMP) that was successfully traversing the IPS sensor continues to do so (unaffected).This condition/state continues until the IPS sensor device is rebooted or bypass-mode is engaged/disengaged, at which point, TCP traffic flow returns to normal (working) until this defect is encountered again.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Title: Clientless WebVPN crash after browser refreshes WebVPN portal page
RNE: Symptoms:  A device running Cisco IOS might reload when the web browser refreshes/reloads the SSL VPN portal page.  Conditions:  Cisco IOS device configured for clientless SSL VPN.  Workaround:  None.  Further Problem Description:  This problem has been seen when the stock Andorid browser visits the SSL VPN portal (after authentication) and refreshes (reloads) the page. However, the issue is not browser-specific and other browsers might trigger the issue too.  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.8/6.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2012-1344 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: After logging into the WebVPN portal with the stock Android web browser (Android 2.3, codenamed ;gingerbread;), refreshing the portal page causes a router crash. This issue does not happen with a normal desktop browser like Firefox.Note: DE indicates that the crash can be triggered by any browser, i.e. it is not Android specific, although the issue has been recreated only with the stock Android browser.There seem to be two separate tracebacks. The first one may lead to the crash recorded by the second one. See attached crashinfo file for details.Router#sh ver | i IOSCisco IOS Software, 2800 Software (C2800NM-ADVSECURITYK9-M), Version 15.1(4)M, RELEASE SOFTWARE (fc1)Last messages:*Aug  2 19:45:46.803: WV-WEBSERVICE: Created HTTP reply header dump*Aug  2 19:45:46.807: WV-WEBSERVICE: Created 10358 byte content data to send to external client for requested file: /cues_taglib/tigra/cuesDrawer_tree_tpl.js*Aug  2 19:45:46.855: %SYS-3-BADLIST_DESTROY: Removed a non-empty list(48876244, name: VW Session List), having 3 elements -Process= ;HTTP Process;, ipl= 0, pid= 209-Traceback= 4316B8F0z 43188844z 4318A3BCz 40C48DB4z 40C421B8z 43188230z 43188518z 42790F34z 42790F18zCMD: 'int Virtual-Access 1' 19:45:46 UTC Tue Aug 2 2011CMD: 'no ip unnumbered' 19:45:46 UTC Tue Aug 2 2011CMD: 'end' 19:45:46 UTC Tue Aug 2 2011*Aug  2 19:45:46.867: %SYS-5-CONFIG_I: Configured from console by console*Aug  2 19:45:46.867: %SYS-6-STACKLOW: Stack for process HTTP Process running low, 0/6000

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers Access Control List Security Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in certain filtering mechanisms of access control lists (ACLs) for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass ACL rules that have been configured for an affected device.  The vulnerability exists because the affected device fails to inspect and match certain traffic that meets the criteria defined in ACL rules configured for the device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP packets to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass certain sets of rules defined in ACLs for the affected device.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170719-asr1  Conditions: Device running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: For information about vulnerable and not vulnerable software releases, and time frame for fixed software releases, please open a support case with your support organization. PSIRT does not provide or maintain this information for Medium SIR advisories.   This is the best available information on affected/not affected/fixed releases as of May 22, 2017. PSIRT will not maintain this information. For updates, please follow up with the DE assigned to this bug.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6672 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: This issue is mainly seen because there is no user-agent in HTTP request header and request method is not GET or POST.

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance URL Filtering Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the URL filtering feature of Cisco AsyncOS Software for Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass a configured URL filter rule.  The vulnerability is due to incomplete validation of the HTTP request. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request through the targeted device. An exploit could allow the attacker to bypass a configured URL filter.  Conditions: This vulnerability affects all releases prior to the first fixed release of Cisco AsyncOS Software for Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA), both virtual and hardware appliances, that are configured with URL filters for email scanning.  Workaround: The fix to this issue shall be available in the 11.0 release targeted for April End 2017  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3870 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: We are able to bypass URL filtering on the WSA in transparent mode by spoofing the Host header from the client.For example, if we block www.purple.com on the WSA, the client can send a request to the IP address of purple.com, with a Host header of something that's not blocked, say www.google.com.  The WSA will not block this request.-------------------------c:\curl\src>curl -vvv -H ;Host: www.google.com; http://www.purple.com* Rebuilt URL to: http://www.purple.com/* timeout on name lookup is not supported*   Trying 153.104.63.227...* TCP_NODELAY set* Connected to www.purple.com (153.104.63.227) port 80 (#0)> GET / HTTP/1.1> Host: www.google.com> User-Agent: curl/7.52.1> Accept: */*>< HTTP/1.1 200 OK< Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 17:53:00 GMT< Server: Chaos< ETag: ;af6-542e81b9a4449;< Accept-Ranges: bytes< Keep-Alive: timeout=5, max=100< Content-Length: 2806< Content-Type: text/html< Last-Modified: Mon, 05 Dec 2016 12:05:46 GMT< Via: 1.1 rtp5-dmz-wsa-2-old-mgmt.cisco.com:80 (Cisco-WSA/9.0.1-162), 1.1 bananas.csts-rtp.lab:80 (Cisco-WSA/9.1.2-010)< Connection: keep-alive1483984467.271 1166 192.168.100.5 TCP_MISS/200 3195 GET http://www.google.com/ - DIRECT/www.google.com text/html DEFAULT_CASE_12-DefaultGroup-DefaultGroup-NONE-NONE-NONE-DefaultGroup <IW_srch,5.7,0,;-;,0,0,0,1,;-;,-,-,-,;-;,1,-,;-;,;-;,-,-,IW_srch,-,;Unknown;,;-;,;Google;,;Search Engine;,;-;,;-;,21.92,0,-,;Unknown;,;-;,1,;-;,-,-,;-;,;-;> -^^^^^ This was the request to purple.com with spoofed Host header-------------------------This also applies to HTTPS.  If we set www.bankofamerica.com to Drop in the decryption policy but spoof the HTTP host header to www.google.com, we are not dropped/blocked.  See SS-Review enclosure for more info.

Title: Autonomic Networking Infrastructure Adjacency Discovery DoS Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Autonomic Networking Infrastructure (ANI) feature of Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.    The vulnerability is due to incomplete input validation on certain crafted packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability sending a crafted IPv6 packet to a device that is running a Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software release that supports the ANI feature.    A device must meet two conditions to be affected by this vulnerability:  The device must be running a version of Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software that supports ANI (regardless of whether ANI is configured)  The device must have a reachable IPv6 interface    An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the affected device to reload.    Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There is a workaround that addresses this vulnerability.    This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170320-aniipv6    Note: Also see the companion advisory for affected devices that are configured as an autonomic registrar: Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Autonomic Networking Infrastructure Registrar Denial of Service Vulnerability at the following link https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170320-ani  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software devices that support the ANI feature. A device must meet two conditions to be affected by this vulnerability:    The device must be running a version of Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software that supports ANI (regardless of whether ANI is configured)  The device must have a reachable IPv6 interface    Please see the Cisco IOS XE Software Checker:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x  Workaround: Workarounds are available.  Please consult the advisory for details on possible mitigations and workarounds.  Further Problem Description: Cisco has confirmed that this vulnerability does not affect Cisco IOS XR Software, or Cisco NX-OS Software.    PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X    CVE ID CVE-2017-3850 has been assigned to document this issue.    Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: An external security researcher has reported the following Denial-of-Service condition:Cisco Devices running IOS-XE are prone to a Denial-of-Service condition bysending specifically crafted Autonomic Networking Adjacency Discoverypackets.See Big-Description for full details.

Description: I configure file policy which supposed to block malware fails. I enabled SMB file inspection in NAT policy. I found in the following TZ article: https://techzone.cisco.com/t5/Intrusion-Detection-Snort-SRU/Firepower-6-0-Snort-SMB-File-Processing-Troubleshooting/ta-p/849754;SMB2/3 file transfer can use different sessions for the same file. Title: ISR4221 router crashed on fw_icmp6_get_ntuple
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptom: Router (DMVPN client router) crashes everytime when an ICMPv6 packets (with bigger size than the configured MTU) are sent from the test client connected to the client site to the hub site, and due to the higher MTU fragmentation is performed on the IPv6 packets.  Conditions: DMVPN setup with a DMVPN hub router and a DMVPN spoke router.   Each spoke router has multiple tunnels to the two central DMVPN routers:  pre-shared key authenticated provisioning tunnel in a VRF,  pre-shared key authenticated production tunnel in the global routing table  and certificate based authenticated tunnel in the global routing table.   The IP MTU (IPv4 and IPv6) of the MGRE tunnel interfaces are set to 1300 byte.  Workaround: None  Further Problem Description:
Description: During an IPv6 PMTUD and fragmentation test, a Cisco ISR4221 router crashed after a test client sends a 1500 byte IPv6 packet to Cisco ISR4221 router.DMVPN test setup with two DMVPN hub routers and two DMVPN spoke routers. Each spoke router has multiple tunnels to the two central DMVPN routers: pre-shared key authenticated provisioning tunnel in a VRF, pre-shared key authenticated production tunnel in the global routing table and certificate based authenticated tunnel in the global routing table. The IP MTU (IPv4 and IPv6) of the MGRE tunnel interfaces are set to 1300 byte. During the test mentioned above, a test client connected to the remote site sends a 1500 byte IPv6 packet to the central site. It was expected, that the remote DMVPN router sends an ICMPv6 Packet Too Big (MTU of next hop 1300 byte) to the test client. Unfortunately, the remote DMVPN router (Cisco ISR4221 router) crashed and the following logging output can be seen: dest515x-lbwnr223# 000072: Mar 16 15:39:27.116 CET: %IOSXE_OIR-6-OFFLINECARD: Card (fp) offline in slot F0 000073: Mar 16 15:39:27.086 CET: %CPPHA-3-FAULT:  SIP0: cpp_ha_top_level_server:  CPP:0.0 desc:Data Plane Failed det:DRVR(non-interrupt) class:DP_SW sev:FATAL id:0 cppstate:STOPPED res:UNKNOWN flags:0x7 cdmflags:0x0 000075: Mar 16 15:39:27.246 CET: %CPPDRV-3-LOCKDOWN:  SIP0: fman_fp_image:  QFP0.0 CPP Driver LOCKDOWN encountered due to previous fatal error (SW: Ucode process fault). 000076: Mar 16 15:39:27.285 CET: %CPPOSLIB-3-ERROR_NOTIFY:  SIP0: fman_fp_image:  fman_fp encountered an error -Traceback= 1#0fbac4462b417138db8b5e76c101eb3f   errmsg:7FADB48C7000+1C24 cpp_common_os dest515x-lbwnr223#:7FAD94E56000+DB8C cpp_common_os:7FAD94E56000+1B97E cpp_crypto_device_lib:7FAD8AF62000+DE04 crypto_device_host_api:7FADCEBA8000+586A imgr:7FADCF83D000+1A67C imgr:7FADCF83D000+1C13C evlib:7FAD9AB28000+8D25 evlib:7FAD9AB28000+95FC :400000+35543F :400000+352727 c:7FAD83535000+219A5 :400000+1C6569

Title: Cisco Prime Infrastructure Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A Vulnerability in the web framework code of the Cisco Prime Infrastructure could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attack against the user of the web interface of the affected system.   The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of some parameters passed to the web-server. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the user to access a malicious link or by intercepting the user request and injecting the malicious code. An exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected site or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  Conditions: Exposure is not configuration dependent.  Workaround: Not applicable or available.  Further Problem Description Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigations can be found at: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html  This vulnerability has been disclosed in the following advisory: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170301-cpi  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2017-3848  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: /webacs/api/v1 is vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting (XSS) via the parameters ;id; and ;preid;. This was found during an automated scan using HP WebInspect test tool. It is recommended to sanitize the input parameters properly.Here are some sample requests:{{{GET /webacs/api/v1/?id=tutorials';!@$^*\/:;.,?{}[]`~-_<iMg/SrC=;;oNeRrOr=alert(38417)> HTTP/1.1GET /webacs/api/v1/?id=curl-sample-client-code-doc&preid=sample-client-code-doc';!@$^*\/:;.,?{}[]`~-_<iMg/SrC=;;oNeRrOr=alert(22551)> HTTP/1.1}}}

Title: Prime License Manager unauthorized access vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the upgrade mechanism of Cisco collaboration products based on the Cisco Voice Operating System software platform could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to gain unauthorized, elevated access to an affected device.  The vulnerability occurs when a refresh upgrade or Prime Collaboration Deployment (PCD) migration is performed on an affected device. When a refresh upgrade or PCD migration is completed successfully, an engineering flag remains enabled and could allow root access to the device with a known password.  If the vulnerable device is subsequently upgraded using the standard upgrade method to an Engineering Special Release, service update, or a new major release of the affected product, this vulnerability is remediated by that action.  Note: Engineering Special Releases that are installed as COP files, as opposed to the standard upgrade method, do not remediate this vulnerability.  An attacker who can access an affected device over SFTP while it is in a vulnerable state could gain root access to the device. This access could allow the attacker to compromise the affected system completely.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.   This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-vos  Conditions: Devices running an affected Voice Operating System platform and have met the conditions to be vulnerable are affected.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 9.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Cisco VOSS based products that have undergone a Refresh or PCD upgrade may contain a default root password.  This account may be leveraged to completely compromise the device.

Title: core-engine.log prints password in clear text
RNE: Symptom: During TC-NAC adapter configuration and reconfiguration core-engine.log shows all exchanges between  core engine and target adapter. At time of those exchanges user credentials are sent to adapter multiple and  password is printed in the clear text.  Conditions: TC-NAC adapter configuration or reconfiguration  Workaround: NA  Further Problem Description: None  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 2.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: During TC-NAC adapter configuration and reconfiguration core-engine.log shows all exchanges between core engine and target adapter. At time of those exchanges user credentials are sent to adapter multiple and password is printed in the clear text which mean that whoever has access to ISE log files can get information about customer credentials (Like username/password to access Qualys cloud).

Title: Insufficient XSS protection in ccmivr page
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in several parameters of the ccmivr request of Cisco Unified Communication Manager (CallManager) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web interface on the affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of some parameters used by that page.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the user of the system to follow an attacker supplied link.  An exploit could allow the attacker to cause arbitrary script or HTML code to be executed on the users browser within the context of the affected application.  Conditions: when hackers sends ccmivr request with cross site scripting attack  Workaround: None  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2016-6472  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: The ccmivr page, IVRReturntoMain.do, has previously been vulnerable toXSS attacks through CSCut19580 (CVE-2015-4272).  The changes committedto fix that defect implement a homegrown blacklist filter that attemptsto remove malicious input.  Not only is the list of regex matchesincomplete (which is often the case with blacklists), but the sequentialnature of its application makes it trivial for an attacker to bypass.For example, the following URL will allow injection:cucmserver/ccmivr/IVRReturntoMain.do?ccmusername=username&remotedest=%27%22%3E%3Cscripjavascript:t%3Ealert%28123%29%3C/scripvbscript:t%3EWhere 'username' is a valid user that has 'Enable Mobile Voice Access'configured on a CUCM ('cucmserver') with 'Enable Mobile Voice Access'enabled globally.  Matched 'bad' data is removed by the current filter,ultimately leaving the malicious javascript code.XSS prevention is a mandatory PSB element through SEC-WEB-XSS[1].Please also refer to the corresponding XSS recipe [2] for moreinformation about existing libraries and frameworks that can be used tomitigate XSS instead of attempting to create a custom preventionmechanism.[1] http://csdl-web.cisco.com/cserv/DevTasks#SEC-WEB-XSS[2] https://cisco.jiveon.com/docs/DOC-844372
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: joberrio           This issue is being considered for possible inclusion in a Security Advisory even though the Release-note Enclosure is already visible to customers.  Please do not further change the Release-note Enclosure;  PSIRT will modify it appropriately at a later date.          Do not provide customers with any information beyond what is currently contained in the Release-note Enclosure.          Should customers appear to be running into this DDTs within their network,  please bring it to the immediate attention of the Cisco PSIRT  at psirt@cisco.com.

Title: Cisco Firepower System Software Secure Sockets Layer Policy Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) Decryption and Inspection feature of Cisco Firepower System Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass the SSL policy for decrypting and inspecting traffic on an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to unexpected interaction with Known Key and Decrypt and Resign configuration settings of SSL policies when the affected software receives unexpected SSL packet headers. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted SSL packet through an affected device in a valid SSL session. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass the SSL decryption and inspection policy for the affected system, which could allow traffic to flow through the system without being inspected.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170802-fpw  Conditions: This vulnerability exists on any software version prior to the first fixed which has the configuration SSL Inspection Policy configuration with either ''Known Key'' or ''Decrypt/Resign'' settings.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6766 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: A crafted SSL packet can cause decryption to fail which prevents data from being inspected. This was found in development testing. We do not have any indication that an exploit has been found or used externally.

Title: (SSP) CLI Command Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in CLI of the Cisco Unified Computing System Manager, Cisco Firepower 4100 Series Next-Generation Firewall, and Cisco Firepower 9300 Security Appliance could allow an authenticated, local attacker to perform a command injection attack.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting crafted command arguments into a vulnerable CLI command. An exploit could allow the attacker to read or write arbitrary files at the user?s privilege level outside the expected path and gain access to other devices.  Workaround: None  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6602 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The ;ssh; command in the local-mgmt shell allows users to manipulate argumentspassed to ssh on the command line. This could allow users to load arbitrary ssh_configfiles, bypassing intended restrictions on port forwarding. In addition, using shell IOredirection, this issue can be used to read and write arbitrary files on the system (withthe privileges of the logged-in user) by connecting to an attacker-controlled ssh server.For example:Forwarding sensitive ports:  ssh '-F /dev/null -R 8021:127.5.1.1:8021 josconno@10.1.1.100'Writing arbitrary files:  ssh 'josconno@10.1.1.100 > /tmp/file'These examples are not intended to be exhaustive.To fix these issues, all user input, and especially arguments to shell commands,should be validated to ensure they meet the expected format, preferably with a whitelist. In this case that means validating that the hostname argument specifies a valid hostname.

Title: MCU Software Memory Exhaustion Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the network stack of Cisco TelePresence MCU Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the exhaustion of available memory which could lead to system instability and a reload of the affected system.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141015-mcu  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS sscores as of the time of evaluation are 7.8/6.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-3397 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Over a period of time the MCU can run out of memory and restart when lots of TCP RST messages are sent from a IE9 client. IE9 occasionally sends a TCP reset flag instead of closing a TCP connection with a FIN. This triggers a list of warning messages in the event log and over a period of time (weeks, months etc depending on the number of RST messages) the MCU can run out of memory and restart. When this problem happens, the MCU event log usually shows the following warning messages: NETWORK : Warning : netman[44]: getpeername(new connection) failed: Socket is not connectedNETWORK : Warning : getpeername() failed: Socket is not connectedNETWORK : Warning : getsockname() failed: Invalid argument

Conditions: IPv6 packet with fragment header extension along with other headers can cause this.  Workaround: There is no workaround for this problem.  Further Problem Description:

Title: Cisco Identity Service Engine Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
RNE: _PSIRT  Symptom: A vulnerability in the restricted shell of the Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) that is accessible via SSH could allow an authenticated, local attacker to run arbitrary CLI commands with elevated privileges.  The vulnerability is due to incomplete input validation of the user input for CLI commands issued at the restricted shell. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the targeted device and executing commands that could lead to elevated privileges. An attacker would need valid user credentials to the device to exploit this vulnerability.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171101-ise  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: Not applicable or available.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12261 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: By default OS level access to the system is disabled and only a restricted CLI is provided via SSH. VA testers found a way to break out from the restricted shell and gain OS level access.Telnet has a feature; it can write out a trace file containing the various telnet commands sent over the wire. Please note that these are not shell commands; they are telnet protocol commands that define for example the size of the terminal. Most of these commands don't take user input (and hence telnet won't log anything useful) except for the send environment variable command, which will send over the contents of an environment variable if the remote server supports it (otherwise we'll get an error saying that sending environment variables is not enabled).As the restricted shell has suid root rights it's possible to write the trace file to anywhere. If the attacker can achieve that the trace file is run via bash/sh...etc a command injected to the log would be executed also. VA testers found multiple ways to execute the injected code such as overriding the restricted shell, put a file under /etc/profile.d/, put the trace file in CRON...etc, please note that the list may not full.During the scenario shown below the tracefile was set to /opt/system/bin/carssh.sh.screen and was overridden.Set trace file to the shell script which starts the restricted shell:Please refer to the zip file for customer screen shots of the PoC.

Title: Cisco ASA DHCPv6 Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: ASA crash in Thread Name: DHCPv6 Relay when processing a DHCPv6 packet  Conditions: DHCPv6 relay should be enabled. To verify if this feature is enabled use the show run ipv6 dhcprelay and verify that it is enabled at least on one interface  ipv6 dhcprelay enable if name   DHCPv4 relay is not affected by this issue.  Workaround: There is no workaround other then disabling the DHCPv6 relay feature  Further Problem Description: A vulnerability in DHCP code of Cisco ASA Software could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause the reload of an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of crafted or malformed DHCP version 6 (v6) packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted DHCPv6 packet to the affected system.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.1/5.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-2182 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2182  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Customer has an Active/Active pair of mixed-mode ASAs running 9.1(4). The ASA crashed several times with the following page fault:   Thread Name: DHCPv6 Relay   Page fault: Address not mapped<snip>          rip 0x0000000000b772d2 <dhcpv6_relay_binding_lookup+34 at ipv6/../slib/include/byteorder.h:110><snip>          cr2 0x0000000000001722   Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance Software Version 9.1(4)   Compiled on Thu 05-Dec-13 20:21 PST by builders   Hardware:   WS-SVC-ASA-SM1   Crashinfo collected on 15:13:39.249 mez Sat Mar 1 2014   Traceback:   0: 0x00000000004225e8 <snap_mini_dump+120 at finesse/snap.c:694>   1: 0x0000000000422622 <snap_dump+50 at finesse/snap.c:2154>   2: 0x00000000004247c1 <snap_handler+449 at finesse/snap.c:2473>   3: 0x000000000135c939 <lina_sigcrash+1817 at lina/linux/lina.c:2326>   4: 0x00007ffffecd65f0   5: 0x0000000000b78bf5 <dhcpv6_relay_process+3893 at ipv6/ipv6_dhcp_relay.c:628>   6: 0x0000000000428d45 <t_start+101 at finesse/thread.c:314>   We were able to gather captures during the crash and found that it is triggered by a Nokia wireless device, which was not setting any client ID in its request. The ASA relays this and crashes when the DHCP server responds with a Relay-Reply that also does not contain a client ID.

Title: cpu ACL does not block ssh to virtual ip, however telnet does
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Virtual Wireless LAN Controllers fail to properly implement Virtual CPU Access Control Lists that have been configured to restrict access to the  private virtual management address.  Conditions: Cisco Virtual Wireless LAN Controllers running WLC software version 7.4 are affected.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: This issue does not allow an attacker to bypass any forms of authentication.  An attacker that did access the private virtual management interface would  need to provide valid credentials to gain access to the device.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  3.3/3.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: WLC - 7.4.100.0Attached - WLC's show run-config, screenshots, network info.Issue #1 Guest wireless clients were able to access management of WLC via SSH/Telnet using virtual ip. Is it expected by design/bug.Issue #2 cpu ACL does not block ssh to virtual ip of wlc, however telnet does. Current workaround: disable management via wireless on WLC. Cust not ok with this workaround. And doesn't want to relay on cpu acl to block management traffic to wlc.Management via wireless is enabled, global ssh were enabled, management via dyn is disabled. These are the different issues observed.#1 unable to block ssh to virtual ip using cpu acl rule for w.less client, however able to block telnet using cpu acl. https allowed for webauth. Check the both screenshots attached. It seem to be a bug.#2 ssh and telnet were blocked using cpu acl rules but ports are seem to be opened for virtual ip - nmap tool - ssh, telnet, snpp, http, https. no matter what is blocked still it shows these ports are open. It seem to be a bug as well based on this info from http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/ps6366/products_tech_note09186a0080a7c988.shtml  It seem to be a bug per this doc.#3 if global ssh is disabled but management via wireless is enabled. Cpu acl set to none here.@ you can ssh and access mgmt controller through virtual ip. Unable to access telnet, it seem ssh is wide open. It seem to be a bug.@ nmap shows all the ports are open#4 if global ssh is disable and mgmt via wirless is also disabled. Cpu acl set to none here. ? Works as expected.@ cannot access the virtual port through ssh@ nmap still shows all the ports as open

Title: NAM: Investigate multiple WPA/WPA2 Vulnerabilties
RNE: Symptom: The Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client - Network Access Manager implements a WPA supplicant and as such is affected by the WPA protocol vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) ID:  CVE-2017-13078: reinstallation of the group key in the 4-way handshake CVE-2017-13080: reinstallation of the group key in the group key handshake  As disclosed in https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171016-wpa  This product is not affected by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2017-13077: reinstallation of the pairwise key in the 4-way handshake CVE-2017-13079: reinstallation of the integrity group key in the 4-way handshake CVE-2017-13081: reinstallation of the integrity group key in the group key handshake CVE-2017-13082: accepting a retransmitted FT Reassociation Request and reinstalling the pairwise key while processing it CVE-2017-13086: reinstallation of the Tunneled Direct-Link Setup (TDLS) PeerKey (TPK) key in the TDLS handshake CVE-2017-13087: reinstallation of the group key (GTK) when processing a Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frame CVE-2017-13088: reinstallation of the integrity group key (IGTK) when processing a Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frame  Conditions: Exposure is not configuration dependent.  Workaround: Not available.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.3:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
