Title: Cisco MDS 9000 Series Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability within the high availability (HA) subsystem of Cisco NX-OS running on MDS 9000 series devices could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted traffic to the affected device.  Conditions: The following Cisco MDS 9000 Series devices running an affected version of Cisco NX-OS Software:  Cisco MDS platforms affected in NX-OS 5.2 train:   Cisco MDS 9513 Multilayer Director   Cisco MDS 9509 Multilayer Director   Cisco MDS 9506 Multilayer Director   Cisco DS 9222i Multiservice Modular Switch   Cisco MDS 9148 Multilayer Fabric Switch   Cisco MDS 9134 Multilayer Fabric Switch   Cisco MDS 9124 Multilayer Fabric Switch   Cisco MDS 8-Gb Fabric Switch for HP c-Class Blade System   Cisco MDS 4-Gbps Fabric Switch for HP c-Class BladeSystem   Cisco MDS 4-Gbps Fabric Switch for IBM BladeCenter  Cisco MDS platforms affected in NX-OS 6.2 train:   Cisco MDS 9710 Multilayer Director   Cisco MDS 9706 Multilayer Director   Cisco MDS 9148s 16G Multilayer Fabric Switch   Cisco MDS 9250i Multiservice Fabric Switch   Cisco MDS 9513 Multilayer Director   Cisco MDS 9509 Multilayer Director   Cisco MDS 9506 Multilayer Director   Cisco MDS 9222i Multiservice Modular Switch   Cisco MDS 9148 Multilayer Fabric Switch   Cisco MDS 8-Gb Fabric Switch for HP c-Class Blade System  No MDS linecards or external applications are affected by this vulnerability.  Workaround: Switch over to the standby supervisor in a dual supervisor system or reload the system in a single supervisor system. Please note that this will disrupt traffic in the single supervisor system.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  5/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=&version=2.0 dispatch=1&version=2&vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C CVE ID CVE-2015-0582 has been assigned to document this issue. http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0582 Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: ASR1K with pppoe subscribers block overrun crash
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in PPPoE processing code of Cisco IOS XE could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a reload of the affected device  and eventually a denial of service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to improper processing of certain malformed PPPoE packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a  malformed PPPoE packet to an IOS XE ASR1000 device, configured with PPPoE termination. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a reload of  the affected device and eventually a denial of service (DoS) condition.  Conditions: Cisco ASR 1000 with IOS XE, configured for PPPoE termination.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: A device crashing, may print the following messages on the console:    %SYS-3-OVERRUN: Block overrun at 7F7FAE750B58 (red zone 44534C5F00000000) %SYS-6-MTRACE: mallocfree: addr, pc ? %SYS-6-BLKINFO: Corrupted redzone blk 7F7FAE750B58, words 404, alloc 6374D1B, InUse, dealloc 10001, rfcnt 1 ? %Software-forced reload   Exception to IOS Thread: Frame pointer 0x7F7FA0AB5AD8, PC = 0x7F80A8469565   UNIX-EXT-SIGNAL: Aborted(6), Process = Check heaps -Traceback= 1#c3a5522ccb47820b036322d6b7226e1c  c:7F80A8438000+31565    Fastpath Thread backtrace:  -Traceback= 1#c3a5522ccb47820b036322d6b7226e1c  c:7F80A8438000+BDDD2    Auxiliary Thread backtrace:  -Traceback= 1#c3a5522ccb47820b036322d6b7226e1c  pthread:7F80A3697000+A7C9    PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. Title: Going to upgrade_control.html without being logged in causes MCU to segf
RNE: Symptoms:  A vulnerability in the Cisco TelePresence multipoint control unit (MCU) contains a vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to trigger a reload of an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient sanitization of TCP packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a sequence of TCP packets to the affected system.  Conditions: An affected system with software version 4.5(1.45).  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None. PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5.4/4.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0621 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: On an MCU running 4.5(1.45), going to the page http://ip_address/upgrade_control.html (where ip_address is the IP address of the MCU) while you are not logged in causes an unexpected restart.As this can be done without logging in, it could be used in a denial of service attack.This can also be done with HTTPS, i.e. the link https://ip_address/upgrade_control.html
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Title: ASA may reload with traceback related to SSH, PING, DHCP, or IPSEC
RNE: Symptom:  ASA may reload with a traceback in one of the following thread names:  Thread Name: DATAPATH-x-xxxx (Datapath can have different numbers here) Thread Name: DHCP Client Thread Name: SSH  Conditions:  Affects all ASA platforms.   Workaround: None PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5.4/5.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-6390 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: While running AnyConnect IKEv2 throughput performance tests, a traceback was encountered on 100.8.0.106, as well as 100.7.20.4.  It appears that that the traceback occurs after the tunnels are torn down.  However, it does not appear to be occurring the first few times tunnels are brought up and torn down.  Instead, it happens a few iterations in of a binary search.  Strangely however, this issue not seem to be encountered for the IKEv2 TPS test.  The main difference between the two is the type and the amount of data being passed.  The throughput test passes a large amount of SIP/UDP data, while the TPS test passes a small amount of HTTP data.Testing was performed using the Shenick diversifEye.  For the test in question, 100 IKEv2 users are brought up and data is passed for a few minutes.  After which the tunnels are then brought, down.  This is repeated, changing how much data is being passed each time to perform a binary search.This traceback appears to be very consistent, and easily reproducible.  It appears to happen on both SMP and LINA platforms, and happened for every test.  No coredump is currently available, but can most likely be provided if necessary.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT.  PSIRT has provided a public Release-note Enclosure (RNE) for this issue which is visible on Cisco.com. Title: Cisco Firepower Detection Engine SSL Decryption Memory Consumption Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in SSL traffic decryption for Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause depletion of system memory. If this memory leak persists over time, a denial of service (DoS) condition could develop because traffic can cease to be forwarded through the device.  The vulnerability is due to an error in how the inspection engine (snort) handles SSL traffic decryption and notifications to and from the Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) handler. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a steady stream of malicious Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) traffic through the device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a DoS condition when the device runs low on system memory.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171004-ftd  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation:The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:XCVE ID  CVE-2017-12245 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco 1000 Series Connected Grid Routers SNMP BRIDGE MIB Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) BRIDGE Management Information Base (MIB)  of the Cisco 1000 Series Connected Grid Routers could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial  of service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to a faulty implementation of certain SNMP OIDs within the BRIDGE MIB.  An SNMP request for certain Object Identifiers (OIDs) within the BRIDGE MIB can cause the  device to reload unexpectedly. If an attacker knows the SNMP community string, they could exploit  this vulnerability by performing an authenticated SNMP request of the BRIDGE MIB OID to an  affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a DoS as it could reload for each SNMP request.  Conditions: A device with SNMP configured running an affected version of software.  Workaround: 1.	SNMP can be removed from the configured.  2.	SNMP can be configured but cease polling of any BRIDGE MIB OIDs.  No Forthhcoming fix planned. We cannot reproduced it in lab. Customer upgraded to 15.5-3M2 and the SNMP workaround. Problem is not seen any more. Need to know if that M2 version already fixed the problem.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.8/6.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2016-1333 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: SNMP String query to 0x0ED74AC crashes routerCustomer had around 20 devices that were intermittently reloading during operational hours. The stack trace shows that SNMPd is causing the crash, when queried for 1.3.6.1.2.1.17.4.4.1. This is from a management system that they use for all their devices.First of all access to any SNMP OID should not reload a router, so we should not just check for this OID, but overview SNMPd on the CGR platform for this problem.We could not reproduce this in the lab, but the customer had over 20 devices that were affected. The workaround provided to the customer (and in RNE) stopped the reload from occurring.Stack trace:   cgr1000 - cgr1000 platform running 15.5(3)M experienced a crash at|    2016-01-01 11:28:40.|    The previous UPTIME before this crash was: 00:02:11|    The decoded stack traces are:|    0x0BDB729 pm_platform_get_idb_from_gid|    0x0BDB6A6 pm_platform_get_idb_from_bridge_portnumber|    0x0BBBACE pm_port_get_cookie_from_bridge_portnumber|    0x0ED4ECB stp_bmib_get_port_info|    0x0ED74AC stp_k_dot1dTpPortEntry_get|    0x3641066 k_dot1dTpPortEntry_get|    0x3640F97 dot1dTpPortEntry_get|    0x340C502 GetNextObjectInstanceCore|    0x3411B16 do_response|    0x33FFB2E SrDoSnmp

Title: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance WebVPN Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA)  could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against  a user of the web-based management interface of an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management  interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of  the interface to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the interface or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at:      https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoAppliedMitigationBulletin/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss     https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170802-asa1  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6765 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

They did not use any scanning tools so there isn't a specific report with details. Title: Cisco VDS Service Manager Information Disclosure Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in Representational State Transfer (REST) Application Programming Interface (API)  Cisco Videoscape Distribution Suite Service Manager could allow an unauthenticated, remote  attacker to cause the device to disclose sensitive information.  The vulnerability is due to lack of proper input validation of the HTTP request to the REST API. An  attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP requests with specific URLs to the  REST API of the affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information  from the device that should not be available to a non-authenticated user.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score.  The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/3.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:POC/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6364  has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: VDS-SM vulnerability: unsecured RESTful APICustomer: ITALTEL Background: in view of the possibility of giving access to Sky (with a specific user) to the console of the VDS-SM (thus placing the console on the Internet), it was made a PenetrationTest on the console (using the user t_penetration). Customer is reporting several vulnerabilities as a result of this test. Vulnerability: given a list of names, check, without authentication, if there are users with these names and get some information on them by just pointing to the UI node. Impact: Obtained username, name and real last name is easy to create wordlist password plausible for attacks bruteforcing.Troubleshooting Performed: I've been able to replicate it in my lab, pointing to the UI node. Example: http://10.50.214.134:8080/bnimgmt/resources/user/admin/user/permission/serortiz/CDNMGR response: json response contains the details for this test user... which is what customer is complaining about: {;BNIAdmin;:true,;realname;:;Sergio Ortiz;,;roles;:;CDNManager;,;userId;:4,;username;:;serortiz;} We must secure this RESTful API to avoid this and any other possible sensitive information leakage.

Title: Cisco NX-OS System Software Unauthorized User Account Deletion Vulnerability
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptoms: A vulnerability in the user role ''network-operator'' implementation for Cisco NX-OS System Software  could allow an authenticated, local attacker to improperly delete valid user accounts. The ''network-operator''  role should not be able to delete other configured users on the device.  The vulnerability is due to lack of proper Role Based Access Control (RBAC) checking for the actions a user  with the ''network-operator'' role is allowed to perform. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticate  to the device with user credentials that give that user the ''network-operator'' role. An exploit could allow the  attacker to impact the integrity of the device by deleting configured user credentials. The attacker would need  valid user credentials for the device.  Please refer to the security advisory at https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180117-nxos1 for additional information.  Conditions: This vulnerability exists in software release 7.0(3)I6(1) and is present until the first fixed release.   Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2018-0092 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Intrusion Prevention System Device Manager Information Disclosure Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of the Cisco Intrusion Prevention System Device Manager (IDM) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to view sensitive information stored within certain HTML comments.  The vulnerability is due to improper masking of sensitive data within certain HTML comments. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the application and navigating to certain configuration screens. An exploit could allow the attacker to discover certain sensitive data which should be restricted and could be used to conduct further attacks.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration, running an affected version of Cisco software.  Workaround: Issue resolved and verified in software release 07.3(00)C98.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT). Title: Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Cluster Management Protocol Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco Cluster Management Protocol (CMP) processing code in Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a reload of an affected device or remotely execute code with elevated privileges.  The Cluster Management Protocol utilizes Telnet internally as a signaling and command protocol between cluster members. The vulnerability is due to the combination of two factors:   * The failure to restrict the use of CMP-specific Telnet options only to internal, local communications between cluster members and instead accept and process such options over any Telnet connection to an affected device, and  * The incorrect processing of malformed CMP-specific Telnet options.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malformed CMP-specific Telnet options while establishing a Telnet session with an affected Cisco device configured to accept Telnet connections. An exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain full control of the device or cause a reload of the affected device.  Cisco will release software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170317-cmp  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 9.8:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3881 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Wikileaks https://wikileaks.org/ciav7p1/cms/page_17760451.htmlIt shows a telnet exploit with remote code execution.We have reproduced a crash involving a buffer overflow in CMP which has the same symptoms as their telnet exploit.Further work is required to turn the crash into remote code execution but since we see that PC and SP are under our control, you can assume it's doable.Contact xabrouck@cisco.com for repro details.Workaround : turn off telnet, use SSH.

Title: Cisco Smart Net Total Care Portal: SQL Injection Vulnerability in Contracts Details page
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco Smart Net Total Care (SNTC) portal could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform a read-only, blind SQL injection attack, which could allow the attacker to compromise the confidentiality of the system through SQL timing attacks. The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of certain user-supplied fields that are subsequently used to build SQL queries.   The issue has been resolved in SNTC 3.11 release.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170802-sntc  Conditions: This was already addressed in the SNTC portal software version 3.11 released on Jul 7th 2017.  Workaround: NA  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6754 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco IOS XE Software Locator/ID Separation Protocol Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Locator/ID Separation Protocol (LISP) of Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker using an x  tunnel router to bypass authentication checks done for registering Endpoint Identifier (EID) to Routing Locator (RLOC) in the map server/map  resolver (MS/MR).  The vulnerability is due to a logic error introduced via a code regression. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending specific valid map- registration requests, which will be accepted by the MS/MR even if the authentication keys do not match. An exploit could allow the attacker to inject  invalid mappings of EID to RLOC in the MS/MR.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170927-lisp  This advisory is part of the September 27, 2017, release of the Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication, which  includes 12 Cisco Security Advisories that describe 13 vulnerabilities. For a complete list of the advisories and links to them, see the '' Cisco Event  Response: September 2017 Semiannual Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication'' which is available at  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-63410  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco devices that are running a vulnerable release of a Cisco IOS XE Software. See the published advisory for more  information.  Please see the Cisco IOS XE Software Checker tool for information on non-vulnerable, vulnerable and fixed releases. This tool is available at  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x  Workaround: See published advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12236 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: crash during out of order tcp flow with fin while using canary debugging
RNE: Symptom: Sensor crashes while receiving an out of order TCP flow that is prematurely terminated with a FIN packet.   Conditions: This crash may occur on 7.0(4) sensors that have been running for long periods of time. This may be artificially reproduced by using ojmalloc or canary malloc libraries.  Workaround: Sensor must be reset.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.8/6.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-3900 has been assigned to document this issue. Title: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance Username Enumeration Information Disclosure Vuln.
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web interface of the Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to determine valid usernames. The  attacker could use this information to conduct additional reconnaissance attacks.  The vulnerability is due to the interaction between Lightweight Directory Access  Protocol (LDAP) and SSL Connection Profile when configured together. An attacker  could exploit the vulnerability by doing a username enumeration attack to the ip address of the device. An exploit could allow the attacker to determine valid usernames.  There are workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170802-asa2  Conditions: The device is configured with LDAP and SSL Connection Profile with ''Enable password management''.  Workaround: The ASA administrator can disable on-board password management using the following command:   tunnel-group DefaultWEBVPNGroup general-attributes    no password-management  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation:  Credit: This vulnerability was discovered by Kirk Hayes of Rapid7, Inc.  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6752 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The vulnerable configuration is introduced when the ASA is set up to connect to LDAP, and the Clientless SLL Connection Profile is configured to ; [x] Enable password management ;. Once configured in this way, invalid users trigger a ;Login Failed; message, while valid users with incorrect passwords trigger an ;Authentication Failed; message.  ## Mitigations for R7-2016-04.1To avoid leaking valid user names, ASA administrators can disable on-board password management.```tunnel-group DefaultWEBVPNGroup general-attributes    	no password-management```This was found by an external researcher and reported to PSIRT. Please email psirt@cisco.com for additional information.

Description: 43156 - NTP ntpd Mode 7 Error Response Packet Loop Remote DoSSynopsisThe remote network time service has a denial of service vulnerability.DescriptionThe version of ntpd running on the remote host has a denial of servicevulnerability. It responds to mode 7 error packets with its own mode 7error packets. A remote attacker could exploit this by sending a mode 7error response with a spoofed IP header, setting the source anddestination IP addresses to the IP address of the target. This wouldcause ntpd to respond to itself endlessly, consuming excessive amountsof CPU, resulting in a denial of service.See Also  https://support.ntp.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=1331  SolutionUpgrade to NTP 4.2.4p8 or later.Risk FactorMediumCVSS Base Score6.4 (CVSS2#AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:P)CVSS Temporal Score5.3 (CVSS2#AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:P)References  BID   37255     CVE   CVE-2009-3563     XREF   Secunia:37629     XREF   CERT:568372     XREF   OSVDB:60847

Title: Cisco Unified Presence Server Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco Unified Presence Application could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web interface of the affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of a user-supplied value. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing a user to click on a specific link. Title: AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Arbitrary Code Execution
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Inter-process communication (IPC) channel of Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary code.  The vulnerability is due to missing input sanitization of certain IPC commands. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted messages over the IPC. An exploit could allow the attacker to write to arbitrary user-space memory. This could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code, disclose information, or crash the AnyConnect application.  Conditions: None  Workaround: Not applicable or available.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. Title: Cisco ESC sensitive log access vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco Elastic Services Controller could allow an  authenticated, local unprivileged attacker to access sensitive  information including system accounts credential.  The vulnerability is due to improper protection of sensitive log files . An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by logging into the  system and accessing the unprotected log files. An exploit could allow  the attacker to access sensitive log files which include other systems  credential.  Conditions: This issue affects Cisco Elastic Services Controller  Workaround: none  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6786 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: There are multiple log files that contain user passwords for ConfD and Element Manager in cleartext. This is in direct violation of the SEC-PWD-AUDIT PSB requirement which states that passwords should never be logged [1]. It should be noted that these logs are world-readable which means that even unprivileged users can easily read these passwords.Services that log passwords to these files must be modified to scrub such sensitive information: * escmanager.log * confd/netconf.trace * debug_yangesc.logReferences:[1] https://cserv.cisco.com/library/tasks/CT584/[2] https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/532.html[3] https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/313.html

Title: Secondary Firepower Management Center in pair displays remote storage password in plain text in log
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco Firepower Management Center could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to obtain unauthorized user information. An attacker could use this information to conduct reconnaissance attacks.  The vulnerability is due to verbose output that is returned when the HTTP log file are retrieved from an affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by reading the information disclosed within the log files and potentially conducting further attacks.  Conditions: Devices running an affected version of the  Firepower Management Center software, 6.1.0 and 6.1.0.x.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. Title: Basic Apache Tomcat administration functionality is enabled
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in Cisco Cisco Secure Access Control Server (ACS) may allow authenticated remote attackers to render unreachable the ACS web interface and to execute arbitrary code on the server with the privileges of the web server.  The vulnerability is due to the leftover of a default Tomcat administration web interface. An attacker, in possession of an ACS administrative account, could exploit this vulnerability by accessing the Tomcat administration interface and modifying the ACS application files and web interface configuration. Title: AC VPN: PKCS12 import should not include Root certs
RNE: Symptom: Cisco AnyConnect contains a vulnerability that could allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to cause the client to import an untrusted Root CA  certificate. Under certain circumstances, Cisco AnyConnect client may install an untrusted Root CA certificate during SSL connection establishment,  without prompting a user for confirmation.  Conditions: Under certain circumstances, Cisco AnyConnect may install an untrusted Root CA certificate without prompting a user for confirmation. If during SSL  connection establishment to the SSL gateway, the AnyConnect client installs an untrusted Root CA certificate, it would trust a all the certificates issued  by that Root CA. This attack would require a number of other actions and attacks to be carried in order to be successful.  Workaround: None PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  5.8/5.2: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=&version=2.0 dispatch=1&version=2&vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N/E:POC/RL:U/RC:C CVE ID CVE-2012-5440 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  More Info:
Description: Certificate imports from SCEP and P12 imports from embedded ASA CA feature should not import the Root CA certificate.  This is considered a security issue.

Title: c1900 - SIP ALG inspection module in PAT allows outside connection to be initiated
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptoms: A vulnerability in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) / Application-Layer Gateway (ALG) feature set of the Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to initiate unwanted SIP connections to an affected appliance.  The vulnerability is due to a lack of proper input validation checking mechanisms within an affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by connecting to certain specific unused ports during Port-Address Translation (PAT) operations. An exploit could allow the attacker to conduct further unwanted reconnaissance attacks or gain access to sensitive information.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration running an affected version of software.   Workaround: None.   Further Problem Description: None. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Firepower Detection Engine SSL Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the detection engine reassembly of SSL packets for Cisco Firepower  System Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of  service (DoS) condition due to the Snort process consuming a high level of the CPU.  The vulnerability is due to improper handling of an SSL packet stream. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted SSL packet stream to the detection engine  on the targeted device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a DoS condition due to  the Snort process being consuming a high level of the CPU. The device must be manually  reloaded to recover this condition.  Conditions: The device is configured with an SSL policy that has at least one rule specifying  traffic decryption.  This vulnerability effects all releases until the first fixed software release.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3885 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: infinite loop in ssl_record::decryptWhile running a suite of codenomicon tests we noticed a snort process at 100% cpu. Further investigation points to a loop in ssl_record::decrypt.

Title: Crash seen with pass-thru traffic with mace configuration
RNE: Summary Cisco IOS Software contains a denial of service (DoS) vulnerability in the Wide Area Application Services (WAAS) Express feature that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the router to leak memory or to reload.  Cisco IOS Software also contains a DoS vulnerability in the Measurement, Aggregation, and Correlation Engine (MACE) feature that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the router to reload.  An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending transit traffic through a router configured with WAAS Express or MACE. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the router to leak memory or to reload. Repeated exploits could allow a sustained DoS condition.  Cisco has released free software updates that address these vulnerabilities. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-mace PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.1/5.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Is Firepower 9300 affected by a MITM described in CVE-2016-5387
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Firepower 9300 does not include a version of Apache http_proxy that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability  and  Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2016-5387  This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: NA  Workaround: NA  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2016-5387 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The Apache HTTP Server is affected by a man-in-the-middle vulnerability known as 'httpoxy' due to a failure to properly resolve namespace conflicts in accordance with RFC 3875 section 4.1.18. The HTTP_PROXY environment variable is set based on untrusted user data in the 'Proxy' header of HTTP requests. The HTTP_PROXY environment variable is used by some web client libraries to specify a remote proxy server. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can exploit this, via a crafted 'Proxy' header in an HTTP request, to redirect an application's internal HTTP traffic to an arbitrary proxy server where it may be observed or manipulated. (CVE-2016-5387)

Title: Cisco Policy Suite Radius Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco.  Do not forward this information to mailing lists or newsgroups.  Documentation writers: it is prohibited to publish this Release-note  Enclosure (RNE) until the content has been approved by PSIRT.  PSIRT may  publish a Security Advisory regarding this defect, and the current text of  this RNE will be replaced with appropriate information.  In the event that  a Security Advisory is not published, PSIRT will replace this text with an  appropriate explanation.  More information on PSIRT is available at http//psirt.cisco.com/.   Cisco's public policy on security vulnerability handling can be reviewed at  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html. For further information, send a message to psirt@cisco.com.  (jklimarc-10/19/17) Symptoms: A vulnerability in the RADIUS authentication module of Cisco Policy Suite (CPS) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to log in as a subscriber without a valid password. The attacker does need to have a valid username.  The vulnerability is due to incorrect RADIUS user credential validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to log in as a subscriber.  Conditions: USuM Authorization used for a Domain with RADIUS authentication.  Workaround: Not available.  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.2: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: An Access Accept is sent for Access Requests that either have the correct RADIUS password or a blank RADIUS password.  Invalid passwords are rejected.Blank password succeeds (unexpected):Sending Access-Request of id 34 to 172.20.52.78 port 1812        User-Name = ;pppoe1;        User-Password = ;;        Calling-Station-Id = ;74-86-7a-28-86-8a;        Called-Station-Id = ;111.0.0.1;        Acct-Session-Id = ;001A47CD;        NAS-IP-Address = 172.20.4.125        Service-Type = Framed-User        NAS-Identifier = ;TEST-MUM-ISG.hathway;rad_recv: Access-Accept packet from host 172.20.52.78 port 1812, id=34, length=75        Cisco-Account-Info = ;A512K-DOWN;        Cisco-AVPair = ;accounting-list=QNS_ACCT_LIST;Correct password succeeds (expected):Sending Access-Request of id 92 to 172.20.52.78 port 1812        User-Name = ;pppoe1;        User-Password = ;cisco123;        Calling-Station-Id = ;74-86-7a-28-86-8a;        Called-Station-Id = ;111.0.0.1;        Acct-Session-Id = ;001A47CD;        NAS-IP-Address = 172.20.4.125        Service-Type = Framed-User        NAS-Identifier = ;TEST-MUM-ISG.hathway;rad_recv: Access-Accept packet from host 172.20.52.78 port 1812, id=92, length=75        Cisco-Account-Info = ;A512K-DOWN;        Cisco-AVPair = ;accounting-list=QNS_ACCT_LIST;Incorrect password fails (expected):Sending Access-Request of id 138 to 172.20.52.78 port 1812        User-Name = ;pppoe1;        User-Password = ;cisco1234;        Calling-Station-Id = ;74-86-7a-28-86-8a;        Called-Station-Id = ;111.0.0.1;        Acct-Session-Id = ;001A47CD;        NAS-IP-Address = 172.20.4.125        Service-Type = Framed-User        NAS-Identifier = ;TEST-MUM-ISG.hathway;rad_recv: Access-Reject packet from host 172.20.52.78 port 1812, id=138, length=114        Reply-Message = ;AR07: Failed USUM_AUTHORIZATION password and/or user name do not match Authorization failure;

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance HTTP Response Splitting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a HTTP response splitting attack.  The vulnerability is due to the failure of the application or its environment to properly sanitize input values. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting malicious HTTP headers, controlling the response body, or splitting the response into multiple responses. An exploit could allow the attacker to perform cross-site scripting attacks, cross-user defacement, web cache poisoning, and similar exploits.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-esa  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory  Further Problem Description: The Security Advisory is available at: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-esa  More information can be found at:  https://www.owasp.org/index.php/HTTP_Response_Splitting http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_response_splitting  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12309 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: When performing an HTTP to HTTPS redirect, the ESA GUI allows for HTTP response splitting, as described by OWASP here:https://www.owasp.org/index.php/HTTP_Response_SplittingAn example of this can be seen using a URL like the following (substitute the IP for the IP of a lab appliance):??[johnhes@JOHNHES-M-M057]?[Fri Jul 07 02:10:23]?[~]???? curl -i http://10.250.42.38/%0d%0aSet-Cookie:%20example=ResponseSplitInjectionHTTP/1.0 307 Temporary RedirectServer: glass/1.0 Python/2.6.4Date: Fri, 07 Jul 2017 21:11:42 GMTLocation: https://10.250.42.38/Set-Cookie: example=ResponseSplitInjectionIf you use this same URL in a browser and observe the network section in the browser's developer tools, you will see a cookie named 'example' set to a value of 'ResponseSplitInjection'This defect exists in the EUQ Web UI as well, as you can see below:??[johnhes@JOHNHES-M-M057]?[Fri Jul 07 02:11:42]?[~]???? curl -i http://10.250.42.38:82/%0d%0aSet-Cookie:%20example=ResponseSplitInjectionHTTP/1.0 307 Temporary RedirectServer: glass/1.0 Python/2.6.4Date: Fri, 07 Jul 2017 21:43:43 GMTLocation: https://10.250.42.38:83/Set-Cookie: example=ResponseSplitInjectionThis is regarded as an 'attack' on OWASP's site, and hence it should be corrected on the ESA.Furthermore, this vulnerability in the ESA's HTTP to HTTPS redirection comes up often in security scanners that are testing for CVE-2011-4237.  This was raised in defect CSCvc72050, but since the ESA doesn't contain the CiscoCommon Services system, the defect was junked.  I believe this was in error.  Just because we don't have this system, doesn't mean we are not allowing response splitting.Please do not junk this bug.  The response splitting is easily reproducible, so the defect is real and does exist.

Title: Cisco ASA Failover Command Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software is affected by the following vulnerabilities:      Cisco ASA Failover Command Injection Vulnerability     Cisco ASA DNS Memory Exhaustion Vulnerability     Cisco ASA VPN XML Parser Denial of Service Vulnerability  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA Failover Command Injection Vulnerability would allow an attacker to submit failover commands to the failover units,  which may result in an attacker taking full control of the systems.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA DNS Memory Exhaustion Vulnerability may result in system instability and dropped traffic.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA VPN XML Parser Denial of Service Vulnerability may result in a crash of the WebVPN process, which may lead to the reset of all SSL VPN connections, system instability, and a reload of the affected system.   Cisco has released free software updates that address these vulnerabilities. Workarounds that mitigate these vulnerabilities are available for the Cisco ASA Failover Command Injection Vulnerability and Cisco ASA DNS Memory Exhaustion Vulnerability. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-asa  Note: The resolution of the vulnerability in the Cisco Security Advisory Cisco ASA FirePOWER Services and Cisco ASA CX Crafted Packets Denial of Service Vulnerability, cisco-sa-20150408-cxfp,  released on the 8th of April may require an upgrade of the Cisco ASA Software release. Cisco ASA customers should review cisco-sa-20150408-cxfp before deciding which Cisco ASA Software release to upgrade to.  The Cisco Security Advisory Cisco ASA FirePOWER Services and Cisco ASA CX Crafted Packets Denial of Service Vulnerability is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-cxfp  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS sscores as of the time of evaluation are 8.3/6.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0675 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine GUI Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the TCP throttling process for the GUI interface of the Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE)  could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device where the ISE GUI may fail to respond to new or established connection requests.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient TCP rate limiting protection on the GUI interface. An attacker could exploit  this vulnerability by sending the affected device a high rate of TCP connections to the GUI interface. An exploit  could allow the attacker to cause GUI interface to stop responding while the high rate of connections is in progress.  Conditions: This vulnerability exists in all software releases until the first fixed. This will be fixed in 2.3.0 which is a future release.  Workaround: None. The fix is in 2.3 which is expected to be released by end of August'17.Also,we have released the fixes in 2.2 Patch 2.  Further Problem Description: None. PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6653 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Cisco ISE 2.1 patch 1- DOS Attack against ISE cause the ISE GUI to start running very slowCustomer reported of DOS attacks on ISE portals and web interface- Customer initially reported of click-jacking on ISE portal and web interface- During the demonstration, a DOS attach was run against ISE- This causes the ISE GUI to start running so slow and eventually go down until the DOS script is stopped

Title: Assess GHOST vulnerability for MDS (CVE-2015-0235)

Title: Mesh crash on BVI restart by DHCP
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the DHCP subsystem of Cisco Aironet Access Points could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to create a denial of service  condition.  The vulnerability is due to an error condition that may occur when very short DHCP leases are in used. If an attacker can prevent the access point  from renewing its lease, the device may restart after unsuccessful DHCP Renew attempts in an effort to reestablish network connectivity.  The  expected behavior is that the network interface would restart and not the device.  This vulnerability was reported to Cisco by Maxim Salomon and Timo Warns of Airbus Operations GmbH.  Conditions: DHCP is in use with a very short lease timeout on a Cisco Aironet Access Point running an affected version of IOS software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: This condition requires a very specific set of circumstances and timing to occur.  The issue has been resolved.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  4.6/3.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2014-7997 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: MSE / Information Disclosure Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Mobility Services Engine (MSE) display passwords in cleartext in the GUI and in log files.  Conditions: Running versions prior to this bugfix.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Under certain circumstances, the logs of the MSE may display passwords of local users in plain text in log files that are as well available through the GUI. Title: Polaris: I/O pool memory leak with igmpsn_mrd_handle_igmp_pak.
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco.  Do not forward this information to mailing lists or newsgroups.  Documentation writers: it is prohibited to publish this Release-note  Enclosure (RNE) until the content has been approved by PSIRT.  PSIRT may  publish a Security Advisory regarding this defect, and the current text of  this RNE will be replaced with appropriate information.  In the event that  a Security Advisory is not published, PSIRT will replace this text with an  appropriate explanation.  More information on PSIRT is available at http//psirt.cisco.com/.   Cisco's public policy on security vulnerability handling can be reviewed at  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html. For further information, send a message to psirt@cisco.com.  (mgerencs-06/29/17)$$IGNORE-PSIRT  Device can be crashed due to a memory leak, by sending IGMPv2 64 Membership Query packets towards it.   Symptom: A Stack of 3850 Switches is experiencing a memory leak in I/O pool:  Public buffer pools: Small buffers, 104 bytes (total 122044, permanent 1200, peak 122044 @ 00:00:07): --       226 in free list (200 min, 2500 max allowed)      36866632 hits, 46407 misses, 990 trims, 121834 created      0 failures (0 no memory) Middle buffers, 600 bytes (total 900, permanent 900):      897 in free list (100 min, 2000 max allowed)      12400878 hits, 0 misses, 0 trims, 0 created      0 failures (0 no memory) Big buffers, 1536 bytes (total 900, permanent 900, peak 907 @ 1w4d):      900 in free list (50 min, 1800 max allowed)      5194298 hits, 22 misses, 7 trims, 7 created      0 failures (0 no memory) VeryBig buffers, 4520 bytes (total 100, permanent 100, peak 129 @ 1w4d):      100 in free list (0 min, 300 max allowed)      1676 hits, 2004 misses, 29 trims, 29 created      2004 failures (0 no memory) Large buffers, 5024 bytes (total 100, permanent 100, peak 127 @ 1w4d):      100 in free list (0 min, 300 max allowed)      896 hits, 1108 misses, 27 trims, 27 created      1108 failures (0 no memory) VeryLarge buffers, 8256 bytes (total 100, permanent 100, peak 126 @ 1w4d):      100 in free list (0 min, 300 max allowed)      1405 hits, 375 misses, 26 trims, 26 created      375 failures (0 no memory) Huge buffers, 18024 bytes (total 20, permanent 20, peak 50 @ 1w4d):      19 in free list (0 min, 33 max allowed)      478 hits, 153 misses, 31 trims, 31 created      153 failures (0 no memory)  due to IGMP packets held in the buffer:  Statistics for the Small pool Input IDB    :   Te1/0/12 count:   109233 Caller pc    : 0xAAAFF76500 count:   109233  Resource User:     IGMPSN count:   109233 -- Input IDB    :      Gi0/0 count:        1 Caller pc    : 0xAAAF76DB2C count:        1 Resource User: IOSXE-RP P count:        1 Number of Buffers used by packets generated by system: 109441  Conditions: Device is handling IGMP multicast traffic.  Workaround: None at the moment. Title: Command Injection Vulnerability in Multiple Cisco TelePresence Products
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web framework of multiple Cisco TelePresence products could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary commands that are executed with the privileges of the root user.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the device and submitting crafted input to the affected parameter in a web page. Administrative privileges are required in order to access the affected parameter. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute system commands with the privileges of the root user.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150513-tp   Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS sscores as of the time of evaluation are 9.0/7.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0713 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Enter the following as the NTP host on a vTS (with NTP enabled):a;;reboot;echo;brokenThe box will echo ;broken; on its console and reboot.I believe this is specific to vTS because of this vTS-specific code:  custom_sprintf(cmdbuf, sizeof cmdbuf, ;/bin/python/usr/local/vts/bin/ash_system_settings.py --ntp \;%s\;;,ntp_settings->host_name);  int err = system(cmdbuf);Other platforms do not seem to be vulnerable.  ntpdate is invoked with exec asof changeset 56820748bd05 so I don't think there is an issue there any more.

Title: CIMC and ESXi: Server Supports SSL version 3: POODLE/CVE-2014-3566
RNE: Symptom: This product includes a version of SSL that is affected by the vulnerability identified by the Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2014-3566  This bug has been opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: ESXI: Exposure is not configuration dependent CIMC: Exposure is not configuration dependent  Workaround: Both vendors Cisco and VMware state to disable SSLV3 as the workaround.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-3566 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: In CIMC and ESXi components of CMS MAP:The SSL protocol 3.0, as used in OpenSSL through 1.0.1i and other products, uses nondeterministic CBC padding, which makes it easier for man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain cleartext data via a padding-oracle attack, aka the ;POODLE; issue. A Metasploit module is available to verify against POODLE attack.The solution is to disable SSLv3 protocol support. Configure the server to require clients to use TLS.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Title: Cisco ASA Malformed DNS Reply Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: ASA crash in thread name: dns_process  Conditions: This may happen when a the network object configuration includes both a IPv4 & IPv6 fqdn defined and in use and the ASA triggers a DNS request for these object  Workaround: do not map the same fqdn to v6 and v4  Further Problem Description:  A vulnerability in DNS code of Cisco ASA Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the reload of an affected system.  The vulnerability is due to improper handling of DNS error cases when the Cisco ASA Software receive a DNS reply packet under particular configuration of the system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by either owning a DNS server or making sure that the reply to a DNS request coming from an affected system is malformed. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the reload of the affected system.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5.4/4.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2013-6696 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6696  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: ASA running 9.0.2 code crashing with thread name: dns_process.  The same crash was seen on both the primary and secondary ASA.Customers config had:object network ssl.google-analytics.com fqdn v4 ssl.google-analytics.comobject network ssl.google-analytics.com-IPv6 fqdn v6 ssl.google-analytics.comApplied and configured and was seeing bad DNS responses - ;show counters; output:DNS          BAD_RESPONSE                            2   SummaryDNS          POSSIBLE_SPOOF                          1   Summary <---This crash can only occur when a user has the same fqdn defined and in use for both IPv4 & IPv6. And then the IPv6 DNS request must succeed and then if the IPv4 one is malformed, this will cause this crash.

Title: malware is not getting blocked on SMBv2/3 using samba server/smbclient
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptoms: A vulnerability in the detection engine of Cisco Firepower System Software could allow an unauthenticated,  remote attacker to bypass a file policy that is configured to block the Server Message Block Version 2 (SMB2)  or SMB Version 3 (SMB3) protocol.  The vulnerability is due to the incorrect detection of an SMB2 or SMB3 file when the file is over a certain size. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted SMB2 or SMB3 transfer request through  the targeted device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass filters that are configured to  block SMB2 or SMB3 traffic.  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco Firepower System Software that has one or more file action policies configured.   This vulnerability is present in all software versions prior to the first fixed.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue. Title: Cisco IP Phone 8800 Series Command Injection Vulnerability in Debug Shell
RNE: $$PREFCS  Symptom: A vulnerability in the debug interface of Cisco IP Phone 8800 series could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the device and submitting additional command input to the affected parameter in the debug shell.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-ipp  Conditions: Default installation of an affected release of firmware.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.7: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12305 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:L/A:H - 9.9 (Critical)DESCRIPTIONThe btcli interface launched from the debug shell contains a command injection vulnerability. An example sequence to reproduce the issue follows:1. SSH to the phone2. Log in as the debug user3. run 'btcli'4. run 'init-client test'5. run 'start-bluetooth test'6. run 'set local-device-name test;<INSERT ARBITRARY SHELL COMMAND>'The output is suppressed, but can be retrieved using a number of indirect measures including redirecting to a file in /usr/local/backtraces, which can then be 'cat'ed using debugsh, or by redirecting to /dev/pts/0 or another logged in terminal.IMPACTThis allows a user to break out of the btcli and run an arbitrary shell command. SUGGESTED REMEDIATIONUser input should be sanitized sufficiently before being passed to system calls.

Title: Specific SNMP GET request causes 'snmpd' and 'licmgr' services to crash.
RNE: Symptom: Cisco NX-OS Software-based devices contain a buffer overflow vulnerability in the SNMP subsystem.  An authenticated, remote attacker can exploit the vulnerability by submitting a malicious SNMP  query via UDP port 161 to trigger a buffer overflow condition in the SNMP and License Manager  components of the device. Successful exploitation could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary  code with elevated privileges.   SNMP is disabled by default and must be explicitly configured by an administrator. Because SNMP  is primarily a UDP-based protocol, no TCP three-way handshake is required to exploit this vulnerability,  and the malicious request could contain a spoofed origin. The attacker must know the configured  community strings for SNMP version 1 and version 2. Exploitation also requires a valid username  and password when a device is configured for SNMP version 3.  This vulnerability can be triggered via SNMP over IPv4 and SNMP over IPv6.  Conditions: The NX-OS device is configured for SNMP.  Workaround: The SNMP community string should be secure.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 9/7.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2013-1179, CVE-2013-1180 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Port N7K: CSCtx54822/CSCtx54830 (N5K: CSCux81143) for SNMP LICMGR CRASHDetermine if the fixes for N7K: CSCtx54822 and CSCtx54830 (N5K CSCux81143) need to beported to this platform.

Title: Need to investigate few security vulnerabilities on the SX20 Codec
RNE: Symptoms: This bug has been opened in order to investigate the potential impact of several vulnerabilities on third party software used on the SX20. These vulnerabilities are documented in the following CVE IDs:   * CVE-1999-0524  * CVE-2011-3192  * CVE-2014-0133  * CVE-2014-2532  * CVE-2014-3616  Conditions: CVE-1999-0524 This CVE says we respond to ICMP messages netmask (17/18) and timestamp (13/14) with no access control.  This may be true, but we don't consider this a threat.  It's been given a CVSS score of 0.0.  CVE-2011-3192 Not relevant, we don't have apache.  CVE-2014-0133 We have a vulnerable version of nginx, but we don't use the vulnerable spdy module, so not vulnerable here.  CVE-2014-2532 7.3.x and earlier have a vulnerable version of openssh, but we don't use AcceptEnv at all (let alone with a wildcard), so no harm done.  CVE-2014-3616 Again we have a vulnerable version, but we don't use a) several vhosts, and b) ssl_session_{cache,ticket}. We are not vulnerable to any of these CVEs.  Workaround: Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. Title: Cisco TP TC and TE Software Serial Port Access Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco TelePresence TC and TE Software are affected by the following vulnerabilities:      Six Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) denial of service vulnerabilities     Cisco TelePresence TC and TE Software DNS Buffer Overflow Vulnerability     Cisco TelePresence TC and TE Software Input Validation Vulnerability     Cisco TelePresence TC and TE Software tshell Command Injection Vulnerability     Cisco TelePresence TC and TE Software Heap Overflow Vulnerability     Cisco TelePresence TC and TE Software U-Boot Buffer Overflow Vulnerability     Cisco TelePresence TC and TE Software Unauthenticated Serial Port Access Vulnerability     Cisco TelePresence TC H.225 Denial of Service Vulnerability  Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to cause the affected system to reload, execute arbitrary commands or obtain privileged access to the affected system.  Note: This security advisory does not provide information about the OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Read Overrun Vulnerability identified by CVE-2014-0160 (also known as Heartbleed).  For additional information on Cisco products affected by the Heartbleed vulnerability, refer to the Cisco Security Advisory available at the following link:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140409-heartbleed   Cisco has released free software updates that address these vulnerabilities. There are no workarounds that mitigate these vulnerabilities. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140430-tcte  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Symptom:  Conditions:  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Further Problem Description: See published Cisco Security Advisory PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.2/6.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:H/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-2173 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: By default, tc-software endpoints provide unauthenticated access to au-boot console via their serial port.  By holding down the 'b' keyduring boot, a user can interrupt the boot process at which point,entering 'c' causes the console to be loaded.From the u-boot console, a user can perform a number of privilegedactions including reading and writing arbitrary regions of memory,loading programs from the network, and launching arbitrary programs.This allows an unauthenticated user with physical access to loadarbitrary software and make arbitrary modifications to the system.The u-boot console should be administratively configurable to beprotected from unauthorized access via a password.  If disasterrecovery capabilities are required, the console can provide the userthe ability to perform a factory reset without requiring a password(as is done when the device is configured for FIPS mode).CWE: CWE-306

Title: ASA  high cpu vulnerability with cut-through proxy
RNE: Symptom: High CPU utilization is observed on ASA, when forward many HTTPS sessions between two hosts.   Conditions:  The issue only appears when source IP is a part of cut-through proxy ACL.  Workaround: Exclude source IP address from cut-through proxy ACL  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-6393 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
