Title: Cisco PNSC Apache Multiple Security Vulnerabilities
RNE: Symptoms: All Versions of Cisco Prime Network Services Controller prior to the release bundled with Cisco Intercloud Fabric 2.2.1 are shipping with a version of the Apache Web server that is affected by the following vulnerabilities:  CVE-2013-5704: The mod_headers module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.2.22 allows remote attackers to bypass ''RequestHeader unset'' directives by placing a header in the trailer portion of data sent with chunked transfer coding. NOTE: the vendor states ''this is not a security issue in httpd as such.'' This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 5.0 (AV:N/AC:L/AU:N/C:N/I:P/A:N)  CVE-2013-6438: The dav_xml_get_cdata function in main/util.c in the mod_dav module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.8 does not properly remove whitespace characters from CDATA sections, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a crafted DAV WRITE request. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 5.0 (AV:N/AC:L/AU:N/C:N/I:N/A:P)  CVE-2014-0098: The log_cookie function in mod_log_config.c in the mod_log_config module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and daemon crash) via a crafted cookie that is not properly handled during truncation. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 5.0 (AV:N/AC:L/AU:N/C:N/I:N/A:P)  CVE-2014-0118: The deflate_in_filter function in mod_deflate.c in the mod_deflate module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.10, when request body decompression is enabled, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via crafted request data that decompresses to a much larger size. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 4.3 (AV:N/AC:M/AU:N/C:N/I:N/A:P)  CVE-2014-0226: Race condition in the mod_status module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.10 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow), or possibly obtain sensitive credential information or execute arbitrary code, via a crafted request that triggers improper scoreboard handling within the status_handler function in modules/generators/mod_status.c and the lua_ap_scoreboard_worker function in modules/lua/lua_request.c. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 6.8 (AV:N/AC:M/AU:N/C:P/I:P/A:P)  CVE-2014-0231: The mod_cgid module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.10 does not have a timeout mechanism, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (process hang) via a request to a CGI script that does not read from its stdin file descriptor. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 5.0 (AV:N/AC:L/AU:N/C:N/I:N/A:P)  This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: Running version of the software prior to the Known Fixed Releases.  Workaround: Not currently available.  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.5/6.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:P/E:H/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this score based on information obtained from multiple sources. This includes the CVSS score assigned by the third-party vendor when available. The CVSS score assigned may not reflect the actual impact on the Cisco Product.  CVE ID CVE-2013-5704,CVE-2013-6438,CVE-2014-0098,CVE-2014-0118,CVE-2014-0226,CVE-2014-0231 have been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Cisco PNSC Apache Multiple Security VulnerabilitiesIntercloud Bundle: PNSC Calvus1 191  March 10 releaseLatest PNSC eng builds in Calvus release running an Apache module vulnerable from multiple security holes.  Refer to Govt advisories below for review:https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2013-5704https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2014-0118https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2014-0226https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2014-0231Version source    : Server: Apache/2.2.27  Installed version : 2.2.27  Fixed version     : 2.2.29Solution:  Upgrade to Apache version 2.2.29 or later

Title: N3K/N9K/N7K OSPF Rogue LSA with maximum sequence number vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Multiple Cisco products are affected by a vulnerability involving the Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Routing Protocol Link State Advertisement (LSA) database. This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to take full control of the OSPF Autonomous System (AS) domain routing table, allowing the attacker to intercept or black-hole traffic.  The attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting crafted OSPF packets. Successful exploitation could cause the targeted router to flush its routing table and propagate the crafted OSPF LSA type 1 update throughout the OSPF AS domain.  To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker must accurately determine certain parameters within the LSA database on the target router. This vulnerability can only be triggered by sending crafted unicast or multicast OSPF LSA type 1 packets. No other LSA type packets can trigger this vulnerability.  Fabric Shortest Path First (FSPF) protocol is not affected by this vulnerability.  Workarounds that address this vulnerability are available.  This bug tracks N3K/N9K/N7K  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170727-ospf  Conditions: Please refer to the security advisory.  NX-OS running versions prior to 7.3(2)D1(1) or 7.0(3)F2(2).  Cisco Nexus 5K will have the fix via 7.3.3 which is planned in April 2018.  NX-OS 8.x is affected.  Pending first fix.  Workaround: Please refer to the security advisory.  Further Problem Description: This vulnerability was found and reported to Cisco by Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems.  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.2:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:F/RL:O/RC:C  CVE ID CVE-2017-6770 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: External researcher reported the following issues, both fixed within CSCva74756:Deviation #1: Rogue LSA with maximum sequence numberA false LSA having the maximum sequence number was sent from Cloud 1 to R1. The false LSA had an LS ID and Advertising Router fields that corresponds to R1's ID. In response R1 flooded over all its interfaces a new LSA having maximum sequence number and maximum age in order to flush the false LSA from all the routers in the network. This action is expected and is in accordance with the OSPF specification. Following the reception of the LSA Acks from all its neighbors R1 was expected to send yet another LSA, but this time with the minimum sequence number. However, R1 does not send this LSA. As a result, the LSA of R1 is not installed in the LS DB of the routers in the network, causing their DB to be inconsistent with the actual network topology. This allows an attacker to send a spoofed LSA that persistently harms the routing in the network.Issue #2:When a rogue R-LSA for Router-id 10.0.1.2 is sent with Max sequence number is sent from R0. R1 broadcasts the packet rogue R-LSA. R2 upon receiving the rogue LSA tries to max age out the rogue LSA entry by sending R-LSA with max sequence number and max age. R1 receives the packet and sends the ack. R2 after receiving the acks sends R-LSA with initial sequence number. R1 discards the new R-LSA from R2 as it considers the max sequence number what it has is newer. R1 again broadcast the R2's R-LSA with max sequence number and this process continues forever.Please contact srasovic@cisco.com or osantos@cisco.com for further information including researcher report and trace files and captures.Note: This vulnerability will be disclosed during Black Hat USA - end of July. Please treat with priority.

Title: OpenSSH CVE-2010-5107 Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Unified Computing System Fabric Interconnect Devices are affected by the OpenSSH issue described by CVE-2010-5107. This issue stems  from the default values utilized for the MaxStartups parameter as supplied by OpenSSH.  To be exploited an attacker would need to have the ability to  open SSH connections to the SSH Management port on the affected device.  If successful, they attacker could consume all available SSH connection  slots provided by the SSH Daemon.  By reconnecting within the timeout period specified by the service the attacker could keep all connections  consumed for an extended period of time.  This would result in the inability to access the SSH management console by authorized users. Any users that  were connected via SSH at the time of the attack would continue to operate as expected.  Because this attack relies on long timers and timeouts, it creates very little resource strain on an affected device.  Only the connection pool for the SSH  service is affected.  Once the attack stops users can connect to the device normally.  Conditions: Devices running an affected version of Cisco UCS software.  Workaround: Aministrators can mitigate this issue by restricting SSH access to trusted workstations and networks only.  Further Problem Description: This issue will be remediated in a future release of Cisco Unified Computing System software. It is likely that this fix will take the form of a change to the  default startup values for OpenSSH and will not be a package upgrade to OpenSSH 6.2. No ETA is available at this time for when the release will be  published to CCO that contains this change.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  5/4.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:POC/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2010-5107 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Summary=======OpenSSH 5.9 is prone to DoS vulnerability CVE-2010-5107. OpenSSH need to be upgraded to 6.2 to remediate this vulnerability. Find the Qualys Scan report Attached for more details.Impact======Successful exploitation could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to cause the targeted server to stop responding to legitimate user queries,leading to a denial of service on the targeted server.Threat:======OpenSSH (OpenBSD Secure Shell) is a set of computer programs providing encrypted communication sessions over a computer network using the SSH protocol.Default OpenSSH installations have an overly long LoginGraceTime and a lack of early connection release for MaxStartups settings. Remote unauthenticated attackers could bypass the LoginGraceTime and MaxStartups thresholds by intermittently transmitting a large number of new TCP connections to the targeted server. This could lead to connection slot exhaustion.Affected Software:============OpenSSH 6.1 and prior.SOLUTION:=======Customers are advised to upgrade to OpenSSH 6.2 (http://www.openssh.org/) and apply the associated server configuration settings to remediate this vulnerability.Patch:====Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:OpenSSH 6.2 (http://www.openssh.org/)

Title: Exe files inside some rar archives can't be detected
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco.  Do not forward this information to mailing lists or newsgroups.  Documentation writers: it is prohibited to publish this Release-note  Enclosure (RNE) until the content has been approved by PSIRT.  PSIRT may  publish a Security Advisory regarding this defect, and the current text of  this RNE will be replaced with appropriate information.  In the event that  a Security Advisory is not published, PSIRT will replace this text with an  appropriate explanation.  More information on PSIRT is available at http//psirt.cisco.com/.   Cisco's public policy on security vulnerability handling can be reviewed at  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html. For further information, send a message to psirt@cisco.com.  (fcasotto-05/11/17)$$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptom: Exe files inside RAR archives are not detected.  Conditions: Configure a File policy to block exe files. Enable the archive inspection. Then try to download the rar file attached.  Actual result: the archive is not blocked.  Expected result: archive flow to be blocked.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description:
Description: Exe files inside some rar archives can't be detected.Configure a file policy to block with reset exe files and with inspect archives enabled. Then try to download the RAR archive attached.

Title: [WSA] CRIME Vulnerability (CVE-2012-4929)
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT See CSCzv76151 Release Note Enclosure. Symptom:The web server included with the WSA is potentially vulnerable to the CRIME vulnerability (CVE-2012-4929).  Conditions: Workaround:The CRIME vulnerability can only be exploited if both the server and web browser both support TLS compression.Almost all modern web browsers disable compression for TLS connections.  To avoid any potential exposure to this vulnerability, please ensure that your browser does not support TLS compression.  All versions of Internet Explorer, and the latest versions of Chrome and Firefox do not support TLS compression and are therefore not vulnerable to the CRIME exploit. More Info:The CRIME vulnerability can be exploited via TLS or SPDY compression.  We do not support the SPDY protocol currently, so only TLS compression is potentially vulnerable.
Description: This defect is cloned from CSCum72269 so we can have an WSA defect for this issue.  I have performed testing on an WSA running 8.0.0-393 and found it to be vulnerable to this defect as well.A security scan by Qualys is detecting ESAs running AsyncOS 8.0.1-023 as being vulnerable to the CRIME security exploit.  The security vendor provided the following CVEs:CVE-2012-4929CVE-2012-4930Looking into this further, CVE-2012-4930 is specifically dealing with the SPDY protocol.  My own tests indicate that the web server on the WSA does not support SPDY protocol, so I do not believe this CVE Is relevant here.However, CVE-2012-4929 does appear to be applicable.  My own tests with our lab appliances show that we are negotiating zlib compression.CVE-2012-4929 was discussed in WSA defect CSCzv76151.  In CSCzv76151 it was concluded that the only way to prevent CVE-2012-4929 was to disable encryption in our version of CiscoSSL using the 'NO_COMPRESSION' flag (see the Eng-notes enclosure).  CSCzv76151 is showing that it is fixed and verified in version 8.0.0-363, but my tests on version 8.0.0-393 show that we are still negotiating zlib compression on that version.
PSIRT: psirt-owner: psirt  See CSCzv76151 PSIRT Evaluation Enclosure.

Title: Cisco FXOS and NX-OS Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) implementation of Cisco Firepower Extensible Operating System (FXOS) and NX-OS System Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to reload.  The vulnerability occurs because AAA processes prevent the NX-OS System Manager from receiving keepalive messages when an affected device receives a high rate of login attempts, such as in a brute-force login attack. System memory can run low on the FXOS devices under the same conditions, which could cause the AAA process to unexpectedly restart or cause the device to reload.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by performing a brute-force login attack against a device that is configured with AAA security services. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause the affected device to reload.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171018-aaavty  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3883 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco AnyConnect WebLaunch XSS Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco AnyConnect contains a vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against the user of the WebLaunch functionality.   The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of some parameters passed to the AnyConnect WebLaunch function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the user to access a malicious link or by intercepting the user request and injecting the malicious code.  Conditions: Any AnyConnect deployment scenario which makes use of the WebLaunch functionality.  Workaround: None.  See further information about the vulnerability at https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170816-caw  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6788 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The link utilized to direct a client to install/launch the AnyConnect client is susceptible to a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability.The customer accessed a URL similar to:https://<server_name>/CACHE/stc/1/index.html?A video of the customer exploitation is attached as ie-xss-reflected-cisco-2.mp4

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine DOM Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a Document Object Model (DOM)  cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web-based management interface of an  affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based  management interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by  persuading a user of the interface to click a crafted link. Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA) DNS Resolution Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Domain Name Service (DNS) resolution function of the Cisco Web Security  Appliance (WSA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a partial denial  of service (DoS) condition due to DNS name resolution failing through the device.  The vulnerability is due to the handling of DNS requests awaiting a DNS response when new,  incoming DNS requests are received. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending  TCP proxy traffic to the WSA at a high rate. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a  partial DoS condition because DNS name resolution fails which results in the client receiving  a HTTP 503 ''Service Unavailable'' error.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6287 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Proxy DNS LRU cache handling failure results in intermittent outagesCustomers are reporting frequent HTTP 503 DNS_FAIL errors which results in sporadic inability to browse the web. Environmental issues were tested for and ruled out for the most port.There are a number of conditions that result in a 503, some are typical DNS issues, others are internal proxy failures. In an effort to understand which of the failure cases was being triggered - out of desperation, on the customers production system I attached GDB and set a breakpoint on the HandleDNSFailure function. This uncovered that the majority of failures were occurring at a specific location related to the internal proxy LRU DNS cache. Notably dns_master.c line 498 was the failure mode which stood out. Breakpoint 1, HandleDNSFailure (xact=0xa24723238) at readcli.c:7834#0  HandleDNSFailure (xact=0xa24723238) at readcli.c:7834#1  0x000000000045e5ea in DoneWithDNSLookup (servTok=0xa1eeb90a8, resultList=0x7fffffffdee0, DNSDelay=0x2862a48) at connectserv.c:1192#2  0x0000000000460f19 in DNS_Lookup (name=0xa1b8b1060, waiterToken=0xa1eeb90a8, waiterFunc=0x45e3fe <DoneWithDNSLookup>) at dns_master.c:498#3  0x000000000045e718 in AddOriginIPs (si=Variable ;si; is not available.) at connectserv.c:1228{...SNIP...}
PSIRT: psirt-owner: psirt  See CSCzv76151 PSIRT Evaluation Enclosure.

Title: Cisco Nexus 5K/6K/7K/9K/9500-R/MDS CLI Command Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS System Software running on Nexus Series Switches could allow an authenticated, local attacker to perform a command injection attack.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of command arguments. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting crafted command arguments into a vulnerable CLI command. An exploit could allow the attacker to read or write arbitrary files at the user's privilege level outside of the user's path.  Conditions:  Workaround: None  Further Problem Description: For information about vulnerable and not vulnerable software releases, and time frame for fixed software releases, please open a support case with your support organization. PSIRT does not provide or maintain this information for Medium SIR advisories.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6649 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The ;ssh; command in the local-mgmt shell allows users to manipulate argumentspassed to ssh on the command line. This could allow users to read and write arbitrary files on the system (with the privileges of the logged-in user) by connecting to an attacker-controlled ssh server.For example:Writing arbitrary files:  ssh josconno@10.1.1.100>/tmp/fileThis example is not intended to be exhaustive.To fix these issues, all user input, and especially arguments to shell commands,should be validated to ensure they meet the expected format, preferably with a whitelist. In this case that means validating that the hostname argument specifies a valid hostname.
PSIRT: psirt-owner: psirt  See CSCzv76151 PSIRT Evaluation Enclosure.

Title: HTTP GET method is allowed in login request
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) contains a vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated,  remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against the user of the web interface of the affected system.   The vulnerability is due to a failure to properly call XSS filter subsystems when a URL contains a certain parameter. An attacker who can persuade an authenticated user of an affected device to follow an attacker-provided link or visit an attacker-controlled website could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the affected site in the user's browser.  Conditions: An attacker should be able to inject the script within the HTTP flow between the target user and the affected system  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigations can be found at: https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3802 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Http GET method is designed to querying the data from server however POST method is designed to submitting the data to server . However submitting the data using GET method will transfer the data in insecure way  in which attacker can easily get those information from URL . So the application whichever allowed GET method for  authentication  should be restricted to allow only POST method.
PSIRT: psirt-owner: psirt  See CSCzv76151 PSIRT Evaluation Enclosure.

Description: Looks like charMemccpy is trying to copy the size buffer array over 1024 size buffer array. Title: internal SSH server need to drop CBC ciphers support
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  $$IGNORE  Symptoms: This is a modification on the product to adopt new secure code best practices to enhance  the security posture and resiliency of the Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE).  The ISE SSH server is configured to support Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) encryption which  should be disabled.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: Not applicable or available.   Further Problem Description: This issue was found during an internal security audit of the product. This issue should  not be made public as it is an internal hardening issue to be considered for integration. If you believe that there is new information that would cause a change in the severity of this issue, please contact psirt@cisco.com for another evaluation. Description: Issue:One issue not fixed in CSCva83948 was usage of CBC ciphers.The SSH server is configured to support Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) encryption. This may allow an attacker to recover the plaintext message from the ciphertext. The following client-to-server Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) algorithmsare supported : aes128-cbcaes256-cbcThe following server-to-client Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) algorithmsare supported : aes128-cbcaes256-cbcSetup:Test was done on fresh installation of ISE 2.2 build 277 under standalone deviceConditions/Trigger/How to reproduce:Run nessus/retina/openvas to find issues.Impact:This bug has security impact Workaround:No workaround

Title: rsvp and te_control out-of-sync causing inconsistent LSP's
RNE: Symptom: 1. Old LSP are stuck and  New LSP are not signaled after following syslog message  P/0/RP0/CPU0:Sep 26 14:42:51 PST: rsvp[1053]: %ROUTING-TXLIB-3-ERR : TXSEND_ERROR::Encoded data can not fit in a single msg buffer, data=4914,  buflen=0, max_msg=4096, head/tail size=34/0  : pkg/bin/rsvp : (PID=561537) :  -Traceback= 11920d50 1191bff2 1191c375 d451080  Conditions: Receiving a RSVP signaled Path/Resv with large object length. Generally this can happen in two conditions.  1. Large number of ACK message in RESV message. 2. Big RRO due to large number of Hops.   Conditions: The RSVP inter-op with third party device which support RSVP Ack piggyback and interface MTU more than 3000 bytes.  Workaround: Reduce MTU size of interface to less than 3000 bytes.    Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: We've found that after a route-churn, if there's a LSP being signaled with a path (RRO) that creates a message bigger than 4096 bytes, it will be dropped and cause the ipc communication between rsvp and te_control to be stuck, causing new LSP's not to be established and stuck old LSP's.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com              This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT.  PSIRT has  provided a public Release-note Enclosure (RNE) for this issue which  is visible on Cisco.com. Title: UCS C-Series Integrated Management Controller DoS Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco Integrated Management Controller (CIMC) of the Cisco Unified Computing System C-Series Servers  could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to gain access to specific controls on the CIMC on the affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation for DHCP response packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by  sending crafted DHCP packets to the affected device.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration, running an affected version of software.  Workaround: There are currently no known workarounds for this vulnerability.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of  evaluation are 4.3/3.7: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=&version=2.0 dispatch=1&version=2&vector=AV:A/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:P/E:U/RL:U/RC:C CVE ID CVE-2015-0633 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The default configuration of the UCS C-series CIMC accepts the change-mode command in any DHCP response, including those not originating from a UCSM / fabric interconnect.  This allows a malicious user to access some system control daemons (e.g. mcserver) that are not normally accessible and that may allow for persistent security changes to the CIMC and / or server.

Title: 8865 Key Reinstallation attacks against WPA protocol
RNE: Symptom: The product Cisco IP Phone 8865 implements a WPA supplicant and as such is affected by the WPA protocol vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) ID:  CVE-2017-13077: reinstallation of the pairwise key in the 4-way handshake CVE-2017-13078: reinstallation of the group key in the 4-way handshake CVE-2017-13079: reinstallation of the integrity group key in the 4-way handshake CVE-2017-13080: reinstallation of the group key in the group key handshake CVE-2017-13081: reinstallation of the integrity group key in the group key handshake CVE-2017-13086: reinstallation of the Tunneled Direct-Link Setup (TDLS) PeerKey (TPK) key in the TDLS handshake CVE-2017-13087: reinstallation of the group key (GTK) when processing a Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frame CVE-2017-13088: reinstallation of the integrity group key (IGTK) when processing a Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frame  As disclosed in https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171016-wpa  This product is not affected by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2017-13082: accepting a retransmitted FT Reassociation Request and reinstalling the pairwise key while processing it  Conditions: Exposure is not configuration dependent.  Workaround: Not available.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.3:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Three new vulnerabilities have been identified on the WPA protocol (WPA1 or WPA2) that allow for key re-installation. Two of those vulnerabilities affect wireless devices acting as supplicant/client, while the remaining one affects wireless devices acting as authenticator/server.These vulnerabilities allow (depending on specific device configuration) for packet replaying, packet decryption, and *may allow* for packet forging/packet injection.As these are *protocol* level vulnerabilities (instead of vulnerabilities on a specific implementation of the protocol), there is a high likelihood that any wireless product implementing WPA1 or WPA2, as either supplicant or authenticator, will be affected.The Cisco PSIRT has a draft paper with details on the vulnerabilities, and tools that can be used to help reproduce the vulnerabilities on clients or servers. Due to the sensitive nature of this information, they're NOT attached to the bug but will be provided on an as-needed basis to developers involved on analyzing and fixing this vulnerability on any affected product.This bug has been opened for the development team to investigate the impact of these vulnerabilities against the following product(s): 8865
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: dciccaro@cisco.com          This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT.  PSIRT has provided a public Release-note Enclosure (RNE) for this issue which is visible on Cisco.com.   If a customer is being impacted by this issue, please guide them to the 'Workaround' section of the RNE or recommend a software upgrade to a patched release. Title: TJB interface improvements
RNE: Symptom: Unprivileged user may get to root by executing a crafted TJB call.  Conditions: The attacker would need to have access as root user in order to properly craft the TJB.  Workaround: none  Further Problem Description: A vulnerability in Cisco Tidal Enterprise Scheduler Agent could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the affected system with the privilege of the root user.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of the Tidal Job Buffers (TJB) parameters when the component is executed. An authenticated but unprivileged attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting  a rogue caller of TJB and executing it on the affected system. The attacker needs to have access to the scheduler agent  on the local machine in order to execute the attack.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6/5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:H/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-3272 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3272  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The interface to TJB from the main agent needs to be improved for reliability and security.

Title: WLC produces malformed RADIUS packet during EAP-SIM client auth
RNE: Symptom:  WLC produces malformed RADIUS messages that are sent to the configured RADIUS server. This may cause resource exhaustion issues on some RADIUS implementations that do not handle gracefully these malformed messages, or may cause RADIUS servers to respond with Access-Reject messages, which will deny access to users trying to join the wireless network.  The specific issue is that the RADIUS message contains AV-pairs with invalid data.  Conditions:  This issue has been detected when the WLC is under high load and EAP-SIM client authentication is in use.  Workaround:  None.  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.8:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2013-1106 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: EAP-SIM authentication is used. WLC 5508 sends malformed packets that canl cause a crash on AAA server or prevent clients to authenticate.Example of such a packet is attached separately.The problem is seen during peak load (>400 users are connected).

Title: Crash in Bstun SNMP code
RNE: Symptom: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6. Only traffic directed to an affected system can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities.  The vulnerabilities are due to a buffer overflow condition in the SNMP subsystem of the affected software. The vulnerabilities affect all versions of SNMP Versions 1, 2c, and 3. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 2c or earlier, the attacker must know the SNMP read-only community string for the affected system. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 3, the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain full control of the affected system or cause the affected system to reload.  Cisco will release software updates that address these vulnerabilities. There are workarounds that address these vulnerabilities.  The advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170629-snmp  Conditions: Devices running an affected version of Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software.  Workaround: Administrators are advised to allow only trusted users to have SNMP access on an affected system. Administrators are also advised to monitor affected systems by using the show snmp host command in the CLI.  In addition, administrators can mitigate these vulnerabilities by disabling the following MIBs on a device:      ADSL-LINE-MIB     ALPS-MIB     CISCO-ADSL-DMT-LINE-MIB     CISCO-BSTUN-MIB     CISCO-MAC-AUTH-BYPASS-MIB     CISCO-SLB-EXT-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-DNIS-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-NUMBER-EXPANSION-MIB     TN3270E-RT-MIB  To create or update a view entry and disable the affected MIBs, administrators can use the snmp-server view global configuration command, as shown in the following example:      snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP iso included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP internet included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpUsmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpVacmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpCommunityMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.252 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP transmission.94 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP mib-2.34.9 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.35 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.95 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.130 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.219 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.254 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMabMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoExperiment.997 excluded  To then apply this configuration to a community string, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server community mycomm view NO_BAD_SNMP RO  For SNMP Version 3, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server group v3group auth read NO_BAD_SNMP write NO_BAD_SNMP  Further Problem Description: Customer are advised to utilize the Cisco IOS Software Checker or Contact Cisco TAC to determine if fixed software has been released for an affected platform.  Cisco IOS Software Checker: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6736 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: It is possible to reliably crash a router by sending it a single packet. This sender only needs to know the snmp community read string. The crash can be triggered by issuing the following command on any system that supports the snmpget program:snmpget -v2c -c <read-pwd> <address> 1.3.6.1.4.1.9.9.35.1.2.1.1.5.67108864The crash is caused by a indexing into an array with an attacker controlled index value. (Smaller final numbers in the OID will allow an attacker to read the contents of memory.) I could only recreate the crash in versions 15.3(3)M1 and later, even though the unprotected array index has always been preset in IOS. Bstun does not need to be configured or enabled for this vulnerability to exist. It only needs to be present in the image. The c2900 I tested with also required a uck9 or data9 license to be present.The crash occurs because the BSTUN snmp code calls the function snmp_get_group, passing in an attacker controlled bstunGroupIndex variable. That function indexes into an array without first validating the index value. Smaller index values allow reading memory past the end of the array; larger index values crash the router by trying to read a non-existent memory address.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: elparis@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT.  PSIRT has provided a public Release-note Enclosure (RNE) for this issue which is visible on Cisco.com. Title: Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switches Remote Login Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the remote login functionality for Cisco NX-OS Software running on Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switches could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a process used for login to terminate unexpectedly and the login attempt to fail. There is no impact to user traffic flowing through the device. The attacker could use either a Telnet or an SSH client for the remote login attempt.  The vulnerability is due to improper handling of failed authentication during login. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by attempting to log in remotely to the device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a login process to terminate unexpectedly.  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switches that are running Cisco NX-OS Software and are configured to allow remote connections to the device.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3879 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

RNE: Symptom: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6. The vulnerabilities affect all versions of SNMP Versions 1, 2c, and 3. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 2c or earlier, the attacker must know the SNMP read-only community string for the affected system. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 3, the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain full control of the affected system or cause the affected system to reload. Description: It is possible to reliably crash a router by sending it a single packet. This sender only needs to know the snmp community read string. The crash can be triggered by issuing the following command on any system that supports the snmpget program:snmpget -v2c -c <read-pwd> <address> `python -c ;print '1.3.6.1.4.1.9.9.654.1.2.1.1.2.5555%s'%('.1'*100);`The crash is caused by a overflowing a stack variable, potentially allowing an attacker to gain control of the cpu program counter. I have recreated the crash in 15.5 as well. The source code for releases 15.2, 15.3 and 15.4 is identical to 15.5 and higher, but instead of crashing it produces a %DATACORRUPTION-1-DATAINCONSISTENCY error. This crash does not require any special configuration, just that the MAC Authentication Bypass feature be present in the image.The crash occurs because the function k_cmabClientInfoEntry_get() in sr_mabmib.c creates a 38 byte data structure on the stack, and then blindly copies however many bytes are specified in the incoming request. This should copy the smaller of MAX_AUTH_MGR_SESSION_ID_LEN or what was specified by the caller.

RNE: Symptom: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6. Only traffic directed to an affected system can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities.  The vulnerabilities are due to a buffer overflow condition in the SNMP subsystem of the affected software. The vulnerabilities affect all versions of SNMP Versions 1, 2c, and 3. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 2c or earlier, the attacker must know the SNMP read-only community string for the affected system. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 3, the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain full control of the affected system or cause the affected system to reload.  Cisco will release software updates that address these vulnerabilities. There are workarounds that address these vulnerabilities.  The advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170629-snmp  Conditions: Devices running an affected version of Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software.  Workaround: Administrators are advised to allow only trusted users to have SNMP access on an affected system. Administrators are also advised to monitor affected systems by using the show snmp host command in the CLI.  In addition, administrators can mitigate these vulnerabilities by disabling the following MIBs on a device:      ADSL-LINE-MIB     ALPS-MIB     CISCO-ADSL-DMT-LINE-MIB     CISCO-BSTUN-MIB     CISCO-MAC-AUTH-BYPASS-MIB     CISCO-SLB-EXT-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-DNIS-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-NUMBER-EXPANSION-MIB     TN3270E-RT-MIB  To create or update a view entry and disable the affected MIBs, administrators can use the snmp-server view global configuration command, as shown in the following example:      snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP iso included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP internet included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpUsmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpVacmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpCommunityMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.252 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP transmission.94 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP mib-2.34.9 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.35 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.95 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.130 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.219 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.254 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMabMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoExperiment.997 excluded  To then apply this configuration to a community string, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server community mycomm view NO_BAD_SNMP RO  For SNMP Version 3, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server group v3group auth read NO_BAD_SNMP write NO_BAD_SNMP  Further Problem Description: Customer are advised to utilize the Cisco IOS Software Checker or Contact Cisco TAC to determine if fixed software has been released for an affected platform.  Cisco IOS Software Checker: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6741 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: It is possible to reliably crash a router by sending it a single packet. This sender only needs to know the snmp community read string. The crash can be triggered by issuing the following command on any system that supports the snmpget program:snmpget -v2c -c <read-pwd> <address> `python -c ;print '1.3.6.1.2.1.34.9.1.1.1.2.1.110%s'%('.1'*110);`The crash is caused by a overflowing a stack variable, potentially allowing an attacker to gain control of the cpu program counter. I have recreated the crash as far back as 12(24)T4. This crash does not require any voice configuration, the feature need only be present in the image.The crash occurs because the function k_tn3270eRtCollCtlEntry_get() in sys/hes/sr_tn3270ertmib.c creates a 25 byte buffer on the stack, and then blindly copies however many bytes are specified in the incoming request. There are five other instances this bad logic in the same file. All of these callers to bcopy must validate that the length specified in the OID is less than the length of the destination buffer before doing the copy.

Title: TLS/SSL Birthday attacks on 64-bit block ciphers on Firepower 7000 Series, 8000 Series, FMC web UI
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco FireSIGHT System Software running on the Firepower Management Center (FMC) and 7000/8000 Series  devices includes a versions DES and Triple DES ciphers, as used in the TLS, SSH, and IPSec protocols  that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2016-2183  This is also known as the ''Sweet32'' attack. This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product.   Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: Not currently available.  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html and https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-2183. Title: Cisco IOS TCL script interpreter privilege escalation vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the TCL script interpreter of Cisco IOS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to escalate its privileges from those of a non-privileged user to a privileged (level 15) user. This would allow a non-privileged user to execute privileged commands (those under privilege level 15).  The vulnerability is due to an error on resetting VTY privileges after running a TCL script. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by establishing a session to an affected device immediately after a TCL script has been run. An attacker would need to provide valid credentials and successfully pass authentication to the device.  Conditions: This behavior is timing dependent, as the attacker would need to log-in to the device immediately after the TCL script finishes execution.  Workaround: There are no workarounds.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.6/5.5:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:M/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-4185 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: BGL14-1.C.04-1900-2#sh run | s kronkron occurrence KBOUNCE_OCC in 3 recurring policy-list KBOUNCEkron policy-list KBOUNCE cli tclsh flash:TCL.tclBGL14-1.C.04-1900-2#show kron scheduleKron Occurrence ScheduleKBOUNCE_OCC inactive, will run again in 0 days 00:02:13This script will run for 3 minutes. During this time if we try to telnet to this box it will bypass userexec mode and take us to enable mode. When script is not running it take user to userexec mode and after entering the password it take to enable mode.

Title: AP1142 disconnecing from WLC and getting freeze no console access in 8.3mr2 and 8.3mr3
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptoms: A vulnerability in the authentication and association request checking mechanisms for the Cisco Aironet 1142 Series Access Point (AP) could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition (DoS) on an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient flow control mechanisms on ingress management traffic sent to a targeted device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by transmitting a large amount of authentication and association request traffic to the access-point potentially causing a complete denial of service (DoS) condition on the device.   Conditions: Device running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue. Description: 8540 running 8.3.133.0 with around 1400xAP1142, AP disconnections started on 8.3.121.0.  Number of AP disconnections has increased to around 20 APs per day. When AP is facing the issue we don't have access to the AP through SSH, CDP or console. Completely freeze. We have captures showing that AP stops to reply to icmp request and then capwap control packets from WLC not replied so WLC tears down connection, we can still see some capwap data tx/rx by the AP, after 2min no further capwap data observed. Show techs from AP before facing issue show no leaks or high cpuIssue is occurring randomly. It is mostly occurring during business hours but we identified some issues during weekend with no wireless clients connected to the AP.Looks like a regression since similar issue was reported in CSCuo64362

Title: Cisco Expressway Series and TelePresence VCS Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the received packet parser of Cisco Expressway Series and Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a reload of the affected system, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient size validation of user-supplied data. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted H.224 data in Real-Time Transport Protocol (RTP) packets in an H.323 call. An exploit could allow the attacker to overflow a buffer in a cache that belongs to the received packet parser, which will result in a crash of the application, resulting in a DoS condition.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170125-expressway  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3790 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Prime Infrastructure Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A Vulnerability in the web framework code of the Cisco Prime Infrastructure could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attack against the user of the web interface of the affected system.   The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of some parameters passed to the web-server. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the user to access a malicious link or by intercepting the user request and injecting the malicious code. An exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected site or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  Conditions: Exposure is not configuration dependent.  Workaround: Not applicable or available.  Further Problem Description Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigations can be found at: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html  This vulnerability has been disclosed in the following advisory: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170301-cpi  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2017-3848  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: /webacs/api/v1/data/Alarms.json is vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting and HTML Tag Injection via the parameters ;message; and ;acknowledgment;.  This was found during an automated scan using HP WebInspect test tool. It is recommended to sanitize the input parameters properly.Here are some sample requests:{{{GET /webacs/api/v1/data/Alarms.json?message=contains(%22disk%20volume%22)%3c%69%4d%67%20%53%72%43%3d%76%42%73%43%72%49%70%54%3a%4d%73%67%42%6f%78%28%34%37%38%38%36%29%3e&severity=in(%22MAJOR%22%2c%22CRITICAL%22%2c%22MINOR%22)&acknowledgementStatus=isFalse() HTTP/1.1GET /webacs/api/v1/data/Alarms.json?message=contains(%22disk%20volume%22)&severity=in(%22MAJOR%22%2c%22CRITICAL%22%2c%22MINOR%22)&acknowledgementStatus=isFalse()%3c%69%4d%67%20%53%72%43%3d%76%42%73%43%72%49%70%54%3a%4d%73%67%42%6f%78%28%34%33%34%38%37%29%3e HTTP/1.1}}}

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers Access Control List Security Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in certain filtering mechanisms of access control lists (ACLs) for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass ACL rules that have been configured for an affected device.  The vulnerability exists because the affected device fails to inspect and match certain traffic that meets the criteria defined in ACL rules configured for the device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP packets to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass certain sets of rules defined in ACLs for the affected device.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170719-asr1  Conditions: Device running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: For information about vulnerable and not vulnerable software releases, and time frame for fixed software releases, please open a support case with your support organization. PSIRT does not provide or maintain this information for Medium SIR advisories.   This is the best available information on affected/not affected/fixed releases as of May 22, 2017. PSIRT will not maintain this information. For updates, please follow up with the DE assigned to this bug.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6672 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Scenario :1) Load ACS config2) Send PCAP having Syn, Syn-ack, Concat GET+CONNECT+Partial_req, Valid GET3) Here, Valid GET request matches to http-error rule (marked as Permanent Failure)4) Now retransmit the concatenated packet which goes again for rule-matching and Even though ;http-error; rule is at the highest priority, this matches to the ;DEFAULT_TRAFFIC_PCRF; rule which is ;http any-match;.Note: This behaviour is observed when delay charging is not enabled.

Title: Cisco ASA SSL VPN Memory Blocks Exhaustion Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: Crafted HTTP request may cause the 64K Blocks depletion  Conditions: webvpn needs to be enabled. This can be verified by doing show run webvpn and checking if webvpn enable command is present. Block depletion can be checked by executing show block at regular interval   The following syslog is created when the memory block goes below the acceptable threashold ASA-3-321007: System is low on free memory blocks of size 65536 (0 CNT out of 16 MAX)  Workaround: Further Problem Description: A vulnerability in in the SSL VPN feature of Cisco ASA Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the exhaustion of available memory which could lead to system instability and availability issue on the SSL VPN services.  The vulnerability is due to improper implementatino of the memory blocks allocation when processing crafted HTTP packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by by sending crafted HTTP packet to the affected system. SSL VPN should be configured in order to exploit this vulnerability.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-3407 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3407  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: It might be possible that some users try to exploit a vulnerability on the ASA Webvpn port by sending long HTTP GET requests causing the 64K Blocks depletion.In the Output of show block dump output we can see the allocation by snp_mp_ssl_allocb.Syslog seen during the time of issue have also been attached.

Title: DES and IDEA cipher, CBC cipher suites, and static key cipher suites
RNE: Symptom: This is a modification on the Cisco Unified Communications Manager (Cisco UCM) to adopt new secure code best practices to enhance the security posture and  resiliency of the product. The web server should be secure by default. Known  broken/risky/weak cryptographic and hashing algorithms should not  be used.The following vulnerabilities were found:  * TLS/SSL Server Supports DES and IDEA Cipher Suites  * TLS/SSL Server Supports The Use of Static Key Ciphers  * TLS/SSL Server Supports Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) Ciphers  In addition the product includes a version of Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Secure Socket Layer (SSL) protocols that are affected by the vulnerabilities  identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:   CVE-2011-3389 and CVE-2013-0169  Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: Not currently available.  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the CVE vulnerabilities listed above can be found at  http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html. Title: AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Local Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the kernel extension for Mac OS X of Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client could allow an authenticated, local attacker to cause a denial of service condition.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient bounds checking. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a piece of contiguous data in memory which is read by the client software. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause an OS X kernel panic.  Conditions: Running an affected version of the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client.  Workaround: Not applicable or available.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.6/3.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:POC/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-4290 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Original Headline: Buffer overflow in kernel extension's common codeA buffer overflow condition has been discovered in the AnyConnect client kernel extension. Exploitation conditions for the overflow are likely to be platform dependent.With a crafted piece of contiguous data passed in from user-space, it may be possible to overwrite the kernel's crash handler, gaining control of execution in kernel space. On MacOSX, the user passing in the data must have root privileges,but this hasn't been tested on other platforms.In kdf/kcrt/ngc_serializer.cpp:331, when the variable ;len; has a value greater than MAX_UINT - 256 and less than MAX_UINT, the memcpy on line 331 will writeover the buffer m_p_buffer with len bytes, while only allocating < 256 bytes. This will cause the data pointed to by parameter ;p; to be written into thekernel from user-space, causing a system crash. The issue is caused by adding256 to the ;len; variable without checking for overflowing ;m_buf_size;.The relevant lines of ngc_serializer.cpp are:320    m_buf_size = len + 256;321    m_p_buffer = NGC_NEW_SERIALIZE_BUFFER uchar8[m_buf_size]       ...331    memcpy(m_p_buffer, p, len);Line 320 overflows the ;m_buf_size; variable.Line 321 allocates less than 256 bytes for ;m_p_buffer;.Line 331 copies in more bytes than ;m_p_buffer; can hold.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Title: Cisco Security Manager is vulnerable to CVE-2014-0160 - aka Heartbleed
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Security Manager includes a version of openssl that is affected by the vulnerability identified by the Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) ID CVE-2014-0160.  This bug has been opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: CSM (Cisco Security Manager) versions 4.5, 4.5 SP0 CP1 and 4.5 SP0 CP2.  Workaround: None.  Upgrade affected versions (noted in Conditions section) to a fixed release (4.5 SP0 CP3 or 4.6 or later) once available.  4.5 SP0 CP3 can be downloaded from cisco.com at following link, http://software.cisco.com/download/release.html?mdfid=280033778&softwareid=282773974&release=4.5&relind=AVAILABLE&rellifecycle=&reltype=latest The patch installer file is "CSM450_SP0_PP3_Installer.exe" Refer to readme file "Readme_for_CSM450_SP0_PP3_Installer.txt" for patch install instructions.  Further Problem Description: Additional details about this vulnerability can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/5:  https://intellishield.cisco.com/security/alertmanager/cvss?target=new&version=2.0&vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:H/RL:U/RC:C  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this score based on information obtained from multiple sources. This includes the CVSS score assigned by the third-party vendor when available. The CVSS score assigned may not reflect the actual impact on the Cisco Product.   CVE-2014-0160 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/psirt/security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: This is defect is to check whether CSM is affected by the hearbleed vulnerability (see below), CSM 4.5 is having openssl 1.0.1e hence it needs to be migrated to 1.0.1g. OpenSSL Security Advisory [07 Apr 2014]========================================TLS heartbeat read overrun (CVE-2014-0160  )==========================================A missing bounds check in the handling of the TLS heartbeat extension can beused to reveal up to 64k of memory to a connected client or server.Only 1.0.1 and 1.0.2-beta releases of OpenSSL are affected including1.0.1f and 1.0.2-beta1.Thanks for Neel Mehta of Google Security for discovering this bug and toAdam Langley <agl@chromium.org> and Bodo Moeller <bmoeller@acm.org> forpreparing the fix.Affected users should upgrade to OpenSSL 1.0.1g. Users unable to immediatelyupgrade can alternatively recompile OpenSSL with -DOPENSSL_NO_HEARTBEATS.1.0.2 will be fixed in 1.0.2-beta2.For further information please see:https://psirt.cisco.com/collaborate/heartbleedhttps://psirt.cisco.com/PSIRThot/openssl-CVE-2014-0160

Title: NDB may stop working unexpectedly
RNE: Symptom: After some time of normal operation, Nexus Data Broker (NDB) is suddenly no longer reachable through the GUI.  Openflow switches using the underlying XNC as controller report a connection failure to the controller. For example:  2014 Nov  9 05:06:22 switch01 %VMAN-5-VIRT_INST_NOTICE: VIRTUAL SERVICE  ofa_ndbemb LOG: OVS: sw1-tcp:10.0.0.1:6653%management: no response to  inactivity probe after 5 seconds, disconnecting  2014 Nov  9 05:06:22 switch01 %VMAN-5-VIRT_INST_NOTICE: VIRTUAL SERVICE  ofa_ndbemb LOG: OVS: sw1-tcp:10.0.0.1:6653%management: connection failed  (Connection reset by peer)  Conditions: This has been observed on NDB 2.0 running embedded on a Nexus 3548 running NXOS 6.0(2)A4(1) It is not confirmed at this time whether or not other versions or other platforms are affected.  Workaround: Restart the NDB service: conf t onep virtual-service ofa_ndb no activate activate exit  Please note: unsaved changes in NDB will be lost.  Further Problem Description: This defect only affects the working of the controller and the NDB application, it does not affect the flows created by the controller, except flows that were created but not saved. PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.7: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:TF/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Customer in SR 632557993 is seeing NDB 2.0 (embedded on Nexus 3548 running 6.0(2)A4(1)) crash when a security scan is run.Crash seems to occur in the accept() on the https socket./xnclite/xnc/logs/xnc-out.log shows:## A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:##  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0xf7fbf22a, pid=80, tid=3368024944## JRE version: 7.0# Java VM: OpenJDK Server VM (21.0-b17 mixed mode linux-x86 )# Problematic frame:# C  [libtcp_clt.so+0x1022a]  accept+0xc2a## Core dump written. Default location: /xnclite/xnc/core or core.80## An error report file with more information is saved as:# /xnclite/xnc/hs_err_pid80.log## If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:#   http://bugreport.sun.com/bugreport/crash.jsp# The crash happened outside the Java Virtual Machine in native code.# See problematic frame for where to report the bug.#

Title: Cisco AMP for Endpoints Static Key Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Cisco AMP For Endpoints application that would allow an authenticated, local attacker to access a static key value stored in the local application software.  The vulnerability is due to the use of a static key value stored in the application used to encrypt the connector protection password. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by gaining local, administrative access to a Windows host and stopping the Cisco AMP for endpoints service.  Conditions: Applies only to Windows endpoints with Admin privileges.  Workaround: Disable administrative privileges on the Windows machines that have the Cisco AMP for endpoints enabled.  Further Problem Description: Only applies to Windows endpoints. Linux, MacOSX, Android, Apple iOS are not impacted.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.7: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12317  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
