Title: Cisco WebEx Browser Extension Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco WebEx browser extensions for Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox provided by Cisco WebEx Meeting Server could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the affected browser on an affected system. This vulnerability affects the browser extensions for Cisco WebEx Meetings Server, Cisco WebEx Centers (Meeting Center, Event Center, Training Center, and Support Center), and Cisco WebEx Meetings when they are running on Microsoft Windows.  The vulnerability is due to a design defect in the extension. An attacker who can convince an affected user to visit an attacker-controlled web page or follow an attacker-supplied link with an affected browser could exploit the vulnerability. If successful, the attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the affected browser.  Conditions: This vulnerability affects all current, previous, and deprecated versions of the Cisco WebEx browser extensions for Chrome and Firefox for Windows.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170717-webex  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 9.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6753 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: EXTERNAL REPORTER:I see several problems with the way sanitization works, and have produced a remote code execution exploit to demonstrate them. This extension has over 20M active Chrome users alone, FireFox and other browsers are likely to be affected as well.1. JSON parsing discrepancies.2. GpcScript verification Regex is incomplete.3. Whitelisted Function Calls are not necessarily safe to call.4. No prevention against downgrade attacks.See BIG DESCRIPTION for more information & examples.90 Disclosure Timer STARTS: JULY 6, 2017

Title: UCCE built-in Java vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco Unified Contact Center Enterprise includes a version of Oracle Java Runtime Environment (JRE) that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:   CVE-2012-4681  This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: Not currently available.  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 10/9.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-4681 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: UCCE employs Java JRE 6 in a variety of ways. It is required by JTAPI to hook up to CUCM. Tomcat based Diagnostic Framework relies on it. There is also CMS/ConAPI dependency and most likely much more.From the below email from BU we do not allow customers to upgrade Java once new updates come up.I can also see that the latest UCCE 10.5(1) still has Java 6 Update 30.I cannot see the publish date for JRE6u30 on the Oracle website however Wikipedia reveals this was back in 12-2011:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_version_history#Java_6_updatesThis means we have a vulnerable component:http://www.cvedetails.com/product/1526/SUN-JRE.html?vendor_id=5* * *Subject: RE: UCCE AW/HDS:  S3 Non-Urgent-Escalation 624447047 ICM 8.0.1 HDS Re-Run SetUP - Apache down - No Web Set-up Tool, 01/15/2013 {games_id:22285}Hello Frank,We do not support the updates from oracle and we use the default Java version with each UCCE version.If customer is looking for a higher java version ? they need to upgrade to the next available UCCE versionTo avail the latest fix from oracle.I hope it clarifies the query and please reach out to me if you still have any queries on this.Regards,Rajalakshmi M

Title: ASA 9.1.1.7 crash Thread Name: Unicorn Proxy Thread
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the WebVPN functionality of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to crash.  The vulnerability is due to a fault in the Proxy Bypass Content Rewriter implementation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by performing an HTTP request that triggers content rewriting. Depending on the configuration, a successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause the appliance to crash or trigger an error recovery event.  When the ASA crashes it will be on Thread Name: Unicorn Proxy Thread  Conditions: Using webvpn with content rewrite configuration  Workaround: If WebVPN event recovery is enabled, the ASA do not crash but logs a webvpn recovery event instead. Workaround configuration:  webvpn    no error-recovery disable  Further Problem Description: This vulnerability does not affect 8.x software versions.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.3/5.5:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=https://intellishield.cisco.com/security/alertmanager/cvssCalculator.do?dispatch=1&version=2&&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2013-5557 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: After upgrading to 9.1.1.7 The ASA started logging webvpn recovery  events with no crash because they had the webvpn recovery events enabled.After disabling webvpn recovery, the ASA has crashed on Thread Name: Unicorn Proxy Thread

Title: Crash in ADSL SNMP code
RNE: Symptom: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) subsystem of Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted SNMP packet to an affected system via IPv4 or IPv6. Only traffic directed to an affected system can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities.  The vulnerabilities are due to a buffer overflow condition in the SNMP subsystem of the affected software. The vulnerabilities affect all versions of SNMP Versions 1, 2c, and 3. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 2c or earlier, the attacker must know the SNMP read-only community string for the affected system. To exploit these vulnerabilities via SNMP Version 3, the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain full control of the affected system or cause the affected system to reload.  Cisco will release software updates that address these vulnerabilities. There are workarounds that address these vulnerabilities.  The advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170629-snmp  Conditions: Devices running an affected version of Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software.  Workaround: Administrators are advised to allow only trusted users to have SNMP access on an affected system. Administrators are also advised to monitor affected systems by using the show snmp host command in the CLI.  In addition, administrators can mitigate these vulnerabilities by disabling the following MIBs on a device:      ADSL-LINE-MIB     ALPS-MIB     CISCO-ADSL-DMT-LINE-MIB     CISCO-BSTUN-MIB     CISCO-MAC-AUTH-BYPASS-MIB     CISCO-SLB-EXT-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-DNIS-MIB     CISCO-VOICE-NUMBER-EXPANSION-MIB     TN3270E-RT-MIB  To create or update a view entry and disable the affected MIBs, administrators can use the snmp-server view global configuration command, as shown in the following example:      snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP iso included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP internet included     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpUsmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpVacmMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP snmpCommunityMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.252 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP transmission.94 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP mib-2.34.9 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.35 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.95 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.130 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.219 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMgmt.254 excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoMabMIB excluded     snmp-server view NO_BAD_SNMP ciscoExperiment.997 excluded  To then apply this configuration to a community string, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server community mycomm view NO_BAD_SNMP RO  For SNMP Version 3, administrators can use the following command:       snmp-server group v3group auth read NO_BAD_SNMP write NO_BAD_SNMP  Further Problem Description: Customer are advised to utilize the Cisco IOS Software Checker or Contact Cisco TAC to determine if fixed software has been released for an affected platform.  Cisco IOS Software Checker: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6744 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: It is possible to reliably crash a router by sending it a single packet. This sender only needs to know the snmp community read string. The crash can be triggered by issuing the following command on any system that supports the snmpget program:snmpget -v2c -c <read-pwd> <address> `python -c ;print '1.3.6.1.2.1.10.94.1.1.14.1.2%s'%('.1'*100);`The crash is caused by a overflowing a stack variable, potentially allowing an attacker to gain control of the cpu program counter. I have recreated the crash as far back as 15.0(1)M, although checking the source shows that this problem originated at least as far back as 12.2.  This crash does not require any configuration of ADSL, the feature need only be present in the image.The crash occurs because the function k_adslLineConfProfileEntry_get() in sr_adslmib.c creates a 33 byte buffer on the stack, and then blindly copies however many bytes are specified in the incoming request. This also occurs another five  places in that file. All of these callers to memset must validate that the length specified in the OID is less than the length of the destination buffer before doing the copy.

Title: Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Unauthorized Password Change Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: The password change functionality in the Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Web Conferencing application could allow an unauthenticated remote, attacker to change the passwords of arbitrary users. The vulnerability is due to the following:  Users are not required to enter the previous password during a password change request.  HTTP session functionality does not validate the session ID in the HTTP request for the password change request.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability via a crafted HTTP request and change arbitrary user passwords to gain access to the application. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to use the reset credentials to gain full control of the application.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There is no workaround that mitigates this vulnerability.   This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150722-mp  Conditions:  Workaround:  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  10/8.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-4262 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Previous password not required during a password change requestThe password change functionality of the Cisco Unified MeetingPlace application is allowing an unauthenticated attacker to change passwords of arbitrary users.  - Users are not required to enter the previous password during a password change request.  - The session functionality does not validate the session ID for the password change request.--- Hence, creating a defect for Session ID checks should not be performed.+++ Old password check needs to be performed.

Title: Jabber 9.6 sends Authorization Header over unencrypted connection
RNE: Symptoms:  A vulnerability in the web based user interface of the Cisco Jabber for Windows could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to have ''read'' access to part of information stored in the affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of specific values passed via HTTP GET methods by the affected software. If successful, the attacker could access sensitive system information from the system.  Conditions: Cisco Jabber for Windows 9.6 and 9.7.   Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-4218 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: VTP-VUL-SCAN - Security holes for the tcp/udp processes in CSS
RNE: Symptom:   Audit scans on the CSS product detect multiple vulnerabilities.      Conditions:   When using such scanning tools as Nessus multiple vulnerabilities are  identified on the CSS.   These scanning tools verify open ports and specific versions of installed  software. They do not   validate that software modifications or patching may have taken place to  mitigate the public    vulnerabilities screened against.      Workaround:      CVE-2002-0083           CVE-2002-0083 does not apply to the CSS11500 SSH implementation.      CVE : CVE-2002-0575           CVE-2002-0575 does not apply to the CSS11500 SSH implementation.            The CSS11500 SSH implementation does not support Kerberos/AFS.      CVE : CVE-2002-0639, CVE-2002-0640           CVE-2002-0639 and CVE-2002-0640 do not apply to the CSS11500 SSH            implementation as the CSS does not support challenge response            authentication during the SSH handshake phase. For a full            description of this vulnerability see:           http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2002-0639:               "Integer overflow in sshd in OpenSSH 2.9.9 through 3.3 allows              remote attackers to execute arbitrary code during challenge              response authentication (ChallengeResponseAuthentication) when              OpenSSH is using SKEY or BSD_AUTH authentication."      CVE : CVE-2003-0682, CVE-2003-0693, CVE-2003-0695           CVE-2003-0693 was previously fixed via CSCec35690. Please reference            http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20030917-openssh.shtml.         CVE : CVE-2003-0386           CVE-2003-0386 does not apply to the CSS11500 SSH implementation as            the restricted list of host feature per-user is not supported. In            addition the CSS11500 does not use the OpenSSH DNS lookup            functionality. DNS is supported separately on the CSS11500.      CVE : CVE-2001-0361                   This was made configurable via bug CSCeb83707. The command            is "[no] ssh version [v1|v2]". The default is to allow both            SSH V1 and SSH V2 connections but it can be configured by            the customer to disallow SSH V1 connections via the command            "ssh version v2".       CVE : CVE-2000-0843           CVE-2000-0843 does not apply to the CSS11500 and can be classified            as a "false positive". The CSS11500 restricts the username to 31            characters.      CVE : CVE-2002-2300           CVE-2002-2300 does not apply to the CSS11550 FTP implementation            because the "CEL" FTP command is not supported.
Description: The issue was found in sg0820205s.adiCSS was scanned for full TCP/UDP port ranges using the tool nessus. Once after scanning, a report file was being generated by nessus tool. In this file the SSH, telnet and ftp process are said to have ;Security Holes;. These processes are vulnerable to attacks.

Title: Session token in URL (Low risk)
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco.  Do not forward this information to mailing lists or newsgroups.  Documentation writers: it is prohibited to publish this Release-note  Enclosure (RNE) until the content has been approved by PSIRT. Description: When the session token is transmitted in the URL, it can result in the user's session token being logged in multiple locations including the user's web browser history, proxy server logs, web server and application server logs. The user's session token will also be sent to any third party site in the referrer HTTP header when the user's web browser loads an external server.

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers Access Control List Security Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in certain filtering mechanisms of access control lists (ACLs) for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass ACL rules that have been configured for an affected device.  The vulnerability exists because the affected device fails to inspect and match certain traffic that meets the criteria defined in ACL rules configured for the device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP packets to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass certain sets of rules defined in ACLs for the affected device.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170719-asr1  Conditions: Device running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: For information about vulnerable and not vulnerable software releases, and time frame for fixed software releases, please open a support case with your support organization. PSIRT does not provide or maintain this information for Medium SIR advisories.   This is the best available information on affected/not affected/fixed releases as of May 22, 2017. PSIRT will not maintain this information. For updates, please follow up with the DE assigned to this bug.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6672 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Impact of X-header insertion on a flow which is redirected or discarded

Title: Argument injection in request-ntp-keygen
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in command line interface (CLI) of the Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) Expressway could allow an authenticated, local attacker to inject arbitrary arguments to a script on the affected system.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of content on a local file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by writing arbitrary code to the affected file. An exploit could allow the attacker to write options to the file which has root privilege.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.8/6.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-4327 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:

Title: Cisco Unified MeetingPlace SQL Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco Unified MeetingPlace could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to impact the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the affected system by executing arbitrary SQL queries.  The vulnerability is due to failure to validate user-supplied input used in SQL queries. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted SQL statement to an affected system. An exploit could allow the attacker to read, modify, or delete entries in some database tables.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6/5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:P/I:P/A:P/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-4233  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The Cisco Unified MeetingPlace application makes queries to the database using Structured Query Language (SQL). When making database queries, the MPWebOS/Note Integration uses data received from the user to dynamically create a SQL statement. The application fails to validate user supplied data when forming SQL statements, resulting in SQL command execution.Acting as an authenticated administrator user Security Assurance was able to modify the SQL statements used by the application to query the database. This attack is known as SQL injection and allowed Security Assurance to:- Extract database information- Extract user details- Retrieve the username and (encrypted) password of every application user
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: jklimarc           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs.  Please do not change the  Release-note Enclosure, as PSIRT will modify it appropriately when this  issue is made public.          Should customers request information regarding this DDTs or appear to be running into this DDTs within their network, please bring it to the immediate attention of the Cisco PSIRT at psirt@cisco.com.

Title: Cisco Security Appliances SNMP Polling Information Disclosure Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in SNMP polling for the Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA), Email Security Appliance (ESA) and Content Security Management Appliance (SMA) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to discover confidential information about the appliances which should only be available to an administrator user.  The vulnerability is due to lack of protecting confidential information at rest in response to SNMP poll requests. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by doing a crafted SNMP poll request to the targeted security appliance. An exploit could allow the attacker to discover confidential information which should be restricted and the attacker could use this information to conduct additional reconnaissance attacks. The attacker would have knowledge of the configured SNMP community string to exploit this vulnerability.  Conditions: The security appliance is configured for SNMP polling.  Workaround: A mitigation for this vulnerability is to disable SNMP. If SNMP is not enabled the device is not vulnerable.  Further Problem Description: None.   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6783 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: During some tests for SNMP in the lab, we could retrieve the whole data structure of the WSA, including some sensitive data that should be accessible for root/service account:the command used: snmpwalk -O a -v 2c -c ironport -M /snmp/  10.48.78.29 iso.3.6.1.2.1Device IP: 10.48.78.29/snmp/: the file that contains my MIB and SMI files.Security implication: When using the snmp version 2, unprivileged user can have access to privileged information by sniffing the snmp traffic. Customers should not have access to these information, but now they can using the SNMP.The current summary of the accessed information:- all memory information including the following: (OK)- root directory structure including the content of the following Directories: (NOT OK).- running processes python scripts with full path. (NOT OK).- current network connections and open ports on WSA appliance, (including connections from localhost such as watchdog). NOT OK- all the binary files that is being used on the proxy: (NOT OK)- appliance current running scripts for collecting status and top logs outputs:(NOT OK)- the results can vary depending on the state of the appliance and the time you trigger the snmp request. which in sometime can include some sensitive passwords or users credentials.

Title: CERT: buffer overflow in libupnp
RNE: $$IGNORE  Summary The Portable Software Developer Kit (SDK) for Universal Plug-n-Play (UPnP) devices contain a libupnp library, originally known as the Intel SDK for UPnP Devices, which is vulnerable to multiple stack-based buffer overflows when handling malicious Simple Service Discovery Protocol (SSDP) requests. This library is used in several vendor network devices in addition to media streaming and file sharing applications.  These vulnerabilities were disclosed on January 29th, 2013 in a CERT Vulnerability Note, VU#922681, which can be viewed at:  http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/922681  Cisco is currently evaluating products for possible exposure to these vulnerabilities. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130129-upnp  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 10/9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:POC/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-5958, CVE-2012-5959, CVE-2012-5960, CVE-2012-5961, CVE-2012-5962, CVE-2012-5963, CVE-2012-5964, CVE-2012-5965 has  been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Symptom:  Conditions:  Workaround:  Further Problem Description:
Description: PSIRT-1677458585 - US-CERT announcing several buffer overflows in libupnpPlease keep this vulnerability information private until the public disclosuredate of Jan. 29th 2013.  Please do not release patches to public source treesor create tickets in public bug trackers yet.  We want affected vendors tohave a chance to patch before the details are made public.IPCentral shows that Asterix & Saturn use libupnp that is vulnerable to buffer overflow vulnerabilities.  We have received the vulnerability report below from HD Moore of Rapid7 &Metasploit.Portable SDK for UPnP Devices unique_service_name() Buffer OverflowsThe libupnp library, originally known as the Intel SDK for UPnPDevices and now maintained as the Portable SDK for UPnP Devices,is vulnerable to multiple stack-based buffer overflows whenhandling malicious SSDP requests. This library is used by tensof millions of deployed network devices, of which approximatelytwenty million are exposed directly to the internet. In addition tonetwork devices, many streaming media and file sharing applicationsare also exposed to attack through this library.This advisory does not address historic or current vulnerabilitiesin the HTTP and SOAP processing code of libupnp.[ Affected Versions ]Versions 1.2 (Intel SDK) and 1.2.1a - 1.8.0 (Portable SDK) areaffected by at least three remotely exploitable buffer overflows inthe unique_service_name() function, which is called to processincoming SSDP requests on UDP port 1900. Additionally, versions priorto 1.6.17 are vulnerable to additional issues in the same function.

Title: CVE-2013-6450 OpenSSL Multiple Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
RNE: Symptoms:  Cisco WAAS includes a version of OpenSSL (1.0.0a with patches) that some scanners may flag as affected by the vulnerabilities identified by the  following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2013-6450 , CVE-2013-6449  and  CVE-2013-4353    Cisco has analyzed these vulnerabilities and concluded that the product is not impacted.  Conditions: Not applicable  WAAS is not vulnerable as it doesn'tt support the affected features - TLS 1.2, DTLS and Next Protocol Negotiation.  The code fix applied via this bug was the patch of CVE-2013-6450, given that OpenSSL 1.0.0a has code support for DTLS but the path to this code  is not reached via any configuration of the WAAS.  Workaround: Not applicable  Further Problem Description: Additional details about the vulnerabilities listed above can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has evaluated this issue and does not meet the criteria for PSIRT ownership or involvement. This issue will be addressed via  normal resolution channels.  If you believe that there is new information that would cause a change in the severity of this issue, please contact psirt@cisco.com for another  evaluation.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: OpenSSL is a toolkit that implements the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) protocols as well as afull-strength general purpose cryptography library.OpenSSL is exposed to multiple vulnerabilities:1) A carefully crafted invalid TLS handshake could crash OpenSSL with a NULL pointer exception. (CVE-2013-4353)2) A flaw in DTLS handling can cause an application using OpenSSL and DTLS to crash. (CVE-2013-6450)3) A flaw in OpenSSL can cause an application using OpenSSL to crash when using TLS version 1.2. (CVE-2013-6449)Affected Versions:OpenSSL 1.0.1e, 1.0.1d, 1.0.1c, 1.0.1b, 1.0.1a, 1.0.1, 1.0.0k, 1.0.0j, 1.0.0i, 1.0.0g, 1.0.0f, 1.0.0e, 1.0.0d, 1.0.0c, 1.0.0b, 1.0.0a, 1.0.0.We are using the fallowing open ssl version,OpenSSL> versionOpenSSL 1.0.0a 1 Jun 2010OpenSSL>We have found these CVE vulnerability while running Qualys tool over 540 b 58.Please find the report attached.

Title: BGP's BFD support code opens tcp/udp 3784 and 3785 to bypass access-lists
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the BGP Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) implementation of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass the ACL for some specific TCP and UDP traffic.  The vulnerability is due to the BFD implementation incorrectly allowing traffic with destination ports 3784 and 3785 through the interface ACLs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending TCP or UDP packets with 3784 or 3785 as destination port through the ASA.  Conditions: The issue affects ASA software version 9.6(2) and later. No specific configuration is required.  Workaround: Explicitly block TCP and UDP for ports 3784 and 3785 on the ingress ACL for the interfaces in question.  Further Problem Description:  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3867 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: With the introduction of BFD support for BGP on the asa, the code changes seems to incorrectly open TCP and UDP port 3784 and 3785 through the interface ACLs. This allows traffic **that is not permitted** to traverse from LOWER security to HIGHER security. unless **explicitly** denied. This means that these ports are skipping the implicit deny at the end of the ACL when traversing LOW to HIGH.port 3876 is UNAFFECTEDASA# packet input outside tcp 8.8.8.8 12345 10.1.1.1 3786 det<snip>Result:input-interface: outsideinput-status: upinput-line-status: upoutput-interface: insideoutput-status: upoutput-line-status: upAction: dropDrop-reason: (acl-drop) Flow is denied by configured rulePort 3785 and 3784 are AFFECTED:ASA# packet input outside tcp 8.8.8.8 12345 10.1.1.1 3785 det<snip>Result:input-interface: outsideinput-status: upinput-line-status: upoutput-interface: insideoutput-status: upoutput-line-status: upAction: allow

Title: Multiple SQLi across CCMAdmin web application
RNE: Symptom: The CCMAdmin application of Cisco Unified Communication Manager (CUCM) is potentially vulnerable to multiple SQL injections. These injections could be leveraged to disclose information from within the CCM Administration component.  Conditions: Default installation of an affected release of CUCM.  Workaround: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 3.5/3.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: Multiple SQL injections were found across the Cisco Unified CM Administration webapp. Based on initial findings in CSCuh10306, 7 additional injections were discovered prompting additional code analysis. The code revealed that 170+ pages mapped to (struts) or inheriting GenericFindListAction.java may be susceptible to a SQLinjection.The 7 examples below show that it is possible to pull user credential information from the Informix database through illegitimate SQL queries. Note that ANY table could be queried against, the credential table was just used as an example.Fixes should not be focused only on queries of the credential table. An architectural review of SQL queries utilized should be considered to fully address the wide-spread impact of this issue.See examples enclosure for description referenced examples.

Title: UCSM Local Command Injection/File Disclosure via less on subordinate FI
RNE: Symptoms:  A vulnerability in the command-line interface (CLI) processor of the Cisco UCS Manager could allow an authenticated, local attacker to inject arbitrary commands .  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the device and submitting crafted commands through the CLI in the subordinate fabric interconnect. An exploit could allow the attacker to inject and execute arbitrary commands which could result in complete system compromise.  Conditions: Attacker must be authenticated to UCS.  Workaround: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.8/5.6: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-4279 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: ACS 5 / Local file inclusion vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco Access Control Server (ACS) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform a file inclusion attack.  The vulnerability is due to improper input validation of certain parameters passed to an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing a user to follow a malicious link. An exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected site or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:H/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE-2015-0729 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco WebEx Network Recording Player Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Multiple vulnerabilities exist in Cisco WebEx Network Recording Player for Advanced Recording Format (.ARF) and WebEx Recording Format (.WRF) files. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by providing a customer with a malicious ARF or WRF file via email or URL and convincing the user to launch the file. Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could cause an affected player to crash and, in some cases, could allow arbitrary code execution on the system of a targeted user.  Conditions: Cisco WebEx Business Suite (WBS30) client builds prior to T30.20 Cisco WebEx Business Suite (WBS31) client builds prior to T31.14.1 Cisco WebEx Business Suite (WBS32) client builds prior to T32.2  Workaround: There are no workarounds that address these vulnerabilities. However, it is possible to remove all WebEx software completely from a system using the Meeting Services Removal Tool (for Microsoft Windows users) or Mac Cisco-WebEx Uninstaller (for Apple Mac OS X users) available at https://help.webex.com/docs/DOC-5432.  Removal of the WebEx software from a Linux or UNIX-based system can be accomplished by following the steps in the Cisco Collaboration Help for Cisco Spark, WebEx, and Jabber article: https://collaborationhelp.cisco.com/article/en-us/WBX28548.  Further Problem Description: The Cisco WebEx Players are applications that are used to play back WebEx meeting recordings that have been recorded by an online meeting attendee. The player can be automatically installed when the user accesses a recording file that is hosted on a WebEx server.  Source This vulnerability was reported to PSIRT by Yihan Lian.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12367 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Disable either BMC by default or force IPMI passwords to be changed.
RNE: Symptom: Certain Ethernet cards shipped with this appliance have the BMC enabled by default, and may obtain an IP address via DHCP.  Conditions: Affects models ship with the baseboard management controller (BMC) active by default.  The BMC has a default username and password, that potentially can be used to access the appliance via IPMI.  Workaround: It is recommended to either: a) Disable remote access to the device by changing the BMC settings via the BIOS. b) Change the username/password for the BMC via the BIOS settings should customers wish to leverage IPMI to manage the device.  Further Problem Description: Once the bug has been integrated the device with disable BMC support by default.  Currently BMC and management via IPMI of this appliance is not supported by Cisco TAC.  Should customers wish to enable BMC and manage the device with IPMI, they may change the BIOS settings to enable BMC and at the same time choose a suitable username and password for management.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.4/5.3:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=&version=2.0 dispatch=1&version=2&vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C  CVE ID CVE-2011-2576 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: By default the BMC is enabled with remote access possible using IPMI.  The remote access username and passwords are set at default, allowing remote access to the appliance.Disable BMC (Baseboard Management Controller) feature using BIOS setup.

Title: Cisco FXOS and NX-OS Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) implementation of Cisco Firepower Extensible Operating System (FXOS) and NX-OS System Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an affected device to reload.  The vulnerability occurs because AAA processes prevent the NX-OS System Manager from receiving keepalive messages when an affected device receives a high rate of login attempts, such as in a brute-force login attack. System memory can run low on the FXOS devices under the same conditions, which could cause the AAA process to unexpectedly restart or cause the device to reload.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by performing a brute-force login attack against a device that is configured with AAA security services. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause the affected device to reload.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171018-aaavty  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3883 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE input queue holding Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom Seeing input queue holding 250 packets which are not released.  Example: Input queue: 250/375/0/0 (size/max/drops/flushes); Total output drops: 0  Symptom: A vulnerability in the UDP processing code of Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the input queue of an affected system to hold UDP packets, causing an interface queue wedge and a denial of service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to Cisco IOS Software application changes that create UDP sockets and leave the sockets idle without closing them. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending UDP packets with a destination port of 0 to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause UDP packets to be held in the input interfaces queue, resulting in a DoS condition. The input interface queue will stop holding UDP packets when it receives 250 packets.  There are workarounds that address this vulnerability.   This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-ios-udp  Conditions: This issue is addressed via different bugs id, consult the advisory https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-ios-udp for further details.  Device with default configuration.  Below table indicates affected trains and fixed releases.  Cisco IOS Software 15.1GC Train		Vulnerable 15.2GC Train		Vulnerable 15.2GCA Train		Vulnerable 15.4(3)M Train		Vulnerable, first fixed in 15.4(3)M8 15.4(2)T Train		Vulnerable, first fixed in 15.4(2)T3 15.6(2)S4		Vulnerable  No other Cisco IOS Software trains/releases are affected.  Cisco IOS XE Software   3.14S Train:		Vulnerable  3.15S Train:		Vulnerable  3.16S Train:   	Vulnerable, first fixed in 3.16.6S  3.16XB Train:		Vulnerable  3.17S Train:		Vulnerable  3.18S/SP Trains:	Vulnerable   No other Cisco IOS XE Software trains/releases are affected.  Cisco IOS XE 16.x Software  16.1 Train:		Not Vulnerable  16.2 Train:		Vulnerable  16.3 Train:		Vulnerable, first fixed in 16.3.3  16.4 and later trains: Not Vulnerable  Workaround: None.  In the event that the interface has a input hold queue  250, the interface would wedge.  Configure the affected interface with a hold queue greater  than 250.  If the hold queue was originally 75 configure the hold queue for 325 (75   250).  Router(config)#interface fastEthernet 0/0 Router(config-if)#hold-queue 325 in  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6627 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Application Framework Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the installation process of the Cisco Application Framework (CAF) for IOx could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to write or overwrite any file on the CAF.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of user supplied application packages. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by submitting crafted application packages to be installed.  Conditions: IOx enbled while running an affected version of software.  Workaround: Not applicable or available.  Further Problem Description: IOx is enabled by configuring the iox subsystem of IOS XE. To see if iox is configured use the show run | inc iox command.  IOx 1.2.4.2 and later contain the fix to this bug. The IOx version can be checked via the IOx Local Manager web management interface 1. Launch the IOx Local manager GUI 2. Login 3. Go to the ''Systems Info'' tab and check the ''Software Ver'' section  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3852 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Web cross site scripting problem reported - Dell SecureWorks
RNE: Summary  A vulnerability exists in Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) due to improper validation of user-controlled input to the web-based administrative interface. User-controlled input supplied to the login page via the HTTP User-Agent header is not properly sanitized for illegal or malicious content prior to being returned to the user in dynamically generated web content. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.  Billy Hoffman from Zoompf, Inc. discovered this vulnerability and Ben Feinstein from Dell SecureWorks reported it to Cisco. Cisco greatly appreciates the opportunity to work with researchers on security vulnerabilities and welcome the opportunity to review and assist in product reports.  Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server Software versions earlier than X7.0 are affected. This vulnerability has been corrected in Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server Software version X7.0.   The Cisco Security Response has been published at: http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20111012-vcs.shtml  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.1:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2011-3294 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

User-controlled input supplied to the login page via the HTTP User-Agent header is not properly sanitized for illegal or malicious content prior to being returned to the user in dynamically generated web content. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.Please contact Omar Santos from PSIRT for more information.

Title: Icmpv6 cores observed during cody test suite for ipv6 with TCP-SYN
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the ICMPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol for Cisco NX-OS System  Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of  service (DoS) condition due to an unexpected reload of the the ICMPv6 process.  The vulnerability is due to incorrect buffer management where a buffer is freed  twice. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by by sending a crafted IPv6  Neighbor Solicitation packet. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a DoS  of the device.  Conditions: There are IPv6 interfaces configured on the device.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Frameable response (potential Clickjacking) in guest administration page
RNE: Symptoms: The application's response does not set suitable X-Frame-Options header in order to prevent framing attacks. Conditions: None Workaround: None Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:POC/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Issue descriptionIt might be possible for a web page controlled by an attacker to load the content of this response within an iframe on the attacker's page. This may enable a ;clickjacking; attack, in which the attacker's page overlays the target application's interface with a different interface provided by the attacker. By inducing victim users to perform actions such as mouse clicks and keystrokes, the attacker can cause them to unwittingly carry out actions within the application that is being targeted. This technique allows the attacker to circumvent defenses against cross-site request forgery, and may result in unauthorized actions.Note that this issue is being reported because the application's response does not set a suitable X-Frame-Options header in order to prevent framing attacks. Some applications attempt to prevent these attacks from within the HTML page itself, using ;framebusting; code. However, this type of defense is normally ineffective and can usually be circumvented by a skilled attacker.Issue remediationYou should review the application functions that are accessible from within the response, and determine whether they can be used by application users to perform any sensitive actions within the application. If so, then a framing attack targeting this response may result in unauthorized actions.To effectively prevent framing attacks, the application should return a response header with the name X-Frame-Options and the value DENY to prevent framing altogether, or the value SAMEORIGIN to allow framing only by pages on the same origin as the response itself.See attached burp proxy report
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Title: Cisco MediaSense Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco MediaSense which could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute unwanted actions.  The vulnerability is due to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF). An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by tricking the user of a web application into executing an adverse action.  Conditions: Cisco MediaSense running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.3: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:H/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0736 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The Mediasense applications are vulnerable to cross-site request forgery (CSRF).  This means it would be possible to spoof actions that can be performed by a user of the application (such as changing the account password, adding accounts, uploading files).  Victims must click a malicious link or visit a malicious webpage while logged in to the vulnerable application for this to occur.A maliciously-crafted page would cause the user's browser to issue GET or POST requests to the vulnerable site by means of hidden images or embedded JavaScript code. Exploitation of cross-site scripting vulnerabilities also provides an effective means of delivering a CSRF attack.Recommendation:The primary defence against CSRF is to create one-time tokens (nonces) that are placed on the page and validated on the server side, to ensure that requests can only be executed once. The received nonce for a given form in a given session must match server-side information.Every significant action that can be performed within the application should be secured by means of random tokens of sufficient length to be non-guessable. If the correct token value is not received with the requested action, the action should not be performed and the user's session should be invalidated under suspicion of malicious activity.Sensitive functions should require additional authentication tokens; for example, a form which allows a user to change their password should request the current password.In addition, the incoming request referrer header could be validated to check that the request originated from an expected application URL, although this is not a sufficient defense on its own, as referrer headers can be modified or tampered with.Browser manufacturers have begun to add support for cross-origin resource sharing headers to manage cross-site requests. From the server perspective, this may typically involve setting an Access-Control-Allow-Origin header and examining request Origin headers.

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers Access Control List Security Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in certain filtering mechanisms of access control lists (ACLs) for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Aggregation Services Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass ACL rules that have been configured for an affected device.  The vulnerability exists because the affected device fails to inspect and match certain traffic that meets the criteria defined in ACL rules configured for the device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP packets to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass certain sets of rules defined in ACLs for the affected device.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170719-asr1  Conditions: Device running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: For information about vulnerable and not vulnerable software releases, and time frame for fixed software releases, please open a support case with your support organization. PSIRT does not provide or maintain this information for Medium SIR advisories.   This is the best available information on affected/not affected/fixed releases as of May 22, 2017. PSIRT will not maintain this information. For updates, please follow up with the DE assigned to this bug.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.3: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6672 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco NX-OS Python Parser Escape Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Python scripting subsystem of Cisco NX-OS System Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to escape the python parser and gain unauthorized access to the underlying operating system of the device.  The vulnerability exists due to insufficient sanitization of user supplied parameters passed to certain Python functions within the scripting sandbox of the affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to escape the scripting sandbox and execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system with the privileges of the authenticated user.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171018-ppe  Conditions: To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker must have local access and be authenticated to the targeted device with administrative or python execution privileges. These requirements could limit the possibility of a successful exploit.  Workaround: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  A mitigation for this vulnerability is to ensure administrators have restricted python sandbox access to only highly trusted users.  Further Problem Description: For information about vulnerable and not vulnerable software releases, and time frame for fixed software releases, please open a support case with your support organization. PSIRT does not provide or maintain this information for Medium SIR advisories.  Credit: Cisco would like to thank Network Engineer Cody Winkler for finding and reporting this vulnerability.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.2: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12301 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Wide Area Application Services ICA Accelerator Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Independent Computing Architecture (ICA) accelerator feature for the Cisco Wide Area Application Services (WAAS) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause an ICA application optimization-related process to restart, resulting in a partial denial of service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to improperly aborting a connection when an unexpected protocol packet is received. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted ICA traffic through the targeted device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause a DoS condition that is due to a process unexpectedly restarting. The Cisco WAAS could drop ICA traffic while the process is restarting.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171004-waas1  Conditions: Cisco Wide Area Application Services (WAAS) prior to release 6.2.3d are vulnerable.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12267 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco IOS Software DHCPv6 Denial Of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Summary A vulnerability in DHCP version 6 (DHCPv6) server implementation of Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote  attacker to cause a memory leak and eventually reload an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to improper parsing of malformed DHCPv6 packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malformed  DHCPv6 packets to be processed by an affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a memory leak and eventually reload an  affected device.   Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140924-dhcpv6 Note: The September 24, 2014, Cisco IOS Software Security Advisory bundled publication includes six Cisco Security Advisories. All advisories  address vulnerabilities in Cisco IOS Software. Individual publication links are in Cisco Event Response: Semiannual Cisco IOS Software Security  Advisory Bundled Publication at the following link: http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/intelligence/Cisco_ERP_sep14.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  7.8/6.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-3359 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: I have an ISR4400 router running XE3.12 throttle image.I have configured a DHCPv6 server on it.From a Linux server, I am sending fuzzed DHCPv6 packets through THC tool ver 2.5 (https://www.thc.org/thc-ipv6/)After about a few minutes, the router runs out of memory. I took a snapshot of GD tool and the leaks were shown at mfib_wrap_copy_to_host_stack functionAfter traffic is stopped and DHCPv6 bindings cleared manually, the router continues to throw malloc failed messages and memory doesn't recover. I let the router stay untouched for almost half a day and found that it had crashed due to lack of memory.Cisco IOS Software, ISR4400 Software (X86_64_LINUX_IOSD-UNIVERSALK9-M), Experimental Version 15.4(20140129:133644) [v154_2_s_xe312_throttle-BLD-BLD_V154_2_S_XE312_THROTTLE_LATEST_20140129_120050-ios 191]Copyright (c) 1986-2014 by Cisco Systems, Inc.Compiled Wed 29-Jan-14 08:57 by mcpre

Title: Apache Tomcat Vulnerabilities
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco Security Manager includes a version of Apache Tomcat that is affected by the vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) IDs:  CVE-2013-4286: Apache Tomcat before 6.0.39, 7.x before 7.0.47, and 8.x before 8.0.0-RC3, when an HTTP connector or AJP connector is used, does not properly handle certain inconsistent HTTP request headers, which allows remote attackers to trigger incorrect identification of a request's length and conduct request-smuggling attacks via (1) multiple Content-Length headers or (2) a Content-Length header and a ''Transfer-Encoding: chunked'' header. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2005-2090. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 5.8 (AV:N/AC:M/AU:N/C:P/I:P/A:N)  CVE-2013-4322: Apache Tomcat before 6.0.39, 7.x before 7.0.50, and 8.x before 8.0.0-RC10 processes chunked transfer coding without properly handling (1) a large total amount of chunked data or (2) whitespace characters in an HTTP header value within a trailer field, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service by streaming data. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-3544. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 4.3 (AV:N/AC:M/AU:N/C:N/I:N/A:P)  CVE-2013-4590: Apache Tomcat before 6.0.39, 7.x before 7.0.50, and 8.x before 8.0.0-RC10 allows attackers to obtain ''Tomcat internals'' information by leveraging the presence of an untrusted web application with a context.xml, web.xml, *.jspx, *.tagx, or *.tld XML document containing an external entity declaration in conjunction with an entity reference, related to an XML External Entity (XXE) issue. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 4.3 (AV:N/AC:M/AU:N/C:P/I:N/A:N)  CVE-2014-0033: org/apache/catalina/connector/CoyoteAdapter.java in Apache Tomcat 6.0.33 through 6.0.37 does not consider the disableURLRewriting setting when handling a session ID in a URL, which allows remote attackers to conduct session fixation attacks via a crafted URL. This has been classified by the vendor as having a CVSSv2 score of 4.3 (AV:N/AC:M/AU:N/C:P/I:N/A:N)  This bug was opened to address the potential impact on this product. Title: More snort cores in BSD stack
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the SSL detection engine handling when encrypting packets for Cisco Firepower System Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote  attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition due to the Snort process  unexpectedly restarting.  The vulnerability is due to improper error handling when encrypting a packet on an SSL connection. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted  SSL packet stream to the detection engine on the targeted device. An exploit could  allow the attacker to cause a DoS condition if the Snort process restarts and traffic  inspection is bypassed or traffic is dropped.  Conditions: There are snort rules configured.  Workaround: None  Further Problem Description: None  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Title: spin lock optimization in snp get idfw user
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptoms: A vulnerability in the ingress flow creation functionality of the Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the  CPU to increase upwards to 100% utilization causing a denial of service (DoS) condition.   The vulnerability is due to the incorrect handling of an internal software lock that could prevent other system processes from getting CPU cycles causing the high CPU  condition. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted, steady stream of TCP SYN packets or other IP packets which create connections on the  targeted device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a DoS condition where the device is at full CPU capacity and traffic can cease to be passed until the  attack traffic is ceased.  Conditions: The default configuration.  Workaround: The ASA configuration commands:  ''set connection per-client-embryonic-max '' ''set connection per-client-max ''  Can be used to limit the number of connection requests from a single IP address.  Further Problem Description: None.   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 8.6: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: When SYN attack is from the single source IP at 200kpps, CPU reaches 100% on a single unit ASA. CPU profile shows spin lock takes the majority of CPU cycles:Percentage of hits per function, with callers@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@...... 88.91% : spin_lock_get_actual_internal           27.54% : snp_host_reference           23.06% : snp_get_idfw_user           22.55% : snp_host_unreference           13.14% : snp_host_set_tcpmss            9.49% : snp_host_attach_flow            3.60% : snp_host_detach_flow            0.31% : mps_hash_lookup CPU. In this fix, we'd like to remove the host lock in snp_get_idfw_user to optimize the CPU performance. It should be safe to do so since the callers of this API already have a conn lock, and as long as the flow is not deleted and the host has at least this flow attached to it, the host would exist throughout the time of snp_get_idfw_get_user processing.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: psirt@cisco.com           This issue has been evaluated and driven to closure by PSIRT. Conditions: Device with default configuration.  Workaround: Not currently available. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/3.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:POC/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2011-4576 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: As written in my previous email, there's also another issue with the retransmit mechanism used in CTS and TS release < 3.0, where the same DTLS sequence number is used in retransmissions, which violates the DTLS spec.  We have to turn off replay protection in order to cope with this.  The next (3.0) TS build will have improved behaviour, as we're switching over to making OpenSSL responsible for retransmissions, which gives a more reliable (and less code on our part) method for doing so.-- Paul

Title: Commands Injection Vulnerability in multiple Cisco TelePresence Products
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web framework of multiple Cisco TelePresence products could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary commands that are executed with the privileges of the root user.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the device and submitting crafted input to the affected parameter in a web page. Administrative privileges are required in order to access the affected parameter. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute system commands with the privileges of the root user.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150513-tp   Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
