Title: Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in Cisco Unified MeetingPlace could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to insert malicious HTML and JavaScript through the ''custom strings'' functionality.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the affected software. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user to click a crafted URL that is designed to submit malicious code to the user's computer, steal login credentials, or preform application functionality on behalf of the user.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None. Title: Cisco ASA VNMC Input Validation Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software is affected by the following vulnerabilities:      Cisco ASA SQL*NET Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA VPN Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA IKEv2 Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA High Performance Monitor Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA GPRS Tunneling Protocol Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA SunRPC Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA DNS Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA VPN Failover Command Injection Vulnerability     Cisco ASA VNMC Command Input Validation Vulnerability     Cisco ASA Local Path Inclusion Vulnerability     Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Information Disclosure and Denial of Service Vulnerability     Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Portal Customization Integrity Vulnerability     Cisco ASA Smart Call Home Digital Certificate Validation Vulnerability  These vulnerabilities are independent of one another; a release that is affected by one of the vulnerabilities may not be affected by the others.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA SQL*NET Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA VPN Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA IKEv2 Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA High Performance Monitor Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA GPRS Tunneling Protocol Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability, Cisco ASA SunRPC Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability, and Cisco ASA DNS Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability may result in a reload of an affected device, leading to a denial of service (DoS) condition.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA VPN Failover Command Injection Vulnerability, Cisco ASA VNMC Command Input Validation Vulnerability, and Cisco ASA Local Path Inclusion Vulnerability may result in full compromise of the affected system.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Information Disclosure and Denial of Service Vulnerability may result in the disclosure of internal information or, in some cases, a reload of the affected system.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN Portal Customization Integrity Vulnerability may result in a compromise of the Clientless SSL VPN portal, which may lead to several types of attacks, which are not limited to cross-site scripting (XSS), stealing of credentials, or redirects of users to malicious web pages.  Successful exploitation of the Cisco ASA Smart Call Home Digital Certificate Validation Vulnerability may result in a digital certificate validation bypass, which could allow the attacker to bypass digital certificate authentication and gain access inside the network via remote access VPN or management access to the affected system via the Cisco Adaptive Security Device Management (ASDM).  Cisco has released free software updates that address these vulnerabilities. Workarounds that mitigate some of these vulnerabilities are available.  This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141008-asa  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS sscores as of the time of evaluation are 6.5/6.2: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:M/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-3390 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Note: the root cause of this bug is identical to CSCuq41510.  A separate defect has been opened because a different fix is required for ASA1000v.This vulnerability is quite serious as it allows a ;jailbreak; escape from the restricted CLI environment and into the underlying Linux OS.The vulnerability is found in the Cisco ASA 9.2 (on a 5505) and it seems it has been carried across from the Cisco 1000v code.The vulnerability stems from a parsing flaw and unfiltered user-input to a shell command.The vulnerability can be exploited as: ciscoasa(config)# vnmc policy-agentciscoasa(config-vnmc-policy-agent)#ciscoasa(config-vnmc-policy-agent)# registration host 1.1.1.1ciscoasa(config-vnmc-policy-agent)# shared-secret |/mnt/disk0/revsocat.sh (shared-secret &/mnt/disk0/revsocat.sh  will also work)Please contact Omar Santos (os@cisco.com) to obtain access to the script - revsocat.shWhere revsocat.sh and socat has been uploaded to disk0:  using standard ftp/scp etc...The result is access to the underlying Linux OS.. from here a malicious user could infect (ptrace) the running LINA process to insert hidden config etc..

Title: Multiple Vulnerabilities in Cisco Unified Communications Manager
RNE: Symptom: Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Unified Communications Manager could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS), cross-site request forgery (XSRF), and phishing attacks on the affected software. br / The vulnerabilities are due to improper input validation of certain parameters passed to the affected software. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by convincing a user to follow a malicious link. An exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected site or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None. PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.7: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:H/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-0749 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: AppScan Test-cases:Issue# 1: Cross-Site Scripting -----------------------------------------Difference: The following changes were applied to the original request:? Injected 'reportXMLFile'/>' into the value of parameter 'type'Reasoning: The test result seems to indicate a vulnerability because Appscan successfully embedded a script in the response, which will be executed when the page loads in the user's browser.? text/html ? alert(4798)Issue# 2: Link Injection (facilitates Cross-Site Request Forgery)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Difference: The following changes were applied to the original request:? Set the value of the parameter 'type' to '%22%27%3E%3CIMG+SRC%3D%22%2FWF_XSRF4795.html%22%3E'Reasoning: The test result seems to indicate a vulnerability because the test response contained a link to the file ;WF_XSRF.html;.? ? Issue# 3: Phishing Through Frames--------------------------------------------------Difference: The following changes were applied to the original request:? Set the value of the parameter 'type' to 'reportXMLFile%27%22%3E%3Ciframe+id%3D4794+src%3Dhttp%3A%2F%2Fdemo.testfire.net%2Fphishing.html%3E'Reasoning: The test result seems to indicate a vulnerability because the test response contained a frame/iframe to URL ;http://demo.testfire.net/phishing.html;.? text/html ?

Title: Cisco IP Phone 8800 Series SIP Denial of Service Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in SIP call handling of the Cisco IP Phone 8800 Series devices could allow an unauthenticated,  remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition due to the SIP process unexpectedly restarting.  All active phone calls are dropped as the SIP process restarts..  The vulnerability is due to incomplete input validation of the SIP packet header. An attacker could exploit this  vulnerability by sending a malformed SIP packet to the targeted phone. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause DoS condition when all phone calls are dropped due to the SIP process unexpectedly restarting.  Conditions: The default configuration of the device.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6656 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Autonomic Networking Infrastructure Registrar Device Reload
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Autonomic Networking Infrastructure (ANI) registrar feature of Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.    The vulnerability is due to incomplete input validation on certain crafted packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability sending a crafted autonomic network channel discovery packet to a device that has all the following characteristics:  Running a Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software release that supports the ANI feature  Configured as an autonomic registrar  Has a whitelist configured    An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the affected device to reload.    Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.    This advisory is available at the following link:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170320-ani    Note: Also see the companion advisory for affected devices that support Autonomic Networking: Cisco IOS Software IPv6 Denial of Service Vulnerability at the following link https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170320-aniipv6  Conditions: This vulnerability affects Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software devices with all the following characteristics:    Running a release of Cisco IOS Software or Cisco IOS XE Software that supports the ANI feature  Configured as an autonomic registrar  Has a configured whitelist    Please see the Cisco IOS XE Software Checker:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/selectIOSVersion.x  Workaround: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability. Autonomic networking should be configured with a whitelist. Do not remove the whitelist as a workaround.  Further Problem Description: Cisco has confirmed that this vulnerability does not affect Cisco IOS XR Software, or Cisco NX-OS Software.    PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.4:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X    CVE ID CVE-2017-3849 has been assigned to document this issue.    Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Issue reported from external security researcher.Autonomic Networking Registrar is the device responsible for admitting anynew nodes based on a list of the allowed devices called ;whitelist;. Sendingspecifically crafted AN packets will cause the device to reload.See Big-Description for full details.

Title: ASA changes user privilege by vpn tunnel configuration
RNE: SYMPTOM:  An authenticated, unprivileged user that can enter global configuration mode and that can execute the ''vpnclient''command, can elevate his/her privilege level to 15 by executing the ''vpnclient'' command.  CONDITIONS:  The privilege of the ''configure terminal'' and the ''vpnclient'' commands has been changed from their default privilege levels so a non-privilege 15 user can execute them  The ''vpnclient'' command only applies to the Cisco ASA 5505:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa82/command/reference/uz.html#wp1632005  WORKAROUNDS:  Use AAA command authorization  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 6.8/6.5:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2013-1215 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: 2013/03/29 - dasilver - I lowered the severity to 3 because:1) Must be an authenticate user.2) User must already have access rights to config mode.3) Command authorization could be used to prevent this.User privilege switched to 15 when changing the method of establishing the tunnel from pre-shared-key to cert or viseversa.ciscoasa(config)# show curprivUsername : enable_5Current privilege level : 5Current Mode/s : P_PRIV P_CONFciscoasa(config)# vpnclient trustpoint CERT chainciscoasa(config)# show curprivUsername : enable_5Current privilege level : 15Current Mode/s : P_PRIV P_CONFciscoasa(config)#ASA 5505 hardware vpnclient, issue reproduced on 8.2.5 9.1.1.4and as per Cu he tested 8.4.5, 9.1.1 and 9.0.2

Title: Cisco IP Phone 7821 Denial of Service (Dos) Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the ingress IP broadcast ''protect mode'' feature of the Cisco IP Phone 7821  could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition because Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) packets could be dropped.  The vulnerability is due to the design of the ''protect mode'' feature to drop ingress broadcast traffic  when the phone detects a high input broadcast traffic rate. The Cisco IP Phone 7821 will drop ingress  broadcast traffic and this could also include ARP traffic. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting a high rate of IP broadcast traffic onto the adjacent network of the phone. An exploit could allow  the attacker to cause a DoS attack where phone calls would not complete, the call could have one way  audio or the call could drop.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 3.3/3.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 No CVE ID has been assigned to this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: A customer had an issue with CP-7821 phones having one-way audio after the phone fails to respond to an ARP request.  TAC diagnosed this and was able to reproduce the issue using NBNS broadcasts at a rate of ~210 pps.Please reference https://cibu-jira:8443/browse/IPPHONES-2190the issue only happen on V02

Title: Security issues with Uncontrolled Resource Consumption via Slow HTTP affecting VCS Expressway
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptom: While using slowhttptest (a linux command line tool) to test VCS Expressway it can be seen that DoS is happening where in the HTTPS connection to VCS is lost and we are unable to access the web GUI. Slow HTTP test changes the status of Service available from Yes to No.  Conditions: VCS x8.9.2  Automatic detection rules enabled on VCS Expressway  Workaround: None  Further Problem Description: Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Run slowhttptest -H -u  https://vcs-e hostname -r 64 -c 512 2. Run hping3 -i u1 -S -p 443 vcs-e IP Address 3. Observe service available changes from YES to NO.  HTTPS connection to VCS expressway webGUI is lost when slow HTTP test reports service unable "NO".  Automatic detection rules were unable to block this from happening. Need a way to block this connection on VCS.
Description: While using slowhttptest (a linux command line tool) to test VCS Expressway it can be seen that DoS is happening where in the HTTPS connection to VCS is lost and we are unable to access the web GUI. Slow HTTP test changes the status of Service available from Yes to No.Steps to reproduce the issue1. Run slowhttptest -H -u  https://<vcs-e hostname> -r 64 -c 5122. Run hping3 -i u1 -S -p 443 <vcs-e IP Address>3. Observe service available changes from YES to NO.Automatic detection rules for HTTP Proxy authentication failure, HTTP proxy protocol violation, HTTP resources access failure, Web interface authorization failure, web interface protocol violation, and external API authorization failure were enabled but were unable to block this connection. Need a way block this incoming connection on VCS-E.

Title: ASR 5000 SAE-GW high CPU utilization vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: Abnormally high CPU usage occurs on the device. The following error may be seen:  nonFatal error occurred in SnmpPoller. java.lang.RuntimeException: Poll - Error polling mib var params  Conditions: When SNMP logging is enabled, the snmp task can increase its CPU usage when processing the logging of malformed SNMP packets.  Workaround: No workaround has been identified.  Further Problem Description: A vulnerability in the SNMP code of Cisco ASR 5500 System Architecture Evolution (SAE) Gateway could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause high CPU utilization and the SNMP process may stop responding.   The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of malformed SNMP packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malformed SNMP packets to the affected system.By default the debugging is enabled for all the sub-systems/components in net-snmpd and this causes cpu to spike up. The fix in this CDET gives flexibility to the user to enable disable sub-systems/components selectively.  PSIRT Evaluation:  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.8: https://intellishield.cisco.com/security/alertmanager/cvssCalculator.do?dispatch=1&version=2&vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:U/RC:C CVE ID CVE-2015-0617 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0617   Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: This issue was seen in AT&T CLAB test setup while doing SNMP related negative/security testing using Codenomicon test tool. Codenomincon is a Protocol Robustness Test tool which sends malformed protocol messages to the target device. When Codenomicon SNMP test suite (d3-snmpv2c) version 4.1.1 was run against ASR 5500 SAE-GW StarOS version 17.0, SNMP task cpu usage became ;over; (>90%) and stayed in this state throughout the test. During this time, normal polling from another (legitimate) NMS running Net-SNMP failed (because of timeout). Polling from Prime server failed during this period too. After Normal Polling initiated in Prime PPM, Status became Polling to Unknown and SnmpReqTimeoutException alarm was thrown.After the test is stopped, and waiting for a while for the SNMP task cpu to come down, normal polling from PPM and Net-SNMP server worked fine. The impact seems limited to SNMP failure only. No other issues (crash etc) or no failure of bulkstat reporting was noticed during this test. Attachments: - SNMP task resouce and other logs - SSD - task core for snmp - monitor protocol output for SNMP - Codenomicon test suite summaryASR 5500 SAE-GW StarOS version: 17.0.M0.57082Prime PPM error:Device RTPCLABZ17SAEGW1 - nonFatal error occurred in SnmpPoller. java.lang.RuntimeException: Poll - Error polling mib var params:[;ifIndex,ifDescr,ifType,ifAdminStatus,ifOperStatus,ifOutOctets,ifOutUcastPkts,ifOutErrors,ifOutDiscards,ifInOctets,ifInUcastPkts,ifInErrors,ifInDiscards,ifSpeed,ifLastChange;, ;IfInfo.ifTable;] node:172.18.19.203 : SnmpReqTimeoutExceptionNet-SNMP error:$ /usr/bin/snmpwalk -v 2c -c primerw 172.18.19.203 ifMIBIF-MIB::ifName.83951616 = STRING:  5/1. . .IF-MIB::ifName.84606976 = STRING:  5/11Timeout: No Response from 172.18.19.203

Title: Netstack/TCP - crashed due to double free TCB upon receiving a SYN
RNE: Symptoms:  A vulnerability in the TCP stack of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.  The vulnerability is due to improper processing of certain TCP packets in the closing sequence of a TCP session while the affected device is in a TIME_WAIT state.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specific TCP packet to an affected device on a TCP session that is already in a TIME_WAIT state. An exploit  could allow the attacker to cause a reload of the TCP stack on the affected device, resulting in a DoS condition.  This vulnerability can be exploited using either IPv4 or IPv6 packets. The vulnerability can be triggered by a crafted sequence of TCP packets destined for TCP ports  listening on the device. The packets may use the IPv4 or IPv6 unicast address of any interface configured on the device.  This vulnerability can be triggered only by traffic destined to an affected device and cannot be exploited using traffic that transits an affected device.  Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160302-netstack  Conditions:  Device configured with any service that may use TCP socket, eg: BGP, telnet, http, ssh, etc...  Workaround:  None.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.8/6.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2015-0718 has been  assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco HCM-F SOAP API Sensitive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) Application Programming Interface (API)  of the Cisco Hosted Collaboration Mediation Fulfillment application could allow an authenticated, remote  attacker to obtain sensitive information that should be restricted. The attacker must authenticate as the  ''admin'' user.  The vulnerability is due to lack of Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) within the application. An attacker  could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating as the ''admin'' user and using the SOAP API to request restricted and sensitive information. An exploit could allow the attacker to obtain a list of customer  credentials and other sensitive information.  Conditions: The application running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4/3.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-6404 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: HCM-F: Customer App Credentials Rendered Cleartext in API ResponsesCredentials for customer apps are rendered clear text in WebServices API responses:(1) Invoke getListOfApplicationInstances(2) For internal SDR ID's returned, invoke getListOfCredentialsFromApplicationInstance(3) Passwords returned clear text in field password_CommunityString(4) Can get all credentials via getListOfCredentialsNotes:HCM-F admin credentials are required to connect via API. Since RBAC not employed, credentials for all customers is exposed.

Title: Filter Bypass Extensions Work when Decrypt for EUN Enabled
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco.  Do not forward this information to mailing lists or newsgroups.  Documentation writers: it is prohibited to publish this Release-note  Enclosure (RNE) until the content has been approved by PSIRT.  PSIRT may  publish a Security Advisory regarding this defect, and the current text of  this RNE will be replaced with appropriate information.  In the event that  a Security Advisory is not published, PSIRT will replace this text with an  appropriate explanation.  More information on PSIRT is available at http//psirt.cisco.com/.   Cisco's public policy on security vulnerability handling can be reviewed at  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html. For further information, send a message to psirt@cisco.com.  (tfinn-12/13/17)$$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptom: It may be possible to use filter avoidance technologies to bypass HTTPS policies if  ;Decrypt for  EUN ; is enabled  Conditions:  ;Decrypt for End-User Notification ; is enabled in the HTTPS Proxy  Workaround: Disable  ;Decrypt for EUN ;  Further Problem Description:
Description: When using browser extensions ;UltraSurf; and ;Browsec,; and ;Decrypt for EUN; is enabled, the technologies are successful in bypassing policies.  These extensions set up a TLS connection to internet servers everideasserver.info (UltraSurf) and postls.com (Browsec).  They then send CONNECT or TUNNEL requests over the tunnel which requests the desired site.  Both of these sites are categorized as ;Filter Avoidance.;  If this category is set to ;Drop; in the decryption policy, and ;Decrypt for EUN; is enabled, the sites will be correctly categorized, and decrypted.  If the desired web site is HTTPS, the subsequent TUNNEL request is allowed.  This is true even if the site in the ;inner; tunnel is blocked by policy.  HTTP sites are correctly blocked.This is similar to CSCvb49012, however, that bug is fixed in 10.5 and this behavior is still present in that version.
PSIRT: PSIRT-owner: srasovic           PSIRT is reviewing this issue for possible inclusion in a Cisco Security  Advisory which could include this DDTs.  Please do not change the  Release-note Enclosure, as PSIRT will modify it appropriately when this  issue is made public.          Should customers request information regarding this DDTs or appear to be running into this DDTs within their network, please bring it to the immediate attention of the Cisco PSIRT at psirt@cisco.com.

Description: PLEASE NOTE: Even if the original issue was found on Ubuntu, Debian, RedHat, CentOS and others are also affected.Defect opened to address the potential impact to Cisco ACS by CVE-2017-9445DescriptionIn systemd through 233, certain sizes passed to dns_packet_new in systemd-resolved can cause it to allocate a buffer that's too small. Title: Key Reinstallation attacks against WPA protocol
RNE: Symptom: The product  Cisco WAP371 Wireless-AC N Access Point with Single Point Setup  implements a WPA supplicant and as such is affected by the WPA protocol vulnerabilities identified by the following Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) ID:  CVE-2017-13077: reinstallation of the pairwise key in the 4-way handshake CVE-2017-13078: reinstallation of the group key in the 4-way handshake CVE-2017-13079: reinstallation of the integrity group key in the 4-way handshake CVE-2017-13080: reinstallation of the group key in the group key handshake CVE-2017-13081: reinstallation of the integrity group key in the group key handshake CVE-2017-13082: accepting a retransmitted Fast BSS Transition Reassociation Request and reinstalling the pairwise key while processing it CVE-2017-13086: reinstallation of the Tunneled Direct-Link Setup (TDLS) PeerKey (TPK) key in the TDLS handshake CVE-2017-13087: reinstallation of the group key (GTK) when processing a Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frame CVE-2017-13088: reinstallation of the integrity group key (IGTK) when processing a Wireless Network Management (WNM) Sleep Mode Response frame  As disclosed in https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171016-wpa  Conditions: Exposure is not configuration dependent.  Workaround: Not available.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 4.3:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: New vulnerabilities have been identified on the WPA protocol (WPA1 and WPA2) that allow for key re-installation. Two of those vulnerabilities affect wireless devices acting as supplicant, while the remaining one affects wireless devices acting as authenticator.These vulnerabilities allow (depending on specific device configuration) for packet replaying, packet decryption, and *may allow* for packet forging/packet injection.As these are *protocol* level vulnerabilities (instead of being implementation vulnerabilities), there is a high likelihood that any wireless product implementing WPA1 or WPA2, as either supplicant or authenticator, will be affected. We have confirmed that any product using the Open Source packages ?hostapd? or ?wpa_supplicant? *will be affected by these vulnerabilities*.The Cisco PSIRT has a draft paper with details on the vulnerabilities, and tools that can be used to help reproduce the vulnerabilities on devices working as supplicant or authenticator. Due to the sensitive nature of this information, they're NOT attached to the bug but will be provided on an as-needed basis to developers involved on analyzing and fixing this vulnerability on any affected product.Please contact dciccaro@cisco.com and fcasotto@cisco.com to get access to the paper and the tools. We can also provide a patch for products using the packages ?hostapd? or ?wpa_supplicant?. Please include PSIRT-1457134228 on the subject line of any emails about this issue.Products that1) have NOT YET reached End of Software Maintenance (EOSWM):  product has to be evaluated and a fix developed2) have reached EOSWM, but NOT YET End of Support: product has to be evaluated, but no fix needs to be developed3) have reached End of Support: no evaluation nor fix neededThis bug has been opened for the following products:WAP371 Wireless-AC/N Dual Radio Access Point

Title: Many HTTP GET for webvpn login page cause high CPU in UnicornProxyThread
RNE: Symptom: spikes of CPU in Unicorn Proxy Thread as shown by ''show proc cpu-usage sorted non- zero''  Conditions: - Webvpn portal is enabled - Unauthenticated outside host sending continuous HTTPS GET requests for the login page of the  portal (~50 GET/sec would create a ~40% CPU usage)  Workaround: Block the attacker manually. This can be done using a control-plane access-group on the ASA.  The following Applied Mitigation Bulletin (AMB) provides identification and mitigation techniques that administrators can deploy on Cisco network devices.  http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-amb-20100804-asa.shtml  Cisco IOS NetFlow records can provide visibility into network-based exploitation attempts.  Cisco IOS Software, Cisco ASA, and FWSM firewalls can provide visibility through syslog messages and counter values displayed in the output from show commands.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.5.  https://intellishield.cisco.com/security/alertmanager/cvss?target=new&version=2.0&vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:F/RL:W/RC:C  Further Problem Description:
Description: A client sending HTTPS GET requests for the portal login page continuously causes the CPU to spike in Unicorn Proxy Thread.On an otherwise idle 5550 in the lab we see the following results by firing a loop of wget for the login page of the ASA (so SSL handshake + GET of the root URL redirecting to login + GET of the login page)58 conn/sec => 50% CPU (45% in Unicorn)100 conn/sec => 71% CPU (65% in Unicorn)140 conn/sec => 86% CPU (78% in Unicorn)In customer's environment, we have a misconfigured (or virus-infected) mail client (user agent ;Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.12) Gecko/20101027 Thunderbird/3.1.6;) firing pipelined GET requests for the root URL then the login page. The rate there is 10-30 pipelined GET in each connection and 1-3 connection/sec, the connections and requests are not simultaneous, they follow one-another and result in 50-100 GET/sec on a production ASA 5550 where the CPU normally sits at 30%. This creates spikes going up to 97% and other services are affected (other users see portal page timeouts). The combined throughput in and out is in the ~5Mbps range for 50-100GET/sec.By fine-tuning the attack it seems this could be an effective DoS.logs and show tech of cu's ASA http://www-tac.cisco.com/Teams/ks/c3/getLargeFile.php?srId=616066791&fileName=20101124-104914_TAC_VPN_LOG&forceText=1log of troubleshooting session including cpu profile dumpshttp://www-tac.cisco.com/Teams/ks/c3/getLargeFile.php?srId=616066791&fileName=20101124-061427_bca-sslvpn-full-session-log.txt&forceText=1Performance issues associated with Clientless VPN login page generation have been split out into a separate bug --> CSCtk84069

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance Stored Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web-based management interface of an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of the interface to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the interface or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170719-wsa3  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software.  Workaround: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  Credit: This vulnerability was found and reported to Cisco by Daniel Jensen from Security-Assessment.com.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6749 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Unified Intelligence Center Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web interface of Cisco Unified Intelligence Center could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to perform a Document Object Model (DOM)-based cross-site scripting attack.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of some parameters passed to the web server. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing the user to access a malicious link or by intercepting the user request and injecting the malicious code. An exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the affected site or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based information.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170920-cuic2  Conditions: Exposure is not configuration dependent.  Workaround: Not applicable or available.  Further Problem Description Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigations can be found at: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12254 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12254 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Cross-site scripting (reflected DOM-based) There are 4 instances of this issue:/cuicui/j_identity_check [username parameter]/cuicui/j_identity_check [username parameter]/cuicui/j_identity_check [username parameter]/cuicui/j_identity_check [username parameter]Issue backgroundReflected DOM-based vulnerabilities arise when data is copied from a request and echoed into the application's immediate response within a part of the DOM that is then processed in an unsafe way by a client-side script. An attacker can leverage the reflection to control a part of the response (for example, a JavaScript string) that can be used to trigger the DOM-based vulnerability.DOM-based cross-site scripting arises when a script writes controllable data into the HTML document in an unsafe way. An attacker may be able to use the vulnerability to construct a URL that, if visited by another application user, will cause JavaScript code supplied by the attacker to execute within the user's browser in the context of that user's session with the application.The attacker-supplied code can perform a wide variety of actions, such as stealing the victim's session token or login credentials, performing arbitrary actions on the victim's behalf, and logging their keystrokes.Users can be induced to visit the attacker's crafted URL in various ways, similar to the usual attack delivery vectors for reflected cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.See Big Description.txt attachment for additional details.

Title: CVE-2002-0510 - ACE Linux vulnerable to UDP non-zero IP ID
RNE: Symptom: ACE is vulnerable to CVE-2002-0510. Linux 2.4.x kernels keeps the IP Identification field at 0 for all  non-fragmented UDP packets   Conditions: This can occur when connection-less udp sockets are used   Workaround: NONE
Description: ACE is vulnerable to CVE-2002-0510.The UDP implementation in Linux 2.4.x kernels keeps the IP Identification field at 0 for all non-fragmented packets, which could allow remote attackers to determine that a target system is running Linux.

Title: CVE-2015-0239 Vulnerability - Ironport Encryption Appliance (IEA)
RNE: Symptom: This bug has been opened to evaluate and address the potential impact of the CVE-2015-0239 vulnerability on these versions of the product:       ESA AsyncOS 9.0.x      ESA AsyncOS 8.5.x      ESA AsyncOS 8.0.x      ESA AsyncOS 7.6.3  Overview: ''The em_sysenter function in arch/x86/kvm/emulate.c in the Linux kernel before 3.18.5, when the guest OS lacks SYSENTER MSR initialization,  allows guest OS users to gain guest OS privileges or cause a denial of service (guest OS crash) by triggering use of a 16-bit code segment for  emulation of a SYSENTER instruction.'' Title: Commands Injection Vulnerability in multiple Cisco TelePresence Products
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the web framework of multiple Cisco TelePresence products could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary commands that are executed with the privileges of the root user.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the device and submitting crafted input to the affected parameter in a web page. Administrative privileges are required in order to access the affected parameter. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute system commands with the privileges of the root user.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150513-tp   Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS sscores as of the time of evaluation are 9.0/7.4: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2015-0713 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: CallManager Service crashes when receives badly encoded H323 message
RNE: Symptoms: Cisco Unified Call Manager (CUCM) may restart when a malformed H.323 Response message is received from a configured H.323 gateway.  A remote,  unauthenticated attacker who can compromise or control the response of a H.323 gateway configured on Call Manager could respond to ISDN call  setup requests with a malformed response.  When parsed, this response could cause CUCM to Restart.  Conditions: Devices running an affected version of Cisco Unified Call Manager and configured to utilize a H.323 gateway.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: This issue was discovered during an investigation of a customer case.  It was found that a 3rd Party H.323 gateway was responding with an invalid  H.323 response when passed a Dial String of 21 digits or greater.  The response which violated the ISDN protocol when parsed resulted in the crash.   While this issue has only been seen in very specific circumstances, an attacker that was able to compromise a configured H.323 gateway could  leverage the issue to create a denial of service condition on Cisco Unified Call Manager.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are  5.4/4.5: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2012-5438 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: An outgoing call is placed and a SETUP message is sent by CCM to a 3rd party H323 GW. CCM receives a H323 response with complete violation of ISDN standard (see attachment ;Incoming Badly Encoded Message;) and immediately after CallManager service crashes.First IsdnMsgData is showing the size of call ref as 90 Bytes (0x5A) (;IsdnMsgData1= 08 5A;), which is really unusual (it is usually 1 byte or 2 bytes). Besides CCM considers this as a H225Setup message, since it finds an octect as 05 (;IsdnMsgData1= 08 5A 08 02 80 9F 28 01 00 7E 00 22 05;), which corresponds to SETUP Message Type as per ISDN standard. However as per call flow, it should be a Proceed Message. CallManager Service crashes while CCM tries to treat it as SETUP message.The 3rd party H323 GW is only sending this incorrect format message when called number has 21 digits.

Title: RM3000 802.11ac Module sending malformed open system auth response
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  CISCO HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL - CONTROLLED ACCESS  This issue is under review by the Cisco Product Security Incident Response team (PSIRT).  The defect describes a product security vulnerability.  Its contents must be protected from unauthorized disclosure, both internal and external to Cisco.  Do not forward this information to mailing lists or newsgroups.  Documentation writers: it is prohibited to publish this Release-note  Enclosure (RNE) until the content has been approved by PSIRT.  PSIRT may  publish a Security Advisory regarding this defect, and the current text of  this RNE will be replaced with appropriate information.  In the event that  a Security Advisory is not published, PSIRT will replace this text with an  appropriate explanation.  More information on PSIRT is available at http//psirt.cisco.com/.   Cisco's public policy on security vulnerability handling can be reviewed at  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html. For further information, send a message to psirt@cisco.com.  (jklimarc-05/06/15)Symptom: Clients not able to connect to 3602 AP with Xale 802.11ac Module.  Wireless sniffs show that the client(Intel) probes and gets a response, but during the Open System Auth phase the AP responds with a malformed authentication.  Client does not move forward with the Association packet because of this.  Conditions: 7.6.130.0 3602 AP with 802.11ac Module(AIR-RM3000AC) installed  Workaround: none  Further Problem Description: Seems to only be reproducible in the customer production environment currently.  Was not able to reproduce this in lab.
Description: Clients not able to connect to 3602 AP with Xale 802.11ac Module.  Wireless sniffs show that the client(Intel) probes and gets a response, but during the Open System Auth phase the AP responds with a malformed authentication.  Client does not move forward with the Association packet because of this.

Title: 8510 Data Plane crash with Incomplete Crash file
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptoms: A vulnerability in certain Data-Plane (DP) input and validation-checking mechanisms of the Cisco 8500 series Wireless LAN controller (WLC) could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause a complete denial-of-service (DoS) condition on an affected device.   The vulnerability is due to the WLC improperly handling certain Ethernet traffic types. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted Ethernet packets to an affected WLC. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause the device to reload, resulting in a complete DoS condition.  Conditions: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Workaround: Please refer to the Security Advisory.  Further Problem Description: Link to Security Advisory:   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 7.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The WLC 8500 has crashed several times during the last few months. It crashes and takes about 30 minutes to come back up. The crash was a data plane crash according to the analysis of failure in the crash file, but the DP crash file unfortunately does not look complete. Because the crash file was incomplete, we pulled the DP-coredump from the controller to have someone for the business unit to analyze this file. Title: Cisco IOS XE is vulnerable to CVE-2014-0160 - aka Heartbleed
RNE: Symptom: Cisco IOS XE includes a version of OpenSSL that is affected by the vulnerability identified by the Common Vulnerability and Exposures (CVE) ID CVE-2014-0160.  This bug has been opened to address the potential impact on this product.  Conditions: Cisco IOS XE devices running release 3.11.0S, 3.11.1S or 3.12.0S and with the WebUI interface over HTTPs enabled.  No other versions of Cisco IOS XE are affected.  Devices with the WebUI interface enabled and using HTTPs as transport protocol will include the following configuration:  transport-map type persistent webui http-webui  secure-server ip http secure-server transport type persistent webui input http-webui  Devices running IOS XE release 3.11.0S, 3.11.1S or 3.12.0S but WITHOUT the WebUI interface enabled, or with the WebUI interface enabled but NOT using HTTPs as transport protocol are NOT AFFECTED by this vulnerability.  Devices running IOS XE release 3.11.0S, 3.11.1S or 3.12.0S and with the HTTPs server enabled (by including in their configuration the line "ip http secure-server") are NOT affected. Both the HTTPs server and the WebUI interface need to be enabled for a device to be vulnerable.  The WebUI configuration guide is available at  http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/asr1000/configuration/guide/chassis/asrswcfg/webui.html  Workaround: Not currently available.  Further Problem Description: Additional details about this vulnerability can be found at http://cve.mitre.org/cve/cve.html  Software version and Fixes  The first column is the Cisco IOS XE Software Release The second column is the First Fixed Release.  2.x.x  Not Vulnerable 3.1.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.1.xSG  Not Vulnerable 3.2.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.2xSE  Not Vulnerable 3.2.xSG  Not Vulnerable 3.2.xXO  Not Vulnerable 3.2.xSQ  Not Vulnerable 3.3.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.3.xSE  Not Vulnerable 3.3xSG  Not Vulnerable 3.3xXO  Not Vulnerable 3.3xSQ  Not Vulnerable 3.4.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.4.xSG  Not Vulnerable 3.5.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.5.xE  Not Vulnerable 3.6.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.6.xE  Not Vulnerable 3.7.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.8.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.9.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.10.xS  Not Vulnerable 3.11.xS  Vulnerable 3.12.xS  Vulnerable 3.12.0aS  Not Vulnerable  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/4.3:  https://intellishield.cisco.com/security/alertmanager/cvss?target=new&version=2.0&vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:H/RL:U/RC:C  The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this score based on information obtained from multiple sources. Title: Cisco ASA WebVPN Information Disclosure Vulnerability
RNE: Symptoms: A vulnerability in the WebVPN Portal of the Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to view sensitive information from the affected system.  The vulnerability is due to improper input validation in the WebVPN portal. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by providing a specially crafted javascript file to an authenticated WebVPN user.  Conditions: ASA configured with WebVPN support.  Workaround: Upgrade the ASA appliance to the latest software version.  Further Problem Description: None. PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4/3.8: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2014-2151 has been assigned to document this issue. http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2151 Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: AnyConnect renders UI dialog from arbitrary host.
RNE: Symptom: Cisco AnyConnect for MacOS X renders a credentials form when connecting to arbitrary web servers.  A remote attacker could exploit this by convincing a user to connect with AnyConnect to a specific web server.  Conditions: Enter arbitrary web server address or FQDN in the AnyConnect UI's host field.  Workaround: Administrators can enable Always On in the AnyConnect profile. This allows the user to select one of the gateways listed in the profile but not enter an arbitrary hostname.  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4.3/3.9: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N/E:POC/RL:U/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2014-3314 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional details about the vulnerability described here can be found at:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3314  Further information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: CUCM: Do Not Echo Malicious Characters in Banner Acknowledgement Form
RNE: Symptom: A cross-site scripting (XSS) filter bypass vulnerability in the web management interface of Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to mount XSS attacks against a user of an affected device.   The vulnerability is due to a failure to properly call XSS filter subsystems when a URL contains a certain parameter. An attacker that can convince an authenticated user of an affected device to follow an attacker-provided link or visit an attacker-controlled website could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the affected site on the user's browser.  Conditions: Device configured with default configuration.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attack and potential mitigations can be found at: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/cmb/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss.html   PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-3798 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Malicious characters input into URL are echoed in the useracknowledgement form.  These should be filtered out.  Following are steps to reproduce:(1) Provision click through banner on server(2) Enable SSO(3) Input malicious string into URL, example: http://ip-address/ccmadmin/?bz3en'><script>alert(1)</script>ysm2w=1(4) View page source where  banner is displayed (via Debugger->Sources in developer tools on Mozilla).  Here you can see the same string input into the URL in the useracknowledgement form.  Example:<form id='useracknowledgement' name='useracknowledgement' method=;post; action='/ssosp/saml/login?relayurl=/ccmadmin/?bz3en'><script>alert(1)</script>ysm2w=1'></form>(5) Input validation should be expanded to prevent echoing malicious characters.Additional information:* This occurs on all web paths: /ccmadmin, /ccmservice, /cucreports, /ucmuser* Background can be found in Jira: https://cibu-jira.cisco.com:8443/browse/SELFCARE-203

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SQL Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in Cisco Unified Communications Manager could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a blind SQL injection attack.  The vulnerability is due to a failure to validate user-supplied input used in SQL queries that bypass protection filters. An attacker could exploit this  vulnerability by sending crafted URLs that include SQL statements. An exploit could allow the attacker to modify or delete entries in some database  tables, affecting the integrity of the data.  There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170802-ucm  Conditions: This vulnerability was introduced in CuCM version 006.000.000 and later.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: Made public via https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170802-ucm  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.4: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-6757 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco ASR 5500 System Architecture Evolution Gateway GPRS Tunneling Protocol DOS Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the General Packet Radio Service (GPRS) Tunneling Protocol (GTP)  ingress packet handler in the Cisco ASR 5500 System Architecture Evolution (SAE)  Gateway could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a partial denial  of service (DoS) condition due to the GTPUMGR process unexpectedly restarting.  The vulnerability is due to lack of proper input validation of the GTP packet header.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a malformed GTP packet to the  affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a partial DoS condition  due to the GTPUMGR process restarting. If the GTPUMGR process restarts there could be a  short impact to traffic passing through the device.  Conditions: The device is vulnerable on all software versions prior to the first fixed release if the GTP protocol is configured.  Workaround: None.  Further Problem Description: None.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 5.8: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:N/I:N/A:L/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2017-12217 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: Sessmgr restart observed after receiving 'Malformed Packets' and 'Bad length value'Due to issues on either eNB or the transport, we can see that eNB is sending 'Malformed Packets' and 'Bad length value 6 < 8'.  Due to this, SAE-GW is responding with 'GTP Error Indication'.  When this happens, SAE-GW is showing these kind of behaviors:1. gtpumgr crashes across all 8 SAE-GWs: Fatal Signal 11: Segmentation fault  PC: [f7e42756/X] libc.so.6/__memcpy_ssse3_rep()  Faulty address: 0xfffff000  Signal from: kernel  Signal detail: address not mapped to object  Process: card=5 cpu=0 arch=X pid=14113 cpu=~18% argv0=gtpumgr  Crash time: 2017-Apr-12+08:49:55 UTC  Recent errno: 11 Resource temporarily unavailable  Stack (55176@0xffff0000):    [f7e42756/X] libc.so.6/__memcpy_ssse3_rep() sp=0xffff0fe8    [0810d33e/X] gtpumgr_udp_read_callback() sp=0xffff10f8    [0810dcec/X] gtpumgr_med_msg_read() sp=0xffffd1f8    [0b6a0474/X] sn_epoll_run_events() sp=0xffffd248    [0b6ad588/X] sn_loop_run() sp=0xffffd708    [0b37e75d/X] main() sp=0xffffd7782. Generated syslogs:2017-Apr-13+14:15:19.875 [gtpc 47506 error] [5/0/26173 <gtpumgr:2> gtpumgr_io.c:108] [context: saegw-gtp, contextID: 2]  [software external user syslog] Badly formed GTP message , reason header too short from SGSN 11.245.114.173:2152 to GGSN 10.242.130.197:2152 <ver:-> <imsi:-> <apn:->Packet Hex Dump:----------------0000  30  2017-Apr-13+14:15:17.199 [gtpc 47506 error] [5/0/26173 <gtpumgr:2> gtpumgr_io.c:108] [context: saegw-gtp, contextID: 2]  [software external user syslog] Badly formed GTP message , reason header too short from SGSN 11.245.114.173:2152 to GGSN 10.242.130.197:2152 <ver:-> <imsi:-> <apn:->Packet Hex Dump:----------------0000  30 FF 00 FE 80 343. KPIs are dropping on all aspect.

Title: ASA Remote Access VPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
RNE: Summary  Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software is affected by the following vulnerabilities:      IPsec VPN Crafted ICMP Packet Denial of Service Vulnerability     SQL*Net Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability     Digital Certificate Authentication Bypass Vulnerability     Remote Access VPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability     Digital Certificate HTTP Authentication Bypass Vulnerability     HTTP Deep Packet Inspection Denial of Service Vulnerability     DNS Inspection Denial of Service Vulnerability     AnyConnect SSL VPN Memory Exhaustion Denial of Service Vulnerability     Clientless SSL VPN Denial of Service Vulnerability   These vulnerabilities are independent of one other; a release that is affected by one of the vulnerabilities may not be affected by the others.  Successful exploitation of the IPsec VPN Crafted ICMP Packet Denial of Service Vulnerability, SQL*Net Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability, HTTP Deep Packet Inspection Denial of Service Vulnerability, DNS Inspection Denial of Service Vulnerability and Clientless SSL VPN Denial of Service Vulnerability may result in a reload of an affected device, leading to a denial of service (DoS) condition.  Successful exploitation of the Digital Certificate Authentication Bypass Vulnerability, Remote Access VPN Authentication Bypass Vulnerability, and Digital Certificate HTTP Authentication Bypass Vulnerability may result in an authentication bypass, which could allow the attacker access to the inside network via remote access VPN or management access to the affected system via the Cisco Adaptive Security Device Management (ASDM).  Successful exploitation of the AnyConnect SSL VPN Memory Exhaustion Denial of Service Vulnerability may exhaust available memory, which could result in general system instability and cause the affected system to become unresponsive and stop forwarding traffic.  Cisco has released free software updates that address these vulnerabilities. Workarounds are available for some of the vulnerabilities. This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131009-asa  Note: The Cisco Firewall Services Module (FWSM) for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers may be affected by the SQL*Net Inspection Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability. A separate Cisco Security Advisory has been published to disclose the vulnerabilities that affect the Cisco FWSM. This advisory is available at: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131009-fwsm  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 5/4.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2013-5510 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Symptom:  Conditions:  Workaround:  Further Problem Description:
Description: When ;override-account-disable; is enabled in tunnel-group configuration, andthe account is locked in Acrive Directory, ASA accepts anyconnect VPN sessionfor that account with ANY password. I believe this option should allow ASA acceptlogin attempt of locked account only when provided password is valid.(If ASA allows login attempt with invalid password, this option can be severevalnerability)I can recrate the issue in TAC lab. Please refer attached debug of ASA andpacket capture gathered on AD. You can decrypt LDAPS using attached privatekey named ;20130501-20130501-w2k8addomain1localdcauthentication.key; which isbinded with the certificate AD uses for DC authentication.I did following 6 attempts.(1) valid password(2) invalid password 1(3) invalid password 2(4) invalid password 3(5) invalid password 4(6) valid passwordI configured my Domain Controller to lock the account by 3 invalid logon attempts.So, the account will be locked when I conduct 5th login attemps in above list.At 5th attempt(4th attempt with invalid credential), if ;override-account-disable;works as I expected, the login attemp should be rejected because credential isinvalid. But ASA accespted that attempt regardless of DC returned:[536] Simple authentication for domain1_user01 returned code (49) Invalid credentialsBut you can see same log in 6th attempt with valid password.This indicates that when account is locked on AD, ASA do not have a way to knowvalidity of provided credential.As my understanding, the expected behavior of this option is allow access withVALID credential even if its account is locked on AD. But as far as I see thedebug, there is no way to achieve this.I believe that we shoule remove this option from ASA or add warning to configurationguide of this option.

Title: Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE Session Initiation Protocol DoS Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) implementation in Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a reload of an affected device. To exploit this vulnerability, affected devices must be configured to process SIP messages. Limited Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE Software releases are affected.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability.  There are no workarounds for devices that must run SIP; however, mitigations are available to limit exposure to this vulnerability.  This advisory is available at the following link:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140326-sip  Note: The March 26, 2014, Cisco IOS Software Security Advisory bundled publication includes six Cisco Security Advisories. All advisories address vulnerabilities in Cisco IOS Software. Each Cisco IOS Software Security Advisory lists the Cisco IOS Software releases that correct the vulnerability or vulnerabilities detailed in the advisory as well as the Cisco IOS Software releases that correct all Cisco IOS Software vulnerabilities in the March 2014 bundled publication.  Individual publication links are in Cisco Event Response: Semiannual Cisco IOS Software Security Advisory Bundled Publication at the following link:  http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/intelligence/Cisco_ERP_mar14.html  Conditions: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Workaround: See published Cisco Security Advisory  Further Problem Description: PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 7.8/6.4:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2014-2106  has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL:  http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: WAAS / remote code execution vulnerability in httpmuxd
RNE: Symptom:  A vulnerability in Cisco Wide Area Application Services (WAAS) software versions 5.1.1 through 5.1.1d, when configured with the SharePoint acceleration feature, could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to exploit a buffer overflow and cause arbitrary code execution.  The vulnerability is due to incorrect buffer handling for SharePoint responses. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing a user to access a malicious SharePoint application. An exploit could allow the attacker to crash the application optimization handler and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the WAAS appliance.  Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability.   This advisory is available at the following link:  http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140521-waas  Conditions: Running a 5.1.1 version prior to 5.1.1e, with SharePoint pre-fetch optimization turned on.  Workaround: See advisory.  Further Problem Description: See advisory.  PSIRT Evaluation The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 9.3/7.7: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:C/I:C/A:C/E:F/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0  CVE ID CVE-2014-2196 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: httpmuxd process restarted and created core file with specific URL. Additional headers (simulated manually) would have caused restart in  httpmuxd process. Ran SharePoint specific URL test with additional headers in SP response (kind of malformed response) and within few minutes of starting the test, httpmuxd process restarted on Edge WAE.This problem is seen with Phoenix image (5.1.1-b16) as well.#5  <signal handler called>#6  0x55c80e99 in free () from /lib/libc.so.6#7  0x55c80dd6 in free () from /lib/libc.so.6#8  0x0805b37e in ao_http::WebMux::onStatsQueryFinalizeCB ()Impact:******Connection would get reset if a process is restarting.Setup:******Client---BR RTR---Unlimited BW/180ms/0.05%PL----DC RTR----Server                  |                                                                      |                7371                                                                7371Steps handled:*************- Had 7371s running with 5.2.0-b11.- Using Spirent, generated HTTP SharePoint traffic to exercise SP cache hit/miss.- Added dummy headers in server response with more than 1024 bytes. This would be sent back to request along with payload.Reproducibility factor:*****************2 out of 2Please find attached test info.Device info:**********2.75.3.36   ; admin/defaultI am unable to access 10.18.160.151 share. Hence copied core file and sysreport to 10.18.163.51 desktop ; administrator/watchThis File name: CSCue18479

Title: Input queue wedge due to RTCP packets
RNE: Symptom:  Cisco IOS Unified Border Element (CUBE) contains a vulnerability that could allow a remote attacker to cause a limited Denial of Service (DoS). Cisco IOS CUBE may be vulnerable to a limited Denial of Service (DoS) from the interface input queue wedge condition, while trying to process certain RTCP packets during media negotiation  using SIP.   Conditions:  Cisco IOS CUBE may experience an input queue wedge condition on an interface configured for media negotiation using SIP when certain sequence of RTCP packets is processed.  All the calls on the affected interface would be dropped.   Workaround:  Increase the interface input queue size. Disable Video if not necessary. PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 2 score. The Base and Temporal CVSS scores as of the time of evaluation are 4/3.1: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:P/E:POC/RL:OF/RC:C&version=2.0 CVE ID CVE-2012-5427 has been assigned to document this issue. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html  Further Problem Description:
Description: Call Flow+++++PSTN --- T1 PRI --- Ingress GW (NJ/SC) --- NJ-CUBE --- CVP --- CUCM -- IP Phones(1) Inbound call from Ingress gateway is routed to NJ-CUBE(2) NJ-CUBE routes the call to CVP(3) CVP contacts the ICM and sets up a call leg directly to VXML GW to provide IVR service(4) Once the agent is available, CVP sets up a call to CUCM(5) CVP sends a Re-invite to CUBE with audio and video m-lines in SDP(6) CUBE forwards this Re-invite to Ingress GW(7) Ingress GW sends 200 OK to the Re-invite with ;m=video 0; i.e. audio only call(8) Ingress GW continues to send RTCP packets for the video stream even though it is not negotiated(9) CUBE doesn't process these Video RTCP packets and they get stuck in input queue

Title: Cisco WAP150 Wireless with PoE Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
RNE: $$IGNORE-PSIRT  Symptom: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco WAP150 Wireless-AC/N Dual Radio Access  Point with PoE; and WAP361 Wireless-AC/N Dual Radio Wall Plate Access Point with PoE could allow an  unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the  web-based management interface of an affected device.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface of an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of  the interface to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary  script code in the context of the interface or allow the attacker to access sensitive browser-based  information.  Conditions: Device running with default configuration running an affected version of software. This is fixed as of  firmware version 1.1.0.7.  Workaround: None.   Further Problem Description: Additional information about XSS attacks and potential mitigations can be found at:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoAppliedMitigationBulletin/cisco-amb-20060922-understanding-xss https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. The Base CVSS score as of the time of evaluation is 6.1: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/cvssCalculator.x?version=3.0&vector=CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N/E:X/RL:X/RC:X  CVE ID CVE-2018-0098 has been assigned to document this issue.  Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html

Title: Cisco Nexus Series Switches CLI Command Injection Vulnerability
RNE: Symptom: A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS System Software running on Nexus Series Switches could allow an authenticated, local attacker to perform a command injection attack.  The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of command arguments. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting crafted command arguments into a vulnerable CLI command. An exploit could allow the attacker to read or write arbitrary files at the user's privilege level outside of the user's path.  Conditions: None  Workaround: None  Further Problem Description: For information about vulnerable and not vulnerable software releases, and time frame for fixed software releases, please open a support case with your support organization. PSIRT does not provide or maintain this information for Medium SIR advisories.  PSIRT Evaluation: The Cisco PSIRT has assigned this bug the following CVSS version 3 score. Additional information on Cisco's security vulnerability policy can be found at the following URL: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_vulnerability_policy.html
Description: The ;ssh; command in the local-mgmt shell allows users to manipulate argumentspassed to ssh on the command line. This could allow users to read and write arbitrary files on the system (with the privileges of the logged-in user) by connecting to an attacker-controlled ssh server.For example:Writing arbitrary files:  ssh josconno@10.1.1.100>/tmp/fileThis example is not intended to be exhaustive.To fix these issues, all user input, and especially arguments to shell commands,should be validated to ensure they meet the expected format, preferably with a whitelist. In this case that means validating that the hostname argument specifies a valid hostname.
